reviewnospace: You probably won't see much more incredible architecture. It is a photographers delight. Walk and enjoy.
titleopinion: Spectacular. You probably won't see much more incredible architecture. It is a photographers delight. Walk and enjoy.

reviewnospace: We visited this area twice-via bus tour then walking. The buildings are quite unique and are a contrast to the old architecture in the city center. We did visit the Oceanographic but did not have time to go inside the others. A photographers dreamscape.
titleopinion: Extraordinary architecture. We visited this area twice-via bus tour then walking. The buildings are quite unique and are a contrast to the old architecture in the city center. We did visit the Oceanographic but did not have time to go inside the others. A photographers dreamscape.

reviewnospace: can't go to Valencia without visiting this great piece of architecture. very impressive. we didn't go inside. but just strolled around from the top and underneath. we took our time. already impressive. a nice sunny day helped to make it even more pleasant.

quote: Perfect place to spend several hours !
reviewnospace: Stunning architecture. Absolutely perfect when the weather is pleasant. Lots of activities for children, families as well as solo travellers. I enjoyed the Science Museum (It is prohibited to not touch - what a fantastic motto!) and the Oceanographic. Both require atleast 3 hours each so you can spend a LOT of time here :)
titleopinion: Perfect place to spend several hours !. Stunning architecture. Absolutely perfect when the weather is pleasant. Lots of activities for children, families as well as solo travellers. I enjoyed the Science Museum (It is prohibited to not touch - what a fantastic motto!) and the Oceanographic. Both require atleast 3 hours each so you can spend a LOT of time here :)

reviewnospace:
The City of Arts and Sciences is an amazing spectacle of modern architecture and had been on my bucket list for a long while!

It is unlike anything else I've seen during my travels in Europe. It is free to walk around and take in the sights. It is easily accessible via bus number 95 which goes all around the Turia Park. The City of Art and Sciences is hands down, the number one attraction to visit in Valencia.
titleopinion:
Number 1 attraction in Valencia. The City of Arts and Sciences is an amazing spectacle of modern architecture and had been on my bucket list for a long while!

It is unlike anything else I've seen during my travels in Europe. It is free to walk around and take in the sights. It is easily accessible via bus number 95 which goes all around the Turia Park. The City of Art and Sciences is hands down, the number one attraction to visit in Valencia.

reviewnospace: The picture says it all. Wonderfull architecture to behold in the beautifull setting right next to Turia.
titleopinion: Awesome sight. The picture says it all. Wonderfull architecture to behold in the beautifull setting right next to Turia.

reviewnospace: This place resembles Sci-Fi movies (not to mention many were filmed here). It is unique and well worth visiting. If you are on a budget make sure to at least have a walk around the area (it's free) that is plenty to enjoy the uniqueness of it.
titleopinion: Refreshing when visiting Europe. This place resembles Sci-Fi movies (not to mention many were filmed here). It is unique and well worth visiting. If you are on a budget make sure to at least have a walk around the area (it's free) that is plenty to enjoy the uniqueness of it.

reviewnospace: I'm not normally a great fan of modern architecture but this is something else. Luckily we visited on a sunny day so we saw the way that the water complemented the design of the buildings. Really a great photo opportunity.

reviewnospace:
I walked the old dry river bed from north of the city to here during the Fallas Festival. It was a nice walk with cyclists mainly staying to their allocated paths. The bridges end route are spectacular and it's well worth the walk.

Once at the actual sight, there's lots to see and do. The architecture alone is worth a look. Very clean and well worth a visit.
titleopinion:

Once at the actual sight, there's lots to see and do. The architecture alone is worth a look. Very clean and well worth a visit.

Save your money, and just walk thru the building to look at the architecture. That's the only exiting part, and it's free.

reviewnospace:
This is absolutely the number one thing to see in Valencia.
Even without visiting the inside, just being in this place makes you feel like you are visiting another planet. The views are very similar to the futuristic cities you see in the movies.
Also, you can visit the museum exhibits, the aquarium, and see an IMAX projection in the Hemisferic, which are all worth a visit.
The one thing that bothered me, is that it is not well connected to the city by metro, because i always prefer to use it, but the bus lines are running very close by. Also you can get to the City by a walk through the beautiful "river" park.

reviewnospace: Very modern buildings and surroundings. After old part of the city this is the second most attractive part. Worth a visit. I am not sure about the opera house and Agora, but the Science museum (and Oceanografic) is open to visitors. Easily accesible by bus or a walk from city centre.

I am not sure about the opera house and Agora, but the Science museum (and Oceanografic) is open to visitors. Easily accesible by bus or a walk from city centre.

reviewnospace: The aesthetically stunning City of Arts & Sciences occupies a massive 350,000-sq-metre swath of the old Turia riverbed.It is a place you should not fail to visit. It is a memorable experience that you will carry for many years. Children will have the time of their life in this place. Make sure you carve a whole day for it as it takes time to see and appreciate everything and even after a whole day you leave feeling you must have missed out on something. There are animals, an astronomy centre, the Principe Felipe science museum, the Hemisferic, etc.....not to be missed.
titleopinion: Top notch experience. The aesthetically stunning City of Arts & Sciences occupies a massive 350,000-sq-metre swath of the old Turia riverbed.It is a place you should not fail to visit. It is a memorable experience that you will carry for many years. Children will have the time of their life in this place. Make sure you carve a whole day for it as it takes time to see and appreciate everything and even after a whole day you leave feeling you must have missed out on something. There are animals, an astronomy centre, the Principe Felipe science museum, the Hemisferic, etc.....not to be missed.

reviewnospace:
Oh my god !! This place is so huge and so nicely structured. It is one of the beautiful buildings that i have seen in my life. Initially when i saw it from far i was like, Ok this place might be good then when i was nearing i started to realise that this place is very huge. Its a must see tourist attraction guys do not miss out on this.
Now talking about the science exhibition, it was really fun going inside you will almost recall all your school memories back if you have been performing those experiments in the class room time. My physics subject just got revised over here. Apart from that there were lot of other things like Fossil world wherein you will discover the Dinosaur era and its importance and history will be explained to you.
The space is huge so you will need to walk a lot over here. You can click loads of photographs at this place because the buildings itself are so beautiful and the whole space is scenic in itself. According to me its the best attraction in the whole of Valencia.

reviewnospace: Magnificent, beautiful architecture great for photos and strolling on a sunny day. However as you walk around it you can notice the lack of maintenance it has. There are also some spaces that haven't been used and it is sad to see the waste.

reviewnospace:
You have to see it to believe it! Noted architect, Calatrava, was born in Valencia and has created a most spectacular complex of buildings and gardens at the edge of the park at the point where the sea meets the land. Visually, a masterpiece! No photo could do this project justice. The city maintains the facility beautifully - no small task.
If you visit only one sight in Valencia this should be your choice!

reviewnospace:
This area was amazing. We'd never heard or read anything about it. Then once we saw it we spent a few hours down here checking it all out. There wasn't many people around either which was good. There was a live band playing on the water so we kicked back with a couple of beers and watched them.
Definitely worth a visit.

quote: Quite boring museum, with outdated or non-working demonstrations
reviewnospace:
Please note that this review is only about the museum, not the whole architectural complex. The architecture complex itself is 'must see' in Valencia.
But the museum itself looks a bit outdated. A lot of demonstrations simply don't work anymore, and those which work explain some principles of simple physics, which children can see nowadays at their schools.
Museum is organised in a quite confusing way. For example, there is a space shuttle simulator requiring a separate ticket. However the ticket is available only at the building's entrance while the simulator is located at the 2nd floor. And the online ticket service was not working. So even if someone discovers a possibility of this simulation during the visit, he or she has to spend extra time to get the ticket.
I wouldn't recommend this museum. Just stay outside and enjoy the beauty of the 21st century architecture.
titleopinion:

reviewnospace: The place has a 'futuristic' look, is huge and one day is not enough to see all the attractions on offer. We visited the Oceanographic site, a great collection of marine life and enjoyed the dolphin show. We also saw a 3D documentary at the Hemispheric site. You can't visit Valencia and not visit this 'city'.
titleopinion: A Day is not Enough!. The place has a 'futuristic' look, is huge and one day is not enough to see all the attractions on offer. We visited the Oceanographic site, a great collection of marine life and enjoyed the dolphin show. We also saw a 3D documentary at the Hemispheric site. You can't visit Valencia and not visit this 'city'.

reviewnospace: Visited the planetarium (the Hemispheric) and saw the movie America Wild. Great movie about the national parks in the US. Some cool mountain shoots of World famous Mountaineer Conrad Anker. Robert Redford as the narrator. Possible to hear in different languages. Cost about 9 Euros for 50 min. Would say that it was worth it. But if you want to see all the museums and the Oceanographic it will cost you lots and lots of money! Especially the Oceanographic is ridiculously expensive (29 Euros!) If you want to see several of the attractions you need to start early in the day. Both the ocenographics and the museums takes 3 hours each!

quote: A must see during any Valencia trip.
reviewnospace: This place is absolutely stunning and is free so should be on everyone's list of sites to see during their stay in Valencia. The architecture on display is wonderful, there are sculptures on the higher walkway as well as some very cool structures that teach you a little bit about the sun, shadows, time and distance. I visited during the day and at night and there is just a wonderful feeling here. The only thing I would say is it's a little confusing walking all the around at night as some parts aren't lit very well so take care.

quote: First sight of this complex is jaw-dropping - amazing architecture and beautiful surrounds
reviewnospace: Well worth a visit. The hemisphere does 3 d presentations with headsets which you can set for your language. The science museum, contrary to some of the reports I had read on here, is mainly translated (apart from really boring temporary exhibit on floor 2!!) . For just 2.5 euros you can "visit" the space station, go in a rocket (simulator) and land in space and return!! On the day we visited, we easily spent hours of entertainment in there (ages 11-50!) - plenty of interactive exhibits, and best of all about a tenth as crowded/squashed/busy as the London Science museum!!

For just 2.5 euros you can "visit" the space station, go in a rocket (simulator) and land in space and return!! On the day we visited, we easily spent hours of entertainment in there (ages 11-50!) - plenty of interactive exhibits, and best of all about a tenth as crowded/squashed/busy as the London Science museum!!

titleopinion: Must see in the city of Valencia!. This fantastic collection of Calatrava works each housing a different museum or gallery. I admit that I was more interested in the architecture of the buildings than its contents. If you love Calatrava, you need to visit this place!

reviewnospace: An impressive gathering of fun facts and things to do. Could be slightly more international. Some things are not completely translated. The building itself and surrounding park are a must. Best done with families!
titleopinion: Impressive. An impressive gathering of fun facts and things to do. Could be slightly more international. Some things are not completely translated. The building itself and surrounding park are a must. Best done with families!

reviewnospace: Amazing buildings. At the time we were there, there was a car commercial being shot, so I was asked not to photograph that particular building. It wasn't floodlit the evening we were there too. So all in all not essential viewing for us tourists.
titleopinion: Great architecture but that's all. Amazing buildings. At the time we were there, there was a car commercial being shot, so I was asked not to photograph that particular building. It wasn't floodlit the evening we were there too. So all in all not essential viewing for us tourists.

reviewnospace: This is an amazing space with the most fantastic architecture. Don't stay on the tour bus get off and walk. A truly inspirational world space
titleopinion: Guaw . This is an amazing space with the most fantastic architecture. Don't stay on the tour bus get off and walk. A truly inspirational world space

quote: A nice walking in the City of the Arts and Science
reviewnospace: It is really a breathless place! The various buildings are remarkable together with the surroundings: several pools, gardens and promenades. No matter whether you will visit the museum, the cinema or the auditorium: walking around and watching the site is already worth it!
titleopinion: A nice walking in the City of the Arts and Science. It is really a breathless place! The various buildings are remarkable together with the surroundings: several pools, gardens and promenades. No matter whether you will visit the museum, the cinema or the auditorium: walking around and watching the site is already worth it!

quote: You can not imagine what you can find there! Everything is above your imagination.
reviewnospace: Excellent, Scientific and applied. Art and science together. History and future of art sand science... and most of all Tesla genius ...
titleopinion: You can not imagine what you can find there! Everything is above your imagination.. Excellent, Scientific and applied. Art and science together. History and future of art sand science... and most of all Tesla genius ...

reviewnospace: Valencia, through the genius and very particular style of the architect Santiago Calatrava, knew how to take advantage of what was once a discharged area, but neighboring the historic area, in a very interesting architectural and cultural complex, creating a visually attractive space, but filled with very attractive proposals . Its vast areas of water mirrors make summer visits more appealing because, despite the marked warmth in that region, they provide beautiful cool moments during a walk.
titleopinion: Exceptional. Valencia, through the genius and very particular style of the architect Santiago Calatrava, knew how to take advantage of what was once a discharged area, but neighboring the historic area, in a very interesting architectural and cultural complex, creating a visually attractive space, but filled with very attractive proposals . Its vast areas of water mirrors make summer visits more appealing because, despite the marked warmth in that region, they provide beautiful cool moments during a walk.

reviewnospace: This building is near the Aquarium in Valencia and the architecture is magnificent. Located in the center of Valencia it is a must see.
titleopinion: Beautiful building, great for photos. This building is near the Aquarium in Valencia and the architecture is magnificent. Located in the center of Valencia it is a must see.

reviewnospace: this city is well organised, beautiful architecture in a park on the old river , view is amazing, relaxing

reviewnospace: Definately worth a visit. Such a shame that the Science Museum appears to be under resourced. It area feels as if it was going places and then suddenly stopped with the fincial crisis. But that does not deter from the actual buidngs. Also you begin your walk near here via the former river bed, now a park, stretching through the city. Important advice to visiting Brits. If like me, you get withdrawl symptons if you dont have your daily cup of tea, ask for "black tea with cold milk on the side" You may get some odd looks but its the only way. :-)

The architecture itself is amazing and very much worth a "must stop " while in Valencia.

reviewnospace:
Truly an amazing place to visit. An architectural marvel, even if there are certain bits of it that already show rust and some of the paint came of.

It's beautiful for a walk or even a run if that's your kind of thing, even if you don't go inside each building. Visiting the museums is highly recommended. It's surrounded by beautiful gardens and parks. I visited it during winter and it was a bit chilly and windy, but I imagine that the views and the weather in summer are much better.
titleopinion:
Recommend it for a walk. Truly an amazing place to visit. An architectural marvel, even if there are certain bits of it that already show rust and some of the paint came of.

It's beautiful for a walk or even a run if that's your kind of thing, even if you don't go inside each building. Visiting the museums is highly recommended. It's surrounded by beautiful gardens and parks. I visited it during winter and it was a bit chilly and windy, but I imagine that the views and the weather in summer are much better.

reviewnospace: I was completely overwhelmed with the architecture and look of this place but completely underwhelmed with the contents. Sure it was clean, roomy, bright and informative but for me, overall, just not enough to press, pull, push or squeeze. The science museum in London is way better if you are looking for tactile. Having said that, the London Science Museum is quite a way from Valencia - so if you want a science museum in Valencia, this is your only choice. On t'uther hand, the imax cinema was fantastic. There's not a huge choice of films for this kind of auditorium but it really is a must see. We ate on site and thought it was above average, but no better.
titleopinion: City of Arts and Sciences. I was completely overwhelmed with the architecture and look of this place but completely underwhelmed with the contents. Having said that, the London Science Museum is quite a way from Valencia - so if you want a science museum in Valencia, this is your only choice. On t'uther hand, the imax cinema was fantastic. There's not a huge choice of films for this kind of auditorium but it really is a must see. We ate on site and thought it was above average, but no better.

reviewnospace:
The City of Art and Sciences in Valencia is a huge complex (definitely the top landmark of the city), consisting of Oceanographic (the biggest aquarium in Europe), The Science Museum, The Arts Hall, The Hemisphere (IMAX movie theater and planetarium), a bridge, a sports hall and a covered garder - all designed by Santiago Calatrava.

Oceanographic is a must see and requires at least 3-4 hours or more to visit and see in detail, combined tickets for it together with the Science Museum and The Hemisphere are usually a good bargain - and these all deserve some of your time.

Sunsets and nights there a quite beautiful and if you like taking pictures, you would want to wait for the dark too.
titleopinion:
Worth spending a whole day. The City of Art and Sciences in Valencia is a huge complex (definitely the top landmark of the city), consisting of Oceanographic (the biggest aquarium in Europe), The Science Museum, The Arts Hall, The Hemisphere (IMAX movie theater and planetarium), a bridge, a sports hall and a covered garder - all designed by Santiago Calatrava.

Oceanographic is a must see and requires at least 3-4 hours or more to visit and see in detail, combined tickets for it together with the Science Museum and The Hemisphere are usually a good bargain - and these all deserve some of your time.

Sunsets and nights there a quite beautiful and if you like taking pictures, you would want to wait for the dark too.

quote: Want a different experience? This is it
reviewnospace:
The architecture of the Calatrava buildings in this complex is simply stunning and I keep on finding more and more details to admire every time I take a walk around, having the pleasure to live in Valencia now.
The Hemisferic is showing short movies in an Imax type of cinema, and the Science Museum is a whole day experience, especially with kids.
At night, there are lights to make the buildings complete artworks, and of course, their image is reflected in the water! Amazing!

quote: Space arhitecture but on ground level

titleopinion: Space arhitecture but on ground level. The architecture is amaizing and all has been built before 2001. Very nices spaces must see inside out !

reviewnospace:
This whole development is in sharp contrast to the old city and the juxtaposition is fascinating!

Loved walking down the Turia and see it emerge little by little as we approached and saw the perspectives, curves and reflections change with each step.

Went back twice at other times of the day and it was just as amazing to see the second and third time round.

Bought an entrance ticket to the Science museum to see the building from inside. Many interactive displays, dinosaurs and other artefacts but I was most impressed by the architecture. It seemed way too big for the museum it contained, as if they built the building and did not have many ideas about what to put inside.

Tip: If you do not want to pay to get inside any of these buildings and need a toilet break, the parking lot underneath the Umbracle (rows of palm trees) has very clean bathrooms, you just need to find them on the floor maps. Same for the parking lot at Oceanographic.

reviewnospace:
We went to the museam to get a better feeling for the main building and to see the exabition about Tesla.

All the information was only in spanish so did not allow us to understand the exibition at all.

The other exabitions were more space fillers than of any real artistic or historical interest -space fillers.

The building deserves more and as a tourist attraction the museam does not offer any real attraction.

reviewnospace: Exhibits are excellent - interact with some of the exhibits - the history - a great day for us - nice stroll from central Valencia to get there
titleopinion: Excellent for browsing and interaction. Exhibits are excellent - interact with some of the exhibits - the history - a great day for us - nice stroll from central Valencia to get there

reviewnospace: This place is other thing! The architecture is amazing! it is a MUST is you go to Valencia! It has a museum, and aquarium and a place where you are able to watch some 3D movies.
titleopinion: Mind Blowing. This place is other thing! The architecture is amazing! it is a MUST is you go to Valencia! It has a museum, and aquarium and a place where you are able to watch some 3D movies.

reviewnospace:
it is the triumph of form over content.

Visiting the complex is expensive at I think 37 euros per person. You do get a discount to 31 euros per person if you have the Valencia tourist card.

On arrival we were overawed with the stunning architecture of the whole complex it is like nothing that my wife and I had seen before and the scale of the buildings is big.

Once you have got over the architecture and try to explore a little further is when the let downs start to come.

The theatre building is closed to the public (except for performances) so there is no possibility of visiting inside or walking round the upper levels which would have given superb views. You are limited to making the most of the ground level.

The Hemispheric again is visually impressive. Inside there is a huge I-max cinema with an 80 foot screen. This is bigger than you can perceive with the human eye so you may feel a bit disconcerted by it as images move on the screen. Having said that we enjoyed the 45 minute film about robots. In fact we the only people in the whole cinema (another weird experience). The films change depending on the time of day you are visiting.

The science museum was frankly a let down. Again a stunning building but inside the collections are trying to do too many things and end up doing none of them well. My favourite was the space section in which there is a small theatre which shows earth and space images in a kaleidoscope effect. Definitely worth chilling out with this for 10-15 minutes. The outside balconies which again would have provided great views were closed off and for emergency exit only - why?

The Umbracle was partially closed when we visited but it was January so I'll forgive for that not looking at its best but still pleasant to walk through.

The last building in the complex is a large blue shell and that is what it is there is nothing in it so all you can do is walk round it.

The road bridge is quite something and it's possible to walk across the middle of it to get some nice pictures.

I'll leave a review of Oceanagrafic separately as it warrants it.

For the photographers you'll need your widest lens and a polarising filter to get the best from the architecture.

Overall disappointed with the content and access especially at the price charged.

reviewnospace: We went to the Sciences Museum, which contained quite a lot of very interesting exhibits in many many fields. In one of them we could actually see chicks hatch from their eggs. In others, various characteristics of the human body were highlighted through experiments. Definitely worth a few hours. We skipped the oceanographic Museum as it is very pricey (28 euros !)

reviewnospace: Great visit for at least a day. We were lucky enough to get a phenomenal weather, which only emphasized the beauty of Calatrava's genius designs. A must-see in Valencia for sure (and photographer's heaven)!
titleopinion: Must-see. Great visit for at least a day. We were lucky enough to get a phenomenal weather, which only emphasized the beauty of Calatrava's genius designs. A must-see in Valencia for sure (and photographer's heaven)!

reviewnospace: Valencia has been a surprisingly interesting city to visit. We visited the Science Museum for the afternoon. The architecture is impressive of the entire campus in this area. We enjoyed our afternoon in the science museum with three children ages 12, 8 and 4. We have been around the world visiting science museums and this is a good quality museum. We were not able to get through the entire science museum in the afternoon as our kids really like to take their time but we all would love to go back for more.

We have been around the world visiting science museums and this is a good quality museum. We were not able to get through the entire science museum in the afternoon as our kids really like to take their time but we all would love to go back for more.

reviewnospace: Unless you hate architecture do not miss this place. You can walk/cycle here along the old river bed or you can catch the bus. It is a masterpiece of engineering and a photographer's dream. Do your research before you go and allow plenty of time if you want to visit all of it. Take sunglasses, a polarising filter for the camera and be prepared to be overwhelmed by the scale of Calatrava's extravaganza.

quote: Totally worth the price, interesting, thrilling, futuristic
reviewnospace: Avant garde architecture, futuristic, way ahead... Those are the words that come to your mind when you enter this place. It is a formidable mixup of modern science, zoo, tourist attractions, IMAX panoramic cinema. Spend the day there and you'll have trouble even describing what you saw. Dolphin show recommended for the whole family. All in all the whole place is a must see in Valencia.

reviewnospace:
At any given time of day (in August) this place has its own feel to it. During day the contrast of white buildings and blue water gives it futuristic feel. In the night when everything is lit it feels a bit like being surrounded by alien spaceships!
Walking around is unusual for sure, would recommend it. Sadly, only aquarium and museum are easily accessible as the Agora stands currently empty, the Hemispheric and opera are not that interesting unless you are into this kind of thing.
A very interesting experience is to have two people stand on each end of the arch in front of the museum of science entrance. Even with so much distance between and noise made by passers, you can hear one another like even whispering! Almost like having a private phone call :)
Will be back again!
titleopinion:
Interesting for a walk around. At any given time of day (in August) this place has its own feel to it. During day the contrast of white buildings and blue water gives it futuristic feel. In the night when everything is lit it feels a bit like being surrounded by alien spaceships!
Walking around is unusual for sure, would recommend it. Sadly, only aquarium and museum are easily accessible as the Agora stands currently empty, the Hemispheric and opera are not that interesting unless you are into this kind of thing.
A very interesting experience is to have two people stand on each end of the arch in front of the museum of science entrance. Even with so much distance between and noise made by passers, you can hear one another like even whispering! Almost like having a private phone call :)
Will be back again!

quote: Impressive to look at but soulless inoperation
reviewnospace: We anticipated so much visiting this place. After all isn't this the one thing that revitalised the whole city? First impression did not disappoint. The vistas are magnificent with the opera house looking like an albino orca leaping out of the sea, although the palm trees on the higher level looked a bit out of place. On approaching the building itself though we found it very unwelcoming. There is no entrance at all where we thought there might be, only a nondescript white door leading to a nondescript box office. There is no access to the public area unless you book a guided tour. There looks like a restaurant at the wider end by the water but our experience just put us off trying to find out. That's the overall feel of the entire complex - you have to walk great distances from one building to another to find there's no payoff at the end of it. Likewise the hemisphere, you can only enter into the totally drab lower level to the cafe or get a ticket to see an imax film you could see anywhere in the world. The science museum seems totally geared towards attracting children which put us off paying the 8 euros to get in, and the entrances are only at each end hundreds of metres apart. The building itself is looking a bit run down too. The agora looked tall and impressive until you get there and find the doors are barely kept closed with chains and padlocks. Seems like the management is missing a trick which reminded me of the south bank centre in the seventies. There's just nothing going on during the day and it's totally sterile. Compare that with South Bank Centre now which is bustling with life day and night since they open their doors not just for the events and throw everyone out afterwards. The cafes inside and behind the museum were completely empty since most people probably just go in the building to use the loos. We didn't even bother getting to the aquarium after that, never mind the 30€ it costs to get in. The place looks futuristic for now but nothing dates faster than vision of the future. I hope they bring some life to the complex before it turns into a white elephant. We went back to the old town afterwards and found there were loads of hidden museums that are free to visit. Way more fun.

There is no access to the public area unless you book a guided tour. There looks like a restaurant at the wider end by the water but our experience just put us off trying to find out. That's the overall feel of the entire complex - you have to walk great distances from one building to another to find there's no payoff at the end of it. Likewise the hemisphere, you can only enter into the totally drab lower level to the cafe or get a ticket to see an imax film you could see anywhere in the world. The science museum seems totally geared towards attracting children which put us off paying the 8 euros to get in, and the entrances are only at each end hundreds of metres apart. The building itself is looking a bit run down too. The agora looked tall and impressive until you get there and find the doors are barely kept closed with chains and padlocks. Seems like the management is missing a trick which reminded me of the south bank centre in the seventies. There's just nothing going on during the day and it's totally sterile. Compare that with South Bank Centre now which is bustling with life day and night since they open their doors not just for the events and throw everyone out afterwards. The cafes inside and behind the museum were completely empty since most people probably just go in the building to use the loos. We didn't even bother getting to the aquarium after that, never mind the 30€ it costs to get in. The place looks futuristic for now but nothing dates faster than vision of the future. I hope they bring some life to the complex before it turns into a white elephant. We went back to the old town afterwards and found there were loads of hidden museums that are free to visit. Way more fun.

reviewnospace: The whole area is designed by Santiago Calatrava. The buildings look like alien space ships. Together with the mirroring in the artificial lakes it is the most outstanding futuristic architecture I have ever seen. A must if you visit Valencia.
titleopinion: Futuristic ensemble in Valencia. The whole area is designed by Santiago Calatrava. The buildings look like alien space ships. Together with the mirroring in the artificial lakes it is the most outstanding futuristic architecture I have ever seen. A must if you visit Valencia.

quote: Impressive Opera Building, like few in Europe if any
reviewnospace: Lovely place to go for a walk on a sunday afternoon. We decided to book an opera evening with dinner afterwards - the Palace of Arts is one unique opera concert hall, one of the most impressive in Europe. The whole complex inspires serenity and awe, the perfect harmony of the shapes, fantastic from every angle. Great architecture -Calatrava at hos best. Don't miss it. The minus point for me was the proximity to access highways into Valencia on one side that spoil a bit an otherwise peaceful and serene oasis. Still a Must See.

Don't forget to check out the park around the complex that goes on through the entire city of Valencia.

quote: the best is on the outside
reviewnospace:
I've visited this location twice and definitely what I like the most is the architecture and the exterior look. It is an absolutely amazing construction that stirs up your imagination. Just walking around the different buildings is well worth visiting and there's surely something going on in the street to see as well. Plan at least one and a half hours if you just go for a walk. This is free.
However, if you want to see the different shows, you need two days minimum.

1.-The oceanarium needs 3 hours if you go fast and don't take the audioguide. You'll see sharks, walrus, dolphins, sea lions and exotic fish...If this is the first oceanarium you'll see, you'll have a great time...But in my case, after seeing the one in Lisbon and in Chicago as well as other smaller ones, I wasn't really that surprised.
All in all, I enjoyed myself a lot and this was the building I recommend the most if you need to choose.

2.- The Principe Felipe Museum needs more than 3 hours. I spent 2 and a half and I could only see one floor and in a rush. It has interactive exhibitions that make the experience very amusing. I was fascinated by the Tesla exhibition and I liked the dinosaurs and the DNA show, too.

3.- The Hemispheric is not worth visiting at all, in my opinion. The film I saw (The US national parks) seemed burnt and didn't have high quality. It is not comfortable to try to watch all the details of the screen, as your sight doesn't really cover it all. It is not a better experience than the big screens we have in our cinemas nowadays. Besides, the headphones that they give you at the entrance didn't work properly.

If you go with children, then this is a place where they'll have a blast!

So if you like that kind of thing and willing to really 'go with it' it is worth the extra couple of euro.

Also there is a science museum that takes half a day to visit and enjoy and here you should definetly not miss the tesla and space simulator it is amazing. I wasn' particulary impressed by the planetarium all we could do was watch a movie but in a more inconfortable position than in a cinema

quote: Futuristic and creative use of the old riverbed.
reviewnospace: Built on reclaimed land, this very modern attraction is very worth visiting. Comprising the Palace of the Arts, with its four theatres/concert halls, an IMAX cinema known as L'Hemisferic, a very large Science Museum and an Aquarium, it is possible to experience the imaginative architecture without paying to actually enter the contents of the venues.

Very interstting buildings with lots of steel arches, impresive architecture.

The Science Museum will be very interesting for kids.
titleopinion:
Interesting design....a must see in Valencia. Very interstting buildings with lots of steel arches, impresive architecture.
If you;ve seen the Loro Parque in Tenerife, the aquarium will not be a surprise for you. I might say that the one in Tenerife is much nicer.
The Science Museum will be very interesting for kids.

quote: Brilliant Designs - Visit and be thankful you don't have to maintain them
reviewnospace: Architect Calatrava's creations along the old riverbed in Valencia are fantastical. They could be space ships from an extra-terrestrial tour group that just stopped by to sample some of the outstanding restaurants of the city. Practicality is another matter. These are not "form follows function" but rather "form follows wild imagination" whether truly functional or not. They are stunning to see but must be nightmares to maintain. In fact, the public plaza that connects them shows obvious signs of deterioration as do the buildings themselves. They are remarkable examples of architectural design and engineering skill, but I am certainly glad that I don't have to figure out how to generate the funds to maintain them.
titleopinion: Brilliant Designs - Visit and be thankful you don't have to maintain them. Architect Calatrava's creations along the old riverbed in Valencia are fantastical. They could be space ships from an extra-terrestrial tour group that just stopped by to sample some of the outstanding restaurants of the city. Practicality is another matter. These are not "form follows function" but rather "form follows wild imagination" whether truly functional or not. They are stunning to see but must be nightmares to maintain. In fact, the public plaza that connects them shows obvious signs of deterioration as do the buildings themselves. They are remarkable examples of architectural design and engineering skill, but I am certainly glad that I don't have to figure out how to generate the funds to maintain them.

reviewnospace: Very impressive buildings which complement each other. Looks wonderful in the sunshine. Worth seeing.
titleopinion: Wonderful architecture. Very impressive buildings which complement each other. Looks wonderful in the sunshine. Worth seeing.

reviewnospace: Firstly we would have liked to spend longer here as it had interesting stuff for all ages.As it was we visited primarily for the space experience and to get some photos for a dinosaur mad grandaughter.We were out of season,but were amazed to be given a time slot in English for just four of us. Ask for your tickets at the ticket office as you pay your entrance fee.It is only 2.5e extra and so worth it.

Ask for your tickets at the ticket office as you pay your entrance fee.It is only 2.5e extra and so worth it.

reviewnospace: Worth visiting but better to get a joined two days ticket with Oceanographic, separately costs too much to my view. Nice exhibitions. Great idea of Gene forest with different things to try and fantastic exhibition on Nicola Tesla. A lot of things to learn but with only so much to take when on holidays prepare to spend half a day there and your head will be spinning with information. Interesting view in the room showing space pictures as if you are on the orbit.

reviewnospace: Must see when in Valencia. The contrast with the (beautiful) old city is huge. Walk around and admire the different buildings.
titleopinion: Must see. Must see when in Valencia. The contrast with the (beautiful) old city is huge. Walk around and admire the different buildings.

reviewnospace: About a third of the exhibits were not working and many others were pretty feeble. Perhaps the children's bits were better but it was a waste of time for 4 adults. Glad we bought a joint ticket with the Oceanografic which meant we paid less than €2 each as paying full price would have added insult to injury. Maybe they had let maintenance slide whilst the marathons were on. Beautiful buildings though.
titleopinion: Waste of time.. About a third of the exhibits were not working and many others were pretty feeble. Perhaps the children's bits were better but it was a waste of time for 4 adults. Glad we bought a joint ticket with the Oceanografic which meant we paid less than €2 each as paying full price would have added insult to injury. Maybe they had let maintenance slide whilst the marathons were on. Beautiful buildings though.

quote: Very enjoyable and good for the mind!
reviewnospace:
Spent a good 5 hours at the museum. We had paid admission through our 72hour tourist card. Lots of very interesting exhibits, especially dinosaurs which children would enjoy. Many of the exhibits were interactive which increased the level of interest.
The museum is well laid out and well lit. The children's play area was very noisy but they were having a great time!

Fantastic building so the architecture is worth a visit alone and you can go inside to view and use cafe etc and there is no charge for entry.
titleopinion:

reviewnospace: It's hard to believe this area of Valencia even exists when you have so many gorgeous old-style buildings not far away but that's Valencia, a true mix of old and new. Personally, I love the Old Town more with its beautiful architecture and funky neighbourhoods, but the City of the Arts and Sciences has to be seen to be believed, especially if you're any fan of modern architecture. It's a truly remarkable part of any city.
titleopinion: Unique and fascinating. It's hard to believe this area of Valencia even exists when you have so many gorgeous old-style buildings not far away but that's Valencia, a true mix of old and new. Personally, I love the Old Town more with its beautiful architecture and funky neighbourhoods, but the City of the Arts and Sciences has to be seen to be believed, especially if you're any fan of modern architecture. It's a truly remarkable part of any city.

quote: A nice place to visit and enjoy.
reviewnospace: Modern architecture at it's finest, a very impressive range of seven buildings set in lovely gardens. Marvellous until one remembers what it cost (over 1 billion euros), how it bankrupted Valencia, that the architect charged 100 million euros and then it started falling to pieces. The science museum has a few good exhibits and demonstrations though nothing too extensive, a couple of hours is all that needs.
titleopinion: A nice place to visit and enjoy.. Modern architecture at it's finest, a very impressive range of seven buildings set in lovely gardens. Marvellous until one remembers what it cost (over 1 billion euros), how it bankrupted Valencia, that the architect charged 100 million euros and then it started falling to pieces. The science museum has a few good exhibits and demonstrations though nothing too extensive, a couple of hours is all that needs.

reviewnospace: This place restores your faith in the architectural brilliance that humans are capable of. It looks like the set of some beautiful futuristic (think Star Wars) city. The harmony of elegant buildings with the surrounding water and manicured gardens is awe inspiring. A must see attraction in this gem of a city!
titleopinion: Unique architecture and beauty. This place restores your faith in the architectural brilliance that humans are capable of. It looks like the set of some beautiful futuristic (think Star Wars) city. The harmony of elegant buildings with the surrounding water and manicured gardens is awe inspiring. A must see attraction in this gem of a city!

reviewnospace:
Me and my boyfriend bought combined tickets for the City if Art and Science as described in all city guides, this is a Must visit spot. The first day we used it for the Oceanographic museum which was great, especially the dolphins part and the second day we decided to visit the Science museum and the Hemispheric which both were total waste of time and money. Total desorganization in the museum. We wondered around to find where the escalators for the 3rd floor are. A marathon's expo was also taking place there so it was a mess. Then the exhibition was poor. It is for kids mainly. We weren't impressed at all. Nothing worth to see. Then we decided to visit the Hemispheric where we lost 30 min.trying to enter. There were no visible signs and of course, as everywhere in Valensia which left me shocked..no one speaks English. However, when we found the entrance it turned out that Hemispheric was not included despite we paid about 38 euro per person.
I would definately recommend visiting the Oceanographic museum only. None of te other things worths.

reviewnospace: Went up to Valencia with my son and his friend to this amazing place,lots of hands on that kept the children very interested spent around 6 hours inside with plenty to do also you can buy extra tickets for different things inside which I would advise doing at reception instead of having to go back out to get them once back outside to the small train on a ride around old river bed you can get of and back on at any of the stops the Gulliver's Park for kids looks good but didn't have enough time an excellent day out and would do it again

reviewnospace: We stopped to take pictures and look around at ultra modern Center of Arts and Sciences. There were vendors there to purchase snacks.

quote: Don't miss Ciudad de las Artes y Ciencias
reviewnospace: Great architecture surrounded by nice picnic areas in lovely parks. Don't miss to visit the Oceánográfico!

reviewnospace: Spent a day here in the summer with wife and 2 kids (aged 6 & 3). Went to the science museum - kids loved it, very interactive with tons for them to do. Adults can enjoy as well. The centre / park itself is quite stunning - built on the park that they put in place of the old river, the architecture is amazing and the park and landscaping runs for miles and miles. We would have liked to have gone to the aquarium as well but didn't have time. Recommended

quote: Was OK for a cloudy day

quote: The pendulum you will never forget
reviewnospace:
Not sure about the Earth travelling around the sun and turning on its axis at the same time? The pendulum in the Science Museum will prove it for you. Just sit and watch.
The interactive exhibition is highly recommended for all ages.
On the dark side, more humans are needed in the exhibition halls, leaving everything to the visitor means they will miss lots of thing.
Entrance fee is a bit high.

reviewnospace: I've seen this huge centre while in taxi and I decided to visit it as soon as possible. Not as big as I was imaging. Takes one hour of normal walk to see the whole area. Amazing breathtaking constructions. Grass and gardens in perfect shape. Mandatory stop in Valentia.

reviewnospace: We spent an afternoon wandering through the science portion of this attraction and found the architecture as captivating as the exhibits. The descriptions were in English and Spanish and were very informative. It was like stepping into another world after touring the historic old city of Valencia. If we return, we would come back to this site to see the arts section and other buildings. It is too much to cover in one visit.

If we return, we would come back to this site to see the arts section and other buildings. It is too much to cover in one visit.

reviewnospace: You can't not go to the city of arts and Science when in Valencia. These buildings are so much part of Valencia's modern image. And also it's a nice contrast with the historic city centre. I didn't bother to enter all the buildings. Just looking at them from the outside to me was a nice activity.

reviewnospace: The city of Art and Science is a must see place because of of its beautiful modern architecture and vast water pools. The best way to enjoy the place by renting a bike and cruse around it. There is an entry fees for the two buildings but we were having more fun outside and admiring the design and the reflecting pools. You must go at night! you will see extra beauty and the place more interesting at night than daylight! You can take the metro to get to this place or rent a bike and enjoy the ride cuz the Valencia bike route goes near the 2 buildings ;)

We must return!

quote: Interesting, but not a must see
reviewnospace: We combined this visit with oceonografic. It was interesting, but such a shame that they don't use other languages then Spanish (Catalan and Valencian) and sometimes English. Because it would be more convenient to more people, especially children. I loved the part of Tesla.

reviewnospace: A really interesting, modern area. We hired a boat around the lake which was a great laugh! It's nice to just relax and have a slow wander around. Perfect for families, couples or even alone.
titleopinion: Cool!. A really interesting, modern area. We hired a boat around the lake which was a great laugh! It's nice to just relax and have a slow wander around. Perfect for families, couples or even alone.

reviewnospace: We didn't pay to enter the museum but we had a lovely time walking around and looking at the amazing architecture. It was a public hotel when we visited & it was great to see the families boating & zorbing on the water.

reviewnospace: Here you can try lots of science in practice. To bad many things were out of order when we visited the place.

reviewnospace: My first impression of the buildings is magnificent. Such detail and beauty. As I had a look of the inside I was amazed by the exhibits. I myself is a curious person and for me 3 hours of stay was not adequate for me to see all sorts of items displayed. I wished I had more time but travelling in a group I had to give into majority. All in all I recommend those who visit Valencia and likes museum and such to visit this place at least once. I assure you would not be dissappointed

reviewnospace:
My opinion may to be out of sync with others. Although this complex is beautiful, I was not impressed with much else.
The opera house could only be visited with a guide, the science museum had few working exhibits and poor explanations.
The aquarium was impressive as one walks through a tunnel-like passage with fish swimming overhead.
I could see the appeal for families with young children, but as a retired couple (there is a reduced entrance fee), we should have stayed outside, rented bikes, and enjoyed the park like grounds and the beautiful architecture.
titleopinion:
Disappointed. My opinion may to be out of sync with others. Although this complex is beautiful, I was not impressed with much else.
The opera house could only be visited with a guide, the science museum had few working exhibits and poor explanations.

I could see the appeal for families with young children, but as a retired couple (there is a reduced entrance fee), we should have stayed outside, rented bikes, and enjoyed the park like grounds and the beautiful architecture.

reviewnospace: It's one of the most gorgeous places I've ever been, but there's little besides the beauty. There's hardly any shows in the music palace and the science museum is disappointing. But for a walk on a moce day...so nice!
titleopinion: Pretty but lacking substance. It's one of the most gorgeous places I've ever been, but there's little besides the beauty. There's hardly any shows in the music palace and the science museum is disappointing. But for a walk on a moce day...so nice!

reviewnospace: We walked the park created by diversion of the River Turia all the way from North almost to the beach and these buildings are a wonder to behold
titleopinion: Mind blowing architecture!. We walked the park created by diversion of the River Turia all the way from North almost to the beach and these buildings are a wonder to behold

reviewnospace:
Didn't have the time to visit the museums but this remarkable collection of monumental modern architecture is well worth visiting just for the buildings. Excellent use of water and trees. Kept impeccably clean.

The buildings are in the bed of the old river course, towards the port end. Don't confuse this with the long, perfectly pleasant but totally unexceptional park which occupies the rest of the old course.
titleopinion:
Worth visiting for the buildings. Didn't have the time to visit the museums but this remarkable collection of monumental modern architecture is well worth visiting just for the buildings. Excellent use of water and trees. Kept impeccably clean.

The buildings are in the bed of the old river course, towards the port end. Don't confuse this with the long, perfectly pleasant but totally unexceptional park which occupies the rest of the old course.

reviewnospace: Got on one of the hire bikes you can pick up anywhere in the city and a quick ride later you can get here..a bit quiet when we visited and didn't look like much was going on but fantastic architecture ..worth looking at the scale and style! Imagine amazing when concerts are on!
titleopinion: Worth a visit. Got on one of the hire bikes you can pick up anywhere in the city and a quick ride later you can get here..a bit quiet when we visited and didn't look like much was going on but fantastic architecture ..worth looking at the scale and style! reviewnospace: Absolutely worth walking around this spectacular ultra modern/futuristic place! We stumbled across it and never knew it was even here, and that made it all the more special. A MUST see
titleopinion: What an amazing place!!. Absolutely worth walking around this spectacular ultra modern/futuristic place! We stumbled across it and never knew it was even here, and that made it all the more special. A MUST see

quote: Amazing venue to arts and science
reviewnospace: The modern architecture surrounded by gardens and water is amazing. If nothing else, just stop and walk around so you can truly appreciate the buildings and layout.
titleopinion: Amazing venue to arts and science. The modern architecture surrounded by gardens and water is amazing. If nothing else, just stop and walk around so you can truly appreciate the buildings and layout.

quote: You could spend a very long time here
reviewnospace:
What a complex! All a bit surreal. Amazing architecture. Go on a sunny, blue sky day when your photos will be even better!

Divided into several areas - see the visit valencia site for full information.

Príncipe Felipe Science Museum - the jagged white building. Better from the outside in my opinion. An awful lot of stuff inside, but I found it a tad boring and quite a lot of the stuff didn't work.

Palau de les Arts Reina Sofía. Opera house - where they hold the concerts. Looks a bit like the opera house.You can go in to visit and I wished we had (instead of the Science Museum).

The Hemisfèric - the IMAX theatre. The dome shaped building that looks like it's sunk into the water. Film was ok about USA's Parks.

Oceanogràfic - the underworld aquarium. The most expensive bit of the park which we gave a miss, but families would enjoy it (I imagine).

The Umbracle - most of it was closed during our visit but it only looked ok anyway.

The Ágora - (blue buiding) looked a bit neglected. You couldn't go in.

The Assut D’or Bridge - an amazing bit of architecture (just like the whole complex!)

You are not allowed to paddle in the water - unless you want a very loud whistle blown at you! However you can hire a little rowing boat or have a go in a Water Orb.... Do not miss this attraction which is on the Tourist Bus route. Worth buying a 2-day pass for E18. 1 day is E16.
titleopinion:
You could spend a very long time here. What a complex! All a bit surreal. Amazing architecture. Go on a sunny, blue sky day when your photos will be even better!

Divided into several areas - see the visit valencia site for full information.

Príncipe Felipe Science Museum - the jagged white building. Better from the outside in my opinion. An awful lot of stuff inside, but I found it a tad boring and quite a lot of the stuff didn't work.

Palau de les Arts Reina Sofía. Opera house - where they hold the concerts. Looks a bit like the opera house.You can go in to visit and I wished we had (instead of the Science Museum).

The Hemisfèric - the IMAX theatre. The dome shaped building that looks like it's sunk into the water. Film was ok about USA's Parks.

Oceanogràfic - the underworld aquarium. The most expensive bit of the park which we gave a miss, but families would enjoy it (I imagine).

The Umbracle - most of it was closed during our visit but it only looked ok anyway.

The Ágora - (blue buiding) looked a bit neglected. You couldn't go in.

The Assut D’or Bridge - an amazing bit of architecture (just like the whole complex!)

You are not allowed to paddle in the water - unless you want a very loud whistle blown at you! However you can hire a little rowing boat or have a go in a Water Orb.... Do not miss this attraction which is on the Tourist Bus route. Worth buying a 2-day pass for E18. 1 day is E16.

reviewnospace: This was just okay, nothing great in the science building, not much English translation on signs. Was expecting a lot more for some reason. Would seek out other things to do in Valencia.
titleopinion: Interesting Buildings. This was just okay, nothing great in the science building, not much English translation on signs. Was expecting a lot more for some reason. Would seek out other things to do in Valencia.

reviewnospace: This is one of the most beautiful sites I have ever visited. A combination of imaginative structures and subtle building materials, surrounded by green spaces and tranquil water creates a truly awe-inspiring space. The buildings and their locations link Valencia's past, present and future.
titleopinion: Architecture at its very best. This is one of the most beautiful sites I have ever visited. A combination of imaginative structures and subtle building materials, surrounded by green spaces and tranquil water creates a truly awe-inspiring space. The buildings and their locations link Valencia's past, present and future.

reviewnospace: We enjoyed frozen cocktails whilst people watching others on the water. A great opportunity for photos and relaxing with friends
titleopinion: Lovely place to wander round. We enjoyed frozen cocktails whilst people watching others on the water. A great opportunity for photos and relaxing with friends

titleopinion: THE ART OF MAKING ART OF SCIENCE. Let yourself be impressed by architecture. Cement, watter, light made works of art. They are waiting for you to discover them.

reviewnospace:
Valencia was on my bucket list because of this complex. An imaginative project to inject community facilities in what had been a meandering river course. I was enthralled by the Beaty of the buildings and we came back at night to enjoy the reflections.

If you enjoy architecture or a world class interactive science museum then take the time to visit this complex.
titleopinion:
Architecture at its sexiest. Valencia was on my bucket list because of this complex. An imaginative project to inject community facilities in what had been a meandering river course. I was enthralled by the Beaty of the buildings and we came back at night to enjoy the reflections.

If you enjoy architecture or a world class interactive science museum then take the time to visit this complex.

reviewnospace: To forewarn, I travel around just to reflect on life, see new things, and get stunning photos. This structure is fantastic. I did not go in though!! Close to a big shopping centre, if that is your thing. So food and washrooms not far. I walked from the train station (about 1.5km). Not a pro at the Valencia train station, but a bit removed. I am very happy to have seen it.

Very happy with all the city had to offer and the ease of getting around the town in an electric wheelchair.

The exploring exhibits were OK but somewhat badly communicated in terms of the science behind and somewhat old / worn-out - when you tried the exploration kits at the Victoria & Albert museum (London) or the Experimentarium (Copenhagen) ...

The Imax experience was on the other hand not that great. A quite old story about the nature of USA - they could surely do better.

quote: Calatrava Architecture for Art and Science Symbolic buildings
reviewnospace:
Visiting the City of Arts and Science complex designed by Santiago Calatrava is a feast for the eyes. The imaginative white buildings reflected in large pools are breathtaking, as many of the results of science and arts! It is the closest feeling to being on another planet - or traveling in time!
There is an Opera House - a Science Museum - so be prepared to take long strolls from one building to the next -and withing each building - to really enjoy these beautiful creative monuments to the splendors of arts and sciences!

The centerpiece of the complex is "L'Hemisfèric" hosting an IMAX Cinema, a planetarium and a laserium. The building is meant to resemble a giant eye which explains why it is known as the “eye of knowledge”.

The interactive museum of science is hosted in a building that resembles the skeleton of a whale. Between this museum and the "eye of knowledge" you will find l'Umbracle — an open structure enveloping a landscaped walk with plant species indigenous to Valencia,, hosting The Walk of the Sculptures. A must in your visit!

The complex also contains l'Oceanogràfic — an open-air oceanographic park, which was designed by the architect Félix Candela. It is the largest oceanographic aquarium in Europe and it was built in the shape of a water lily.

The opera house is also very beautiful - but we could not visit it as it was closed when we arrived.
titleopinion:
Calatrava Architecture for Art and Science Symbolic buildings. Visiting the City of Arts and Science complex designed by Santiago Calatrava is a feast for the eyes. The imaginative white buildings reflected in large pools are breathtaking, as many of the results of science and arts! It is the closest feeling to being on another planet - or traveling in time!
There is an Opera House - a Science Museum - so be prepared to take long strolls from one building to the next -and withing each building - to really enjoy these beautiful creative monuments to the splendors of arts and sciences!

The centerpiece of the complex is "L'Hemisfèric" hosting an IMAX Cinema, a planetarium and a laserium. The building is meant to resemble a giant eye which explains why it is known as the “eye of knowledge”.

The interactive museum of science is hosted in a building that resembles the skeleton of a whale. Between this museum and the "eye of knowledge" you will find l'Umbracle — an open structure enveloping a landscaped walk with plant species indigenous to Valencia,, hosting The Walk of the Sculptures. A must in your visit!

The complex also contains l'Oceanogràfic — an open-air oceanographic park, which was designed by the architect Félix Candela. It is the largest oceanographic aquarium in Europe and it was built in the shape of a water lily.

The opera house is also very beautiful - but we could not visit it as it was closed when we arrived.

reviewnospace: A very nice part of Valencia. Wanted to see the Agora where the pro tennis tournament used to be. So we biked around for a half hour and saw the buildings. Some really cool unbelievable stuff. I really don't think there's anything like it anywhere else in the world. That being said, we spent a half hour there and I'm still not exactly sure what it is.
titleopinion: Nice place. A very nice part of Valencia. Wanted to see the Agora where the pro tennis tournament used to be. So we biked around for a half hour and saw the buildings. reviewnospace: One cannot help but be impressed by these enormous structures. They are huge and remarkable to look at. It is fun to walk among them, rather like being intrigued by staggeringly large sculptures. But, with all my looking, I'm not sure they are very appealing as opposed to just impressive. When I pass by in a bus, I definitely look, but I have no urge to investigate further, to once again see them close by. I should add that I did not go inside of any except the L'umbracle. The prices were too high, the contents not sufficiently appealing. Perhaps a younger person (or kids) would find this attractive, but surround Imax theatres have never done much for me. Here is the truly sad note: it is obvious that maintenance and upkeep is being let slide. The structures and grounds are beginning to seem decidedly unkempt, rather like yesterday's World's Fair.
titleopinion: Impressive, expensive and odd. One cannot help but be impressed by these enormous structures. They are huge and remarkable to look at. reviewnospace: The buildings along this plaza are Santiago Calatrava at his best. The day my wife and I visited people were rowing boats and playing inside of bubbles in the reflecting waterway. The combination of the old city, and this new architecture makes for a beautiful, and engaging city. This is a city I would visit again.
titleopinion: Totally unique. The buildings along this plaza are Santiago Calatrava at his best. The day my wife and I visited people were rowing boats and playing inside of bubbles in the reflecting waterway. The combination of the old city, and this new architecture makes for a beautiful, and engaging city. This is a city I would visit again.

The hemispheric I dont recommend, it was basically a 3d movie of 40 minutes. They didnt use the whole dome. You better go to the movies for this.

quote: Beautiful, elegant modern architecture in Valencia
reviewnospace: On a day-long walking tour of Valencia, the City of the Arts and Sciences was our first stop. We did not know what to expect -- I had done concern that this sight might simply delay us from getting to the historical gems in the city -- but we were profoundly impressed and very glad we made this stop. Made up of museum and entertainment venues, the complex is architecturally stunning and a must-see on any visit to Valenca. My only regret was that we didn't have the time to explore each of the venues. That said, it was great to have a private walking tour of the grounds and learn how this complex arose from what had been an unattractive river bed that flooded in 1957. The complex rightly has a place among the 12 Treasures of Spain.
titleopinion: Beautiful, elegant modern architecture in Valencia. On a day-long walking tour of Valencia, the City of the Arts and Sciences was our first stop. We did not know what to expect -- I had done concern that this sight might simply delay us from getting to the historical gems in the city -- but we were profoundly impressed and very glad we made this stop. Made up of museum and entertainment venues, the complex is architecturally stunning and a must-see on any visit to Valenca. My only regret was that we didn't have the time to explore each of the venues. That said, it was great to have a private walking tour of the grounds and learn how this complex arose from what had been an unattractive river bed that flooded in 1957. The complex rightly has a place among the 12 Treasures of Spain.

quote: Modern gem in an old country
reviewnospace: Beautiful place. Close to zero tourists. An undiscovered gem :) Would definitely recommend getting tickets to see the whole complex. Dedicate an entire day as it is massive! They open at 10am. But closing times vary per attraction. Make sure to allocate 3hrs just for Oceanografic. If you can't fit the entire complex into your schedule/budget, then make sure to see Oceanigrafic and Palau de Arts! These were our favourite.
titleopinion: Modern gem in an old country. Beautiful place. Close to zero tourists. An undiscovered gem :) Would definitely recommend getting tickets to see the whole complex. Dedicate an entire day as it is massive! They open at 10am. But closing times vary per attraction. Make sure to allocate 3hrs just for Oceanografic. If you can't fit the entire complex into your schedule/budget, then make sure to see Oceanigrafic and Palau de Arts! These were our favourite.

reviewnospace:
This is modern architecture well laid out with lakes and tropical garden free to walk trough next to Oceanografic in a green belt area of Valencia, it has cafes and toilets and great to spent a day.
Well worth a visit.
titleopinion:
Modern and beautiful. This is modern architecture well laid out with lakes and tropical garden free to walk trough next to Oceanografic in a green belt area of Valencia, it has cafes and toilets and great to spent a day.

reviewnospace: When people told us to visit this we were imagining a standard museum-style place. Were we ever wrong. The architecture and environment are absolutely stunning, and beautiful. Set in lovely gardens, and with relaxing water spaces, the buildings in this are take your breath away. Visit even if you don't choose to go in. We did choose to go in (to avoid queues buy tickets in advance online - I did this while in the Q on my phone. The science exhibits are very interactive (but they don't all work, and for an English speaker the instructions are often poor). There is plenty to wander around, and lots of subjects - health, sound and light, space, dinosaurs etc. I expect other science museums are similar but I doubt if any in the world match the beauty of this building. My five stars are mostly for this.
titleopinion: Wow - amazing architecture. When people told us to visit this we were imagining a standard museum-style place. Were we ever wrong. The architecture and environment are absolutely stunning, and beautiful. Set in lovely gardens, and with relaxing water spaces, the buildings in this are take your breath away. Visit even if you don't choose to go in. We did choose to go in (to avoid queues buy tickets in advance online - I did this while in the Q on my phone. The science exhibits are very interactive (but they don't all work, and for an English speaker the instructions are often poor). There is plenty to wander around, and lots of subjects - health, sound and light, space, dinosaurs etc. I expect other science museums are similar but I doubt if any in the world match the beauty of this building. My five stars are mostly for this.

reviewnospace:
Unfortunately, many of the " interactive" elements were broken and there is no theme to the installations.
OK on a wet day if you have children but otherwise admire the outside and don't go in!

reviewnospace:
We visited the science museum, and learned so much! We enjoyed the time we spent there. I would recommend going earlier in the day, as later in the afternoon it appeared a school group was there and with so many "busy" kids it was harder to enjoy the museum.
The clear kayaks out front were a neat addition!
titleopinion:

reviewnospace:
Lacks any real " scientific" input or consistent theme. There are a few fairly random installations with interactive activities many of which were broken. The ones that worked were reminiscent of science lessons from early childhood. In itself, the walk down memory lane was quite interesting. The IMAX film was repeat of a BBC programme with a few 3D bits thrown in, so that was als a bit disappointing.
Overall, don't bother unless you have kids.
titleopinion:
Designed for 6 year olds. Lacks any real " scientific" input or consistent theme. There are a few fairly random installations with interactive activities many of which were broken. The ones that worked were reminiscent of science lessons from early childhood. In itself, the walk down memory lane was quite interesting. The IMAX film was repeat of a BBC programme with a few 3D bits thrown in, so that was als a bit disappointing.
Overall, don't bother unless you have kids.

quote: A must go-to when in Valencia
reviewnospace: As you walk in the Turia valley and, suddenly, under a clear blue sky, discover these extravagant, jaw-dropping white structures, apparently thrown into sapphire crystal pools, it would be like stepping into a dream world. If on a budget and won't visit the museums located therein, even the exterior view of of these alien quarters shall make your day.

reviewnospace:
I'm not sure how this place got conceived, but my guess it was to
make a statement, and this is a big one. With other-universe designs, the organic structures are planted in grand shimmering pools reflecting exotic gardens. The scale is immense and includes towering sculpted roofs and spires. As wild as the exterior is, the building interior programs may leave a lot to desire beyond design.

All the buildings are impressive. There seems to be a calming effect around that area, maybe it's the water lakes.
The covered garden on the upper level is well laid out with large palm trees.
I did not visit any of the attractions, but walked around all the buildings. There is much to see.
During the weekends in the evening there is live music playing by the science building.
The atmosphere here is great.
In all, a great day to early evening trip.

titleopinion:
Beautiful part of the city. Stark contrast. . This beautiful, white ceramic 'city' is an amazing contrast to the rest of the city. It is a great area to explore although not much to do once there other than marvel at the architecture.

I recommend accessing via segway or bicycle as a large area you can cover fairly quickly.

Science museum and aquarium are the main attractions here.

quote: Modern contrast to the historical side of the city
reviewnospace:
I found this part of the city to be very refreshing after being continuously connected with the ancient history of Spain. It is nice to see a more modern take on a city, the younger side of Valencia. The buildings are of an amazing design, if you enjoy modern architecture or engineering then this is definitely a place for you.

The pools/water is a tranquil contrast to the hustle and bustle of a city. We managed to stop and have a cup of coffee just to relax as this area (we found) tends to be quite peaceful.

For 5 euros, you can also have a bit of fun inside on of those plastic inflated balls (about 10-15 minutes) but it does get quite stuffy and warm inside one.

quote: The best architectural & entertainment place of Valencia!
reviewnospace: We’ve been twice to the City of Arts and Sciences with my boyfriend. The last time was for my birthday in February 2016. The dolphin show there is marvelous. We were all clapping along with the swimmers in rhythm with the music.

reviewnospace:
The hole thing is amazing to look at, very impressive from the outside.

All in all I'd say it's still worth a visit, especially if you have kids (they'll love it) and for €8 euro not a bad price. You can easily spend 2-3 hours in there.

reviewnospace: City of arts and sciences is meant for those who appreciate architecture. Buildings are made with wonderous shapes and designs. It is open for public viewing. If you follow the turia riverbed walk, this will fall on your right at the end of the riverbed. Though its visibly noticeable a long distance away. From the city there are multiple buses which can take you here, but no direct metro lines. Inside the complex there are multiple building architectures to appreciate, including a mini theatre area in the basement region. The water bodies around in the complex are opened for kids to row around in. Also from the complex, there is a train that leaves to tour around the turia riverbed area. There is a small shop in the complex selling cakes , sandwiches, etc.

reviewnospace: We went there in July which was quite hot and we are not prepared for the glare and heat since the old town is cooler thanks to old architecture. Although being an architect and a Santiago Calatrava fan, I was more excited to see these structures. But after the awe was faded by the extreme whiteness which was almost painful to eyes and uneasy to just stand without shade. I think it'll be better in other seasons and they are still making it more commercially available. For now, it's little overwhelming and overrated.

reviewnospace: Earlier in the day we visited the centre with our three teenage children, impressive building but a bit boring inside, later on that day we went for a bike ride along the river bed, we had hired some push bikes to visit the centre, my teenage son somehow cycled ahead and we lost him, I started to panic as we tried to find him. He had our telephone numbers and he cycled to the science centre to ask for help as we had been there earlier. He asked if he could please ring us up as he was lost, he asked three science centre staff and they all refused!!!! I eventually found him outside the centre. I am absolutely disgusted with this and advise the centre to help children when they need it!

quote: Just for the architecture and oceanographic
