titleopinion: Just for the architecture and oceanographic . The others museums besides the oceanographic are really not interesting, and you should spend at least half a day there

reviewnospace:
I went to the museum with high expectations and was more or less pleased with what I saw. The exhibits are wonderful, very interesting and well thought out. You can easily spend the whole day (if you have food or at least snacks with you). There is a huge amount of information written everywhere (even in English) and you can learn a lot if you're interested. For those of you/us that prefer the hands-on approach there are numerous experiments that you can do with very little reading beforehand (but please, don't just bang on stuff to see what happens).
What annoyed me thoroughly was the lack of discipline seen in some kids! I'm very open-minded and free-spirited but the lack of parenting was disturbing. Kids are running around, banging on the exhibits, even intentionally pushing aside other visitors without parents (or employees?!) saying a word. I understand it's not the employee's job to parent the kids, but it should be their job to prevent the little brats from ruining the visit for the rest of us. I'll give you an example: there are a couple of incubators where you can observe baby chickens being hatched. Even though there were employees and parents around, that didn't stop the little brats from banging on the glass and disturbing the little chicks. Signs telling people not to do that were everywhere.
All in all I really enjoyed the exhibits, but as in the Oceanografic, just a little order would go a long way.
titleopinion:

reviewnospace:
We have just returned from our second visit to Valencia
We love everything about this place and did not go to the science museums other than see them on one of the bus tours
We took the train which runs through the Turia and this ended behind one of the museums.
It was only when we got off we realised that there were some really cool things to do, you have a choice of canoeing around the lake, Zorbing or just relaxing with a drink and watching the world go by
My daughter and I had a go at Zorbing, this was an experience in its own right. It was the first time I tried Zorbing and was great value at €5
My wife and daughter had a go on the canoeing, this too was great value at €5 for two people
All in all give the museums a visit as there are great attractions outside.
titleopinion:

reviewnospace:
Plenty to do for teenagers with science which stretched my son who loves reading non-fiction fact based books. We spent a really productive four hours enjoying all the exhibits and reading the English translations.

We had lunch at the excellent cafe in the foyer area at a reasonable price for sandwiches, crisps, drinks etc. Then returned to continue our visit of the science museum.

Definitely one of the best things we have done in Valencia. When you are desperate for something to do on a rainy day (however unlikely) or if you need air conditioning on a red hot day (far more probable) this is the place to go!

quote: Great exhibits at the science museum
reviewnospace:
We took our two teenagers here, 13 and15 and they were fully engaged. We went on a Tuesday without a ticket, arrived just after 10am when it opens and there were no queues. We were staying in the old town and caught a number 35 bus from Plaza Ayuntamiento.

The exhibits were excellent and interactive and we purchased a ticket for the space simulator which was a bit of fun and very educational. This only runs in English twice a day at 11am and 6pm.

Just walking around outside checking out the buildings is cool and there are very large pools next to the museum where you can hire a rowing boat or a canoe.

Stunning photos everywhere for the holiday album.

reviewnospace: The city of arts and sciences in Valencia houses 3 abstract modern works of art which in the form of buildings highlights the city's underlying artistic influences. These buildings are modern architectural feats. Aesthetically the buildings fit in perfectly with the surrounding area and the city has been carefully designed to blend each individual segment synergistically to create a stunning visual impact from the moment you arrive. It would be difficult in my opinion for anyone not to be impressed when visiting the site. I am not an arty person nor do I have a great interest in design but I was very intrigued by the beauty of the area. It appears as though the designers and planners payed great attention to detail to combine nature, art, design and architecture seamlessly into one big piece of living art. If you visit Valencia and don't visit the city of arts and sciences then you are missing out on one of the best places to visit in the beautiful city. 5 stars!
titleopinion: Stunning location. The city of arts and sciences in Valencia houses 3 abstract modern works of art which in the form of buildings highlights the city's underlying artistic influences. These buildings are modern architectural feats. It would be difficult in my opinion for anyone not to be impressed when visiting the site. I am not an arty person nor do I have a great interest in design but I was very intrigued by the beauty of the area. It appears as though the designers and planners payed great attention to detail to combine nature, art, design and architecture seamlessly into one big piece of living art. If you visit Valencia and don't visit the city of arts and sciences then you are missing out on one of the best places to visit in the beautiful city. 5 stars!

quote: Science Museum not a hit with us
reviewnospace: We bought a package deal of tickets for Oceanographic, the Science Museum and the Hemispheric. While the buildings are absolutely fabulous we were disappointed with the science museum. I had heard great things about it in advance but in comparison to other museums in particular Belfast's W5 we found this one sadly lacking in hands on experiences for the children. I overhead one of the children describing it to some one else as "boring". There was little direction and we found it hard to find our way around. It is shame that the staff do not interact with the visitors to engage them in learning about the excellent exhibits. We did not find the museum busy and having been there I am not surprised. The kayaking in the lake outside for 5 euro for 10 minutes was a big hit though and salvaged the day.

Most of our clothes and souvenirs from the trip were gone. Lots of broken glass and some bitter feelings. We wished we parked in museum underground garage for 6 euros. Be careful and enjoy your time.

reviewnospace:
The architecture of these buildings is amazing. The Science museum resembles the skeleton of a whale. You can pop into the cafe located on the ground floor of this museum without paying an entry fee for the exhibitions. We bought tickets for the exhibitions which were not particularly impressive.

Next to the museum is a building that resembles an eye. This has an IMAX cinema. We didn't go in as it was closed at the time of our visit. There are two additional buildings; one was empty and the other has a restaurant and a theatre type venue.

This is certainly worth visiting if you are in Valencia. You could combine this with a trip to the aquarium (Oceanographic) which is next door.

However the science and art area was a total snooze, just random sections for kids to play, pull ropes, press buttons and spinn cogwheels. The botanic garden is just a long identical line of palms and shrubs, nothing special at all. If you get bored in Valencia, then go for the aquarium, the other stuff is not worth it.

quote: Go there if you are in Valencia.
reviewnospace: Impresseve architecture and buildings. Also loved the way nature was combined with the modern style.
titleopinion: Go there if you are in Valencia.. Impresseve architecture and buildings. Also loved the way nature was combined with the modern style.

reviewnospace:
I'd never heard of Santiago Calatrava until I came to Valencia, and now see his work rivals the best architects in the world. I loved hearing how the plan was to build a motorway here when the river was diverted, but after the public protested this gorgeous centre was created. It truly is stupendous. We spent an evening wandering through the park and if it hadn't have clashed with our plans we would have joined the crowds for an outdoor movie. Instead, next day we returned for a visit to Museu de Las Artes y las Ciencas. Arriving early, we enjoyed a 3D movie on Monarch Butterfly migration from Mexico to Canada & we wondered how many in the audience had ever seen a chrysalis hatch if they hadn't grown up in the countryside.

It was the one day we experienced rain so it was great to be indoors, even though we had to dash between showers to different buildings.

After queuing for lunch in the centre (it was crowded with visitors by now) and eating, we toured the Science Centre. Yes, there are some countries which have better ones than this, but judging by the families enjoying the interactive and interesting displays we felt we got more than our money's worth. Best of all for us was the display about Tesla as we knew very little about this talented inventor. Also watching children playing in their own construction area. With hard hats and barrows, they delighted parents and onlookers with their concentration on moving bricks, winding up cranes and lifting barriers for others to pass through - a lovely concept.

Before heading back to our accomodation we walked through Umbracle. This was one area I felt could have been improved, but it may just be that the hot summer months take a toll on the gardens. All in all a wonderful place for visitors, especially when one has been overwhelmed by so much history and ancient architecture.
titleopinion:
Amazing structures & peaceful park. I'd never heard of Santiago Calatrava until I came to Valencia, and now see his work rivals the best architects in the world. I loved hearing how the plan was to build a motorway here when the river was diverted, but after the public protested this gorgeous centre was created. It truly is stupendous. We spent an evening wandering through the park and if it hadn't have clashed with our plans we would have joined the crowds for an outdoor movie. Instead, next day we returned for a visit to Museu de Las Artes y las Ciencas. Arriving early, we enjoyed a 3D movie on Monarch Butterfly migration from Mexico to Canada & we wondered how many in the audience had ever seen a chrysalis hatch if they hadn't grown up in the countryside.

It was the one day we experienced rain so it was great to be indoors, even though we had to dash between showers to different buildings.

After queuing for lunch in the centre (it was crowded with visitors by now) and eating, we toured the Science Centre. Yes, there are some countries which have better ones than this, but judging by the families enjoying the interactive and interesting displays we felt we got more than our money's worth. Best of all for us was the display about Tesla as we knew very little about this talented inventor. Also watching children playing in their own construction area. With hard hats and barrows, they delighted parents and onlookers with their concentration on moving bricks, winding up cranes and lifting barriers for others to pass through - a lovely concept.

Before heading back to our accomodation we walked through Umbracle. This was one area I felt could have been improved, but it may just be that the hot summer months take a toll on the gardens. All in all a wonderful place for visitors, especially when one has been overwhelmed by so much history and ancient architecture.

The space centre was booked out when we got there but the movies are in English so this would probably be worth doing. We went to the dinosaurs, which were a little disappointing (nothing interactive), an area about science in daily life (some fun bits like testing your hand strength/ having your body measured in 3d) and the interactive children's section. The picture showed a child holding a rabbit but there was no interaction. There wasn't much to do in this section, building and water play, looking at the animals. The highlight was the hatching chicks, they were amazing <U+2661>

Really over priced and terrible, didn't learn one thing. the aquarium by all accounts was amazing but again so over priced it's just ridiculous, best observed from the outside.

Worth buying the combo ticket for all attractions and you can easily spend the best part of the day here. A wonderful contrast to the beautifully-preserved historic old town.
titleopinion: Futuristic place . This was the highlight of my trip and it didn't disappoint. Amazing architecture and well maintained. On a hot day like the day I visited, the blue pools are so inviting! Worth buying the combo ticket for all attractions and you can easily spend the best part of the day here. A wonderful contrast to the beautifully-preserved historic old town.

reviewnospace: It is an amazing set of buildings in the former Turia river bed. Most of these buildings were designed by the architect Santiago Calatrava, famous worlwide. One should not miss those architectural treasures of the modern age.
titleopinion: Amazing buildings. It is an amazing set of buildings in the former Turia river bed. Most of these buildings were designed by the architect Santiago Calatrava, famous worlwide. One should not miss those architectural treasures of the modern age.

reviewnospace: Beautiful place with futuristic architecture to spend a day. Located in the biggest park in Valencia, so you can relax sitting on the lawn and enjoying the view
titleopinion: Future is here. Beautiful place with futuristic architecture to spend a day. Located in the biggest park in Valencia, so you can relax sitting on the lawn and enjoying the view

reviewnospace: Must see!! Really nice to wander around and nice to people watch too amazing buildings in a beautiful city
titleopinion: Do go explore!! . Must see!! Really nice to wander around and nice to people watch too amazing buildings in a beautiful city

reviewnospace: We didn't go into any of the facilities but it was a lovely area to walk around. Stunning architecture. Plenty of areas to choose for shade on a hot day and ample choice of places to sit and admire the surroundings.
titleopinion: Wonderful architecture. We didn't go into any of the facilities but it was a lovely area to walk around. Stunning architecture. Plenty of areas to choose for shade on a hot day and ample choice of places to sit and admire the surroundings.

reviewnospace:
For 8 euros it's worth exploring. It's very hands on, lots to see and do. The building is nice and cool with AC so great for a hot afternoon or a rainy day.

The space exhibition was particularly fun, as were the dinosaurs and Tesla.

Some of the exhibitions however I just didn't quite understand. For example the healthy living one was a little bit strange and activities very worn.

It's fun for people of all ages. Go visit.

For all you who have visited Yorkshire, it's no Eureka though! (Less discovery, more real science, aimed at an older audience).
titleopinion:
Worth a visit. For 8 euros it's worth exploring. It's very hands on, lots to see and do. The building is nice and cool with AC so great for a hot afternoon or a rainy day.

reviewnospace: If you only visit Valencia for a couple of days during a city-break this is the one place you should visit. It has picture perfect angles with beautifully designed buildings. Children will surely enjoy the science museum which has tons of experiments to play with. You can also enjoy the Imax experience in the Hemispheric building.

It has picture perfect angles with beautifully designed buildings. Children will surely enjoy the science museum which has tons of experiments to play with. You can also enjoy the Imax experience in the Hemispheric building.

reviewnospace: You can't visit Valencia and walk around in amazement at all the design and buildings at the the city of science and arts. It's totalling breathtaking and there's so many activities you can do. On this recent visit I hired a two man canoe for me and my son and it was brilliant.

reviewnospace: The whole area with these new buildings are fantastic, but going inside on the Science Museum was disappointing. First obstacle was to understand how to pay for the different shows and exihitbitions, then the whole appareance was lacking a red thread and very few possibilities to do experiments. Must admit that I have been to other science museums which are much more interesting

quote: Keep space on your camera for this
reviewnospace: So much of Valencia is photogenic, given that there is a feast of great period architecture. Away from the old town and the busy streets of the newer city, walking or cycling through the park (that used to be a river) brings you to the striking constructions of the arts and sciences. Here is modernism at its brilliant best. You will need memory space on your camera because every few paces you will find new fascinating angles. Thankfully, there is a cafe in the sciences building, and a feature lake to help you feel cooler.
titleopinion: Keep space on your camera for this. So much of Valencia is photogenic, given that there is a feast of great period architecture. Away from the old town and the busy streets of the newer city, walking or cycling through the park (that used to be a river) brings you to the striking constructions of the arts and sciences. Here is modernism at its brilliant best. You will need memory space on your camera because every few paces you will find new fascinating angles. Thankfully, there is a cafe in the sciences building, and a feature lake to help you feel cooler.

reviewnospace: Passed by this building on a bike tour then went back and walked the grounds. if you have interest in architecture this is a must. if you have interest in engineering and construction this is a must. if you have a pulse this is a must. the building and the exhibits are amazing to experience and take in.
titleopinion: Wow, just wow!!!. Passed by this building on a bike tour then went back and walked the grounds. if you have interest in architecture this is a must. if you have interest in engineering and construction this is a must. if you have a pulse this is a must. the building and the exhibits are amazing to experience and take in.

reviewnospace: It is awesome buildings and spectacular views and if you enjoy photography then this place is a must. The place is well worth the visit just to look at the all the different modern art culture buildings
titleopinion: Awesome buildings. It is awesome buildings and spectacular views and if you enjoy photography then this place is a must. The place is well worth the visit just to look at the all the different modern art culture buildings

reviewnospace: What an amazing sight. Just to wander through the buildings after visiting the Fallas museum opposite was a great experience. Well worth the effort
titleopinion: Got the wow factor. What an amazing sight. Just to wander through the buildings after visiting the Fallas museum opposite was a great experience. Well worth the effort

reviewnospace:
The architecture is quite stunning and enjoyable.
The museum was a bit disappointing in my opinion, there was a lack of flow to it and it was not aimed at all ages, not all exhibits were in working order.
The special exhibitions are poorly organized with ticket sales at one point the exhibition in the other and getting from one floor to the other was a bit of a hassle given the length of the building.
Anyway would recommend only visiting for the architecture, go to the imax, and the aquarium if you are going as a family.
titleopinion:
Go for the architecture. The architecture is quite stunning and enjoyable.
The museum was a bit disappointing in my opinion, there was a lack of flow to it and it was not aimed at all ages, not all exhibits were in working order.
The special exhibitions are poorly organized with ticket sales at one point the exhibition in the other and getting from one floor to the other was a bit of a hassle given the length of the building.
Anyway would recommend only visiting for the architecture, go to the imax, and the aquarium if you are going as a family.

reviewnospace:
We only had a few hours to spend in Valencia on a very brief day trip but this was our number one tourist attraction to visit. It definitely did not disappoint.
This site is beautiful to behold, with its swooping curvy structures and dynamic shapes all in white with the occasional touch of blue. The added element of water surrounding all of the structures further adds to the beauty of the site and the fact that you can paddle in the water makes a walk around this area even more enticing and enjoyable.
The modern structures contain a museum and a sea life centre but I didn't get the chance to venture inside any of the buildings as we were so tight on time. For me it was enough to just wonder around the huge site taking copious amounts of photos.
Do not miss this attraction and give yourself at least an hour just to walk around it if nothing else. It's huge!
titleopinion:
Architectural Perfection. We only had a few hours to spend in Valencia on a very brief day trip but this was our number one tourist attraction to visit. It definitely did not disappoint.
This site is beautiful to behold, with its swooping curvy structures and dynamic shapes all in white with the occasional touch of blue. The added element of water surrounding all of the structures further adds to the beauty of the site and the fact that you can paddle in the water makes a walk around this area even more enticing and enjoyable.
The modern structures contain a museum and a sea life centre but I didn't get the chance to venture inside any of the buildings as we were so tight on time. For me it was enough to just wonder around the huge site taking copious amounts of photos.
Do not miss this attraction and give yourself at least an hour just to walk around it if nothing else. It's huge!

quote: Amazing Architecture! Big park, lots to see!
reviewnospace: The City of Arts & Sciences is actually a large area with an acquarium, museum and some other attractions. All require admissions. The "City" you can walk around in, bike in, or drive to and park and enjoy. It is pretty big, over a mile long. The architecture is incredible, so modern! Lots of water features, vendors sell food and junk. It is very easy to get to by bus from just about anywhere in the city. It is a lovely park and I recommend it for singles, families or just about anyone. It is handicapped friendly.
titleopinion: Amazing Architecture! Big park, lots to see!. The City of Arts & Sciences is actually a large area with an acquarium, museum and some other attractions. All require admissions. The "City" you can walk around in, bike in, or drive to and park and enjoy. It is pretty big, over a mile long. The architecture is incredible, so modern! Lots of water features, vendors sell food and junk. It is very easy to get to by bus from just about anywhere in the city. It is a lovely park and I recommend it for singles, families or just about anyone. It is handicapped friendly.

reviewnospace: Beautiful building but the museum needs an upgrade. Not all exhibitions are in English which is a shame because international visitors miss out on interesting parts of the museum. Interactive nature was somewhat disappointing as not everything is working properly. Toilets downstairs need to be cleaned more often, they are smelly and messy.
titleopinion: Beautiful building, average museum.. Beautiful building but the museum needs an upgrade. Not all exhibitions are in English which is a shame because international visitors miss out on interesting parts of the museum. Interactive nature was somewhat disappointing as not everything is working properly. Toilets downstairs need to be cleaned more often, they are smelly and messy.

reviewnospace: What place. Took a while to get round and photograph all of it. We went at sunset so got all the lights against the dimming blue sky. There is also a fantastic restaurant there so made for a very good evening.
titleopinion: Increidble!. What place. Took a while to get round and photograph all of it. We went at sunset so got all the lights against the dimming blue sky. There is also a fantastic restaurant there so made for a very good evening.

reviewnospace: Had a great time wandering around the museum and enjoyed the 3 D experience in the Hemispheric. Visually stunning architecture and lots to see and do
titleopinion: Great day out. Had a great time wandering around the museum and enjoyed the 3 D experience in the Hemispheric. Visually stunning architecture and lots to see and do

reviewnospace:
Incredible architecture. Some of the best we've seen.

Sadly, the museum itself was a little underwhelming. Many exhibits not working, complex to understand ticketing for the add-ons. A couple of the shows that the kids saw were not user friendly for non-Spanish speakers.
titleopinion:
Amazing architecture, museum not great. Incredible architecture. Some of the best we've seen.

Sadly, the museum itself was a little underwhelming. Many exhibits not working, complex to understand ticketing for the add-ons. A couple of the shows that the kids saw were not user friendly for non-Spanish speakers.

reviewnospace: Utterly fantastic if you are a science nerd like me! They had a display of each and every single chromosome in the human body when I went which was amazing to see. Best bit was the interactive nature of the whole place. Definitely would go back!
titleopinion: Holiday. Utterly fantastic if you are a science nerd like me! They had a display of each and every single chromosome in the human body when I went which was amazing to see. Best bit was the interactive nature of the whole place. Definitely would go back!

reviewnospace:
We welcomed spring of 2016 earlier by staying in Valencia in March. The very first stop was the City of the Arts and Sciences! And i fell in love with it! I went back almost daily! It's inspiring to see all the modern Santiago Calatrava buildings, no wonder why have become icons in the city.
It's the place where the all the festivals & events begin, where people gather to walk each weekend, where you start the long walk in the Turia gardens!

The museum take a full day to explore, of course if you have so much time in your visit, and the projections in the Hemispheric are quite epic to watch!

Great for families with children, and awesome facilities everywhere.

I can't wait to go back and spend a full day over there!
titleopinion:
Amazing. We welcomed spring of 2016 earlier by staying in Valencia in March. The very first stop was the City of the Arts and Sciences! And i fell in love with it! I went back almost daily! It's inspiring to see all the modern Santiago Calatrava buildings, no wonder why have become icons in the city.
It's the place where the all the festivals & events begin, where people gather to walk each weekend, where you start the long walk in the Turia gardens!

The museum take a full day to explore, of course if you have so much time in your visit, and the projections in the Hemispheric are quite epic to watch!

Great for families with children, and awesome facilities everywhere.

I can't wait to go back and spend a full day over there!

reviewnospace: This is an amazing space to walk around and attend some of the many activities there. The firework display was spectacular.
titleopinion: Amazing architecture and atmosphere. This is an amazing space to walk around and attend some of the many activities there. The firework display was spectacular.

reviewnospace:
The architecture of the building is the first thing that will attract you,but scientific realities among games and movies and speeches will thrill you.
It is a mesmerizing place for teenagers ,but even adult people can learn or be recalled through mass of scientific hints there.
titleopinion:
A scientific look at life. The architecture of the building is the first thing that will attract you,but scientific realities among games and movies and speeches will thrill you.
It is a mesmerizing place for teenagers ,but even adult people can learn or be recalled through mass of scientific hints there.

reviewnospace: Dramatic building design and some good ideas in interactive science to demonstrate natural laws. E.g. I liked the details and examples of how trees and wood have been used down the centuries by humans in so many ways. They're amazing. The downsides were the number of broken exhibits, the lack of follow through to give great examples, the poor quality film about forests (virtually unwatchable especially when 4k films are in cinemas everywhere) and they can't even fix the urinal or the toilet door lock in the house of science!!! Hence 4 stars for intention, 3 stars for results.
titleopinion: Good in parts.. Dramatic building design and some good ideas in interactive science to demonstrate natural laws. E.g. I liked the details and examples of how trees and wood have been used down the centuries by humans in so many ways. They're amazing. The downsides were the number of broken exhibits, the lack of follow through to give great examples, the poor quality film about forests (virtually unwatchable especially when 4k films are in cinemas everywhere) and they can't even fix the urinal or the toilet door lock in the house of science!!! Hence 4 stars for intention, 3 stars for results.

Would revisit again :)

Santiago Calatrava really worked this place out. Just continue walking in the riverbed of Turia and I promise you'll be more than satisfied with your day.

The park with it's surrounding, pools, a lot of water, and extremly large open space. You coud just seat there and feel that you are in some other planet.

titleopinion: Amazing architecture . Very picturesque- couldnt stop taking photos amazing design work and not busy at all. Lovely to walk around from the park gardens and very close to beach for afterwards if hot!

reviewnospace: The venue itself is excellent but there are so many different attractions on the 3rd and 1st level it's very difficult to truly appreciate it and secondly your shoulder to shoulder with the next attraction. A major issue is the lack of English language in both translations and commentary. My son enjoyed it but we as parents felt it was toodisjointed.
titleopinion: Disappointed . The venue itself is excellent but there are so many different attractions on the 3rd and 1st level it's very difficult to truly appreciate it and secondly your shoulder to shoulder with the next attraction. A major issue is the lack of English language in both translations and commentary. My son enjoyed it but we as parents felt it was toodisjointed.

quote: Brill day out and a fun experience (regardless of language)
reviewnospace:
The whole day spend in this area was great. We explored the building and all of its contents over three floors and had loads of fun looking at exhibits from interactive science 'experiments' to hatching chicks in incubators and the Tesla area. Much of the information was in Spanish only, which we totally expected. However this didn't take away entirely from the experience and we definitely walked away a bit better education and entertained. (I had the advantage of have a super-smart wife and daughter on-hand to explain everything in the biology area which did help!)

All in all it's a good experience at a very low cost.

The architecture of the area alone makes the trip worthwhile and it's gorgeous. Even walking through the entrance halls for the science centre is a treat. The area outside with their expansive water ways which you can ride a boat on is also a treat to the eye.
titleopinion:

quote: Modern and interesting place to visit

quote: great place for kids to spend the day
reviewnospace: a great modern structure, well laid out and well planned. with helpful staff. the kids loved the science museum and the imax was an experience that everyone should try. really festive at night too and the kids loved the water and the bubble balls in the water.

reviewnospace: Architecture of 21 th century situated in a beautiful Turia park. Calatrava best works for his city. Just stroll between structures and enjoy spectacular site. Valencias ultra modern site. Take a bike and cross the whole park.

titleopinion: Futuristic. Cool futuristic architecture, also very nicely lit up at night. You don't have to pay to get close, only to enter the houses.

quote: Beautiful architecture in a peaceful environment
reviewnospace: A day or more in Valencia's long-stretched park is a blessing, and the Ciudad des las Artes y las Ciencias does nothing but enrich this feeling. Every building on its own features an interesting design and when combined the sight is marvelous. Some permanent and temporary exhibitions inside are also worth its while.
titleopinion: Beautiful architecture in a peaceful environment. Every building on its own features an interesting design and when combined the sight is marvelous. Some permanent and temporary exhibitions inside are also worth its while.

reviewnospace: We spent all day (including the Oceangraphic) as they are so close - a total of 17k steps according to our Fitbit, so wear comfortable shoes! I had a teenager with me who was totally immersed in all aspects, especially the science museum. The architecture is totally amazing and the story of its conception within the museum, is essential I feel. As we stayed nearby we were drawn most nights to revisit, re-photograph and enjoy another aspect. Truly breathtaking!
titleopinion: A MUST!. We spent all day (including the Oceangraphic) as they are so close - a total of 17k steps according to our Fitbit, so wear comfortable shoes! quote: This shi was lit af fam
reviewnospace: Ye this shi was totally dope. They had shallow water pools you could cruise through on a bike and everything looked ultra rad. Also very rare pokemon live near here because i caught a magmar, an arbok, and a rhyhorn within 5 minutes. 4/20 would defo recommend.

reviewnospace: My favourite part of the city (and it's a tough choice!) in my favourite city in Europe. We love it so much, we've bought an apartment overlooking this stunning vista, but it's also a great place to visit or stay for a holiday - easy to get about, plenty of free parking, cycle paths everywhere, museum, opera house, aquarium, concert hall, IMAX cinema, beautiful gardens and much much more within a five-minute walk of here.

reviewnospace: We were lucky enough to be based 5 minutes walk from this amazing location so we visited a few times during our stay. The photos don't prepare you for the huge scale of these dramatic buildings and their reflections into the aquamarine waters which are like huge mosaic lined swimming pools. We didn't go inside any of the buildings but rowed on the water in a clear kayak, admired the sculptures, tried out the echo (which works) and ate at one of the waterside cafes.

titleopinion: Inspirational Modern .. Such an interesting place to visit. Wonderfully impressive, modern architecture. a definite must see!!

quote: The modern part of incredible Valencia
reviewnospace: The complex CAC (City of Arts and Sciences in English) is an amazing set of buildings in the former Turia river bed. Starting with the Principe Felipe Museum, architecturaly reminding me of a whale's sceleton, continuing with the Hemispheric (IMAX cinema) looking like an eye,and even one part opening as eyelid, and the Reina Sophia Arts center, the roof of which is a giant leaf, touching ground at only one place, and finishing with the Oceanographic (the biggest Aquarium in Europe), the Agora - a tennis playground and the magnificent bridge - most of these buildgs were designed by the local Santiago Calatrava, now best known for the New Your\sWTC Transportation Hub. One should not miss those architectural treasures of the modern era, some of them being also unique with their use.
titleopinion: The modern part of incredible Valencia. The complex CAC (City of Arts and Sciences in English) is an amazing set of buildings in the former Turia river bed. Starting with the Principe Felipe Museum, architecturaly reminding me of a whale's sceleton, continuing with the Hemispheric (IMAX cinema) looking like an eye,and even one part opening as eyelid, and the Reina Sophia Arts center, the roof of which is a giant leaf, touching ground at only one place, and finishing with the Oceanographic (the biggest Aquarium in Europe), the Agora - a tennis playground and the magnificent bridge - most of these buildgs were designed by the local Santiago Calatrava, now best known for the New Your\sWTC Transportation Hub. One should not miss those architectural treasures of the modern era, some of them being also unique with their use.

reviewnospace: Tips: you can buy one single for the science museum and oceanografic and other sites in the science museum to avoid queuing on every site you want to visit. And for students do bring your student card, they offer interesting student price. For art and design enthusiast this place will please your eyes.

Tips: you can buy one single for the science museum and oceanografic and other sites in the science museum to avoid queuing on every site you want to visit. reviewnospace: Amazing arhitecture... the buildings are like in Science Fiction movies... you can spend a lot of time there without getting bored. The Oceanografic is in the same place, and it's absolutely lovely to see the dolphins show and the big aquariums. The water is so clean and they have some big baloons or canoe to enjoy on water. Loved this place!

reviewnospace:
Very nice aquariums and dolphin show! There are a lot of fish and other species to sea (pun intended).
The only thing I really hate is that the show and the "behind the scenes" film is only in spanish. No subtitles, no English/French dubbing or whatever... Most of the desciptions near the aquaria happily are in English too. Most of the staff speaks English too.

reviewnospace: With this setting, building, architecture, the museum was set up to make a big splash in the science and arts field. What a disappointment... Have low expectation and let's hope that this museum start to reach more than a regional appeal.

reviewnospace: A must see if you visit the city. I could not give much time for this attraction which I guess was a big travel mistake. The place is a must visit for the architects and civil engineers just to see and study the breath taking unconventional structures. Oh and one more thing...if you like taking selfies this is the place to be.

reviewnospace: It was quite pretty to walk along, but what was detracting was reading about how some of the buildings already falling apart (pieces of it coming off the opera house) and with the price tag of $1.1billion, I'd say that the city definitely got skinned on this one. That said, the structures are interesting. It was esp interesting given that NYC just got the most expensive subway station, Oculus, and so to see this by the same architect was good context.

reviewnospace: An enormous, modern designed "city "in Valencia. It is empty and devoid of any people or life. The design is fairly interesting, but it is to such a huge scale that it is off putting. Just way too much hard space.

reviewnospace: You need lots of energy & good walking shoes. It's just a terrific place to visit. The architecture alone is jaw dropping. You can buy tickets for any one of the experiences or for all of them....we went for all of them. The Hemisphere 3D cinema experience, (butterfly film), was a nice experience & very informative). Oceanogragic was the aquarium - a good one. The Science museum is enormous with lots to see & play with. (A bit like the dome when it first opened). We ran out of energy before we got to the internal garden. Next time we visit Valencia we will catch it.

quote: it looks and it is the city of arts and science
reviewnospace: I was with my wife in Valencia,we want to go EL MUSEO NACIONAL DE CERAMICA,but,I don't know what happend,the idiot bus conductor broght us to this side of Valencia.Whay em I seying that,?-because I saw the stupid faces maked by the inhabitants who werw in thw bus,and who were asking the busdriver about theit stations where they must to arrive.For us it wasn't important,we want to visit one day this place too.it was a sunny,warm day,so that we accept this adventure.In this place-it isn't a real town....we sow little riwers,grasslike in golf places,everything very,very clean.We saw liffle lakes ,in which childrens were commeing with their little electronical boots,adults in big plastic balls,who could pss on the water,and boots from plastic,so aranged that you had the sensation you are flouting on the water.Every one does do what he desired.They were many strange,modern constructions,you had not the tme to visit them all,but we went to visit a constraction,big like a ship.It was so constructed that you had the impresion you are realy on a boat,with places for sculptures of wellknown vaencias sculptores,yo could rest on banks made in the stule of Gaudi,you could even make a round with bicicles.on the top ,there was a garden with exotic flowers,palmes,very nice and interesting.In an other building we saw a little cinema ,which Short-50min.documentary films,and we realy try to see one about Israel and his Capitale,in a interesting 3 dimension mode.Everything translated in 6-7 international languages.. At last ,we went to see Oceanografico-a part of this"TOWN",but it is an other story.You may go to see everything-a full day,you can reat,deik and rest thre,you will find everything you want and need.OLA.!

Did not go to the Aquarium this visit due to time constraints but would like to have gone back after a brilliant visit last trip.

quote: Creative, Expensive But Worth a visit.
reviewnospace: Married to an Architect we had to come see the City of Arts and Sciences, and pay tribute to Calatrava's masterful work (that I hear bankrupts most cities). With that out of the way, it really is awe inspiring. Seeing all the buildings/structures as a whole its quite impressive. We purchased tickets to only go inside the science museum and the aquarium but we walked around the other buildings, bridges and just marveled at the creativity. Not knowing any architecture myself, I walked away from this just with the thought that its nice when people/artists think outside the box. With that said, too bad it cost the city so much!

reviewnospace:
Valencia is a fine city with plenty to see and do. As a family of 6 with kids from 13 to 22 we needed variety as we are not a beach type family.
We travelled using the metro which was cheap,easy to use and perfect for where we wanted to go
We did the usual tourist spots like Oceana graphic, old city and Malvarossa
We travelled to Aquopolis in Cullera and lots of shopping in the city so everyone was happy. We found people friendly and happy to please (not as big an English speaking area compared to other regions in Spain)but we never were stuck!!!
Would love to go back to explore the city more (sans kids!!!!) Food/drink not expensive (supermarket wines start at 99c and 12 pack beer @ 25c a can and very tasty!!)
The only down side is the amount of graffiti makes the city look poorly

reviewnospace:
This is an interesting and impressive complex with several buildings and structures sitting in carefully-designed landscaping that all have a modern and innovative design, and form together a unique attraction.
We investigated this large complex by electrical bike which is ideal to maneuver the various levels. Try to come on the weekend, when many local families roam the park and the plazas. It is also worthwhile to come at night when the structures are lighted.

reviewnospace: Our first stop in Valencia was the City of the Arts & Sciences, designed by Valencia native Santiago Calatrava. Next to this complex is the Queen Sofia Palace of the Arts, also built by him. We enjoyed walking through the complex and admiring the unique architecture and history behind the buildings. It is free and definitely worth seeing.
titleopinion: MUST SEE IN VALENCIA. Our first stop in Valencia was the City of the Arts & Sciences, designed by Valencia native Santiago Calatrava. Next to this complex is the Queen Sofia Palace of the Arts, also built by him. We enjoyed walking through the complex and admiring the unique architecture and history behind the buildings. It is free and definitely worth seeing.

reviewnospace:
When you visit most cities there is usually a place that you must see. In Valencia, this is it.Its situated in the Turia river bed and you would need 3 days to do this place justice.
There is so much to see but most of the building have a fee to enter.
I usually take the small train that takes you around the 10 kilometer trail. Commentary is only in Spanish but there's a booklet in other languages to point out places of interest.
The train ride cost 5 euros per person.
Try to get the driver to stop by the children's play area where there is a huge sculpture of 'Gulliver' that has slides and swings built into it.Its more than 50 metres from end to end.
There is often free exhibition's that changes regularly and lots for childrens
Ten minutes away on the same road is the 'Fire' exhibition where you can see images from the major event in Valencia that happens each year 15-19 March.. Another not to 'miss' in Valencia

reviewnospace:
Great museum, almost every display is interactive. However, not all displays were functional, and the Tesla exhibition was very underwhelming.

Purchase it as part of the multi ticket with oceanographic. Not worth it by itself.
titleopinion:

reviewnospace:
Were I a Valencian ratepayer, I would vomit into my hat every time I passed this bizarre assemblage of purposeless structures. Built at vast public expense to showcase the scientific and artistic heritage of Valencia, it does more to underscore the shortcomings of Calatrava's public spaces and the reputation for high maintenance costs than to celebrate science and educate the public.
Inside the three tiered science museum about half the space is filled with poorly conceived and dreadfully executed interactive displays and the rest is echoing void. The structure is oppressive despite all the light that streams in.
The outdoor Umbracle which runs the length of the parking garage is a sort of boardwalk through local flora, half as pleasing as the park outside.
The L'Hèmisferic is a glorified Imax cinema, and the L'Océanographic by Felix Candela a more successful and better purposed structure. That said, the marine mammals on display deserve far more space, or better, total freedom
Of all the complex the Palau de les Artes Reina Sofía appears to best serve it's purpose as it has became the centre for opera and music of the city.
Sadly Valencia is up to its neck in debt and unable to fund appropriate use of the Ciencias structure.
A visit is only of value to see how public funds should not be spent!
titleopinion:
Empty extravagance. Were I a Valencian ratepayer, I would vomit into my hat every time I passed this bizarre assemblage of purposeless structures. Built at vast public expense to showcase the scientific and artistic heritage of Valencia, it does more to underscore the shortcomings of Calatrava's public spaces and the reputation for high maintenance costs than to celebrate science and educate the public.
Inside the three tiered science museum about half the space is filled with poorly conceived and dreadfully executed interactive displays and the rest is echoing void. The structure is oppressive despite all the light that streams in.

The L'Hèmisferic is a glorified Imax cinema, and the L'Océanographic by Felix Candela a more successful and better purposed structure. That said, the marine mammals on display deserve far more space, or better, total freedom
Of all the complex the Palau de les Artes Reina Sofía appears to best serve it's purpose as it has became the centre for opera and music of the city.

reviewnospace:
You can't fail to be blown away by the scale and majesty of the buildings in this part of the old river bed.
We also went to the Science museum. We'd got a good deal by buying our ticket at the same time as our ticket for Oceanographic - a combo ticket - and as it was raining on the Saturday morning we thought we'd visit the science museum at that point. Although we're English and a lot of the exhibits are in Spanish it didn't spoil our enjoyment. A lot (although not all) of them have English explanations as well and there were lots of hands on and interactive exhibits as well. Been to science museums in Manchester and London as well (a few times!) so not sure I would have gone had it not been for the inclement weather, but it was a good way to spend a rainy morning and thinking back to when our kids were young I think they would have enjoyed it / we would have enjoyed it as a family day out.
titleopinion:
Stunning Architecture. Interesting Science Museum. You can't fail to be blown away by the scale and majesty of the buildings in this part of the old river bed.
We also went to the Science museum. We'd got a good deal by buying our ticket at the same time as our ticket for Oceanographic - a combo ticket - and as it was raining on the Saturday morning we thought we'd visit the science museum at that point. Although we're English and a lot of the exhibits are in Spanish it didn't spoil our enjoyment. A lot (although not all) of them have English explanations as well and there were lots of hands on and interactive exhibits as well. Been to science museums in Manchester and London as well (a few times!) so not sure I would have gone had it not been for the inclement weather, but it was a good way to spend a rainy morning and thinking back to when our kids were young I think they would have enjoyed it / we would have enjoyed it as a family day out.

quote: Awesome place to spend quality time and learn!
reviewnospace:
Me and my girlfriend spent the New Year in Valencia and was probably the best New Years ever! And the great thing about this trip is that we made no plan for it and just took the flight to Valencia.

And one of the best entertainment we had were the 2 days spent in this amazing place, which is actually a small city full of interesting and helpful smaller museums to visit.

Compared to other places, there is a lot of interaction allowed for the visitors. You can try different mechanisms, you can ride them, play with them and read about.

We will visit again when our daughter will be around the, hope she'll like it too.

reviewnospace: A jaw dropping aray of buildings make up City of the Arts and Sciences. Think Art Nouveau/dinosaur skeleton/Space station...a fascinating and succesful hybrid of styles designed by a Valencian architect. Impeccably white and scrupulously maintained, the entire area sits within the oasis that is the Turia Gardens. Hire a bike and cycle here for most enjoyable experience. Note..I didnt visit the various museums/aquarium as entry is expensive.

quote: An interesting, modern part of Valencia

reviewnospace: The cac (ciudad de las artes y ciencias) is located in the end of Rio Turia. It is a place to sit down on a bench by the water and think about your life. The architecture by Valencias Calatrava is amazing. Go here also in the evening.
titleopinion: Romantic, beautiful and wow. The cac (ciudad de las artes y ciencias) is located in the end of Rio Turia. It is a place to sit down on a bench by the water and think about your life. The architecture by Valencias Calatrava is amazing. Go here also in the evening.

reviewnospace: I was really deceived by this building. We got the tourist package that included the science building. My friend and I went through the activities and half of the stuff did not work... Deceived and thought it was a waste of time really.
titleopinion: Mediocre . I was really deceived by this building. We got the tourist package that included the science building. My friend and I went through the activities and half of the stuff did not work... Deceived and thought it was a waste of time really.

quote: Ok but not really worth the money
reviewnospace: It's good with lots of experiments showing practical application of concepts but not really worth the money...the outside structure is impressive but that's about it
titleopinion: Ok but not really worth the money . It's good with lots of experiments showing practical application of concepts but not really worth the money...the outside structure is impressive but that's about it

reviewnospace: If you like modern architecture, you're in for a treat. The grounds once were pretty shabby. The city cleaned them up and ultimately built these spectacular buildings. There's even a large pool you can rent a boat to paddle around. However, it's the buildings that steal the show.
titleopinion: Dazzling Modern Architecture. If you like modern architecture, you're in for a treat. The grounds once were pretty shabby. The city cleaned them up and ultimately built these spectacular buildings. There's even a large pool you can rent a boat to paddle around. However, it's the buildings that steal the show.

quote: Enjoyable walk through modern / futuristic buildings
reviewnospace: Had a lovely afternoon at the City of Arts and Sciences in Valencia. You really can't go to Valencia without spending some time here. It is free to walk along the waterfront and take in the wonderful layout of the place. The shallow water pond along the full length of the whole area was fantastic (although it would have been better if there weren't security men policing the use of the water for paddling especially as such a hot day as we had). Paid extra to go in the giant blow up balloons on the water. Kids loved these although again, it was a blistering hot day, and probably a better idea to do the balloons on a cooler day! It was the highlight of our visit to the city.
titleopinion: Enjoyable walk through modern / futuristic buildings. Had a lovely afternoon at the City of Arts and Sciences in Valencia. You really can't go to Valencia without spending some time here. It is free to walk along the waterfront and take in the wonderful layout of the place. The shallow water pond along the full length of the whole area was fantastic (although it would have been better if there weren't security men policing the use of the water for paddling especially as such a hot day as we had). Paid extra to go in the giant blow up balloons on the water. Kids loved these although again, it was a blistering hot day, and probably a better idea to do the balloons on a cooler day! It was the highlight of our visit to the city.

reviewnospace: Statement of modern Valencia architecture. Definitely worth it to spend a day.visiting all the attractions. A bit far away from the metro, but at the walkable distance.
titleopinion: Must to see. Statement of modern Valencia architecture. Definitely worth it to spend a day.visiting all the attractions. A bit far away from the metro, but at the walkable distance.

reviewnospace: This area has some incredible architecture that can be appreciated by just walking around the area. We did this on a Sunday morning and the traffic was light with no crowds of fellow tourists. We did not enter any of the buildings, but you don't have to to appreciate the area.
titleopinion: Spend time just walking around. This area has some incredible architecture that can be appreciated by just walking around the area. We did this on a Sunday morning and the traffic was light with no crowds of fellow tourists. We did not enter any of the buildings, but you don't have to to appreciate the area.

reviewnospace: Do not miss this wonderful complex of architectural wonders. I didn't even want to go to the museums, I just wanted to gaze at the buildings in awe. Calatrava masterpieces for sure.

reviewnospace: Must place to visit- been here on a number of occasions and never fails to impress . Number 15 bus from centre takes you there.

quote: Nice modern place in this old-city

reviewnospace: Many things to do. From opera to cinema, theater, museum, expo and the most impressive aquarium in Europe. Be ready to make a lot of pictures when visiting. It's like a futuristic city. Architecture is plainly amazing. Best advise you can get: If you just want to make pictures, come at the end of the afternoon just before night falls. Best light ever for making pictures. You won't regret it.

Best light ever for making pictures. You won't regret it.

quote: Amazing place for kids AND adults

titleopinion: Amazing place for kids AND adults. I probably enjoyed walking around this place more than the Aquarium next door. Third floor exposition has lots and lots of features that lets you interact with them. Highly recommend, considering the price is only 6-7€ for adult.

quote: skip this entertainment non working thing.

quote: A very interactive hands-on science museum
reviewnospace: Fantastic for kids, just as interesting for adults! Information is in both Spanish and English and almost all of the exhibits are hands-on, learn by doing. That's the best way to understand about science.

reviewnospace: The buildings are absolutely stunning. We walked inside and met a group of young media arts students from Cal Berkley Stunning colors.

reviewnospace: As a frequent visitor to this lovely city with its fine architecture and open spaces I have found that with the Science Museum it fails to show much more now than it did 12 yrs ago. The Opera and Music Buildings and all the rest in the Turia impress me greatly. There is no wonder the same Archtect was commissioned in NewYork. The water displays are very good when on and I do understand because of a dry winter there is need to preserve water. Valencia you do have great building New and Old so look after them please.

quote: Nice for photos bad for science

It looked like the impressive disgine from the outside is just a big shell for the poor exebitions inside. The presentations are bad and not well constracted. The place is too big for the few things there are to see. If you want to see a science museum its not the place.

reviewnospace: Absolutely stunning. Futurism at it's most astounding. It feels like you're on the set of a sci-fi film. Makes the Sydney opera house look pedestrian. Do not miss it if you are in Valencia.

reviewnospace: Interesting place, with interesting buildings, designed by internationally known, Calatrava, who was born in Valencia
titleopinion: City of the Arts and Sciences. Interesting place, with interesting buildings, designed by internationally known, Calatrava, who was born in Valencia

quote: vist if only for the architecture
reviewnospace: yes highly recommended, large variety of exhibits to see and explore and the architect must have been congratulated more than thousands of times for his creativity.
titleopinion: vist if only for the architecture. yes highly recommended, large variety of exhibits to see and explore and the architect must have been congratulated more than thousands of times for his creativity.

reviewnospace: It is a must see. It is incredible... It is a selfie & photographers dream But it is cold, poorly constructed, wearing badly, souless, poorly designed (some of the enormous structures have little usable space) and leave you with a sense of pointlessness. It cost Valencia dear, especially the architectural fees, and the maintenance is astronomical. It has attracted huge attention & tourists, & many films have used it. I'm a fan of modern architecture love photographing buildings but not a fan of egotistical salesman fooling public authorities parting with massive sums of money for a vanity project.It is the original White Elephant.
titleopinion: Fantastic, bleach, narcissistic... It is a must see. It is incredible... It is a selfie & photographers dream But it is cold, poorly constructed, wearing badly, souless, poorly designed (some of the enormous structures have little usable space) and leave you with a sense of pointlessness. It cost Valencia dear, especially the architectural fees, and the maintenance is astronomical. It has attracted huge attention & tourists, & many films have used it. I'm a fan of modern architecture love photographing buildings but not a fan of egotistical salesman fooling public authorities parting with massive sums of money for a vanity project.It is the original White Elephant.

reviewnospace: For those who like modern architecture this is certainly one of the best things to see in Europe! It is well kept and its emplacement in the park makes it a very quiet place. A moment of relax.
titleopinion: Modern architecture. For those who like modern architecture this is certainly one of the best things to see in Europe! It is well kept and its emplacement in the park makes it a very quiet place. A moment of relax.

reviewnospace: From the outside is very very impresive, I realy liked it. But I was a litle bit dispointed inside the Museum od Science. I have been in this type of museum in Bremen, Germany and Ljubljana, Slovenia and they are (in my opinion) smaller but better. I couldn't try many experiments because they didn't work. Many things are only in Spanish.There were many visitors from other countries and I think that only Spanish and a bit English are not enough, especialy for those who explore museum on their own. But I have and recommend it.
titleopinion: A little bit dispointed. From the outside is very very impresive, I realy liked it. But I was a litle bit dispointed inside the Museum od Science. reviewnospace: Consist of several buildings - Museum, Cinema (Hemispheric), Palace of arts, Oceanographic, Umbracle and Àgora. I presume that having an old town center and a beach zone, the city wanted something between to complete the picture - and they got it. After visiting the central part of the city, this complex teleports you to futuristic landscape. Really have to congratulate the people who planed, designed and build this city of the future. Great for family vacations, science, culture and nature tripsters.
titleopinion: Futuristic. Consist of several buildings - Museum, Cinema (Hemispheric), Palace of arts, Oceanographic, Umbracle and Àgora. quote: Great architecture, full days worth of fun

quote: Must see if you're in or close to vakencia
reviewnospace: We've just returned from visiting today. What a fantastic day! The building itself is amazing and worth visiting just to see. Apart from that the tours and exhibition is fantastic. We went alone, but for families this is a must see. We carried on and went to the oceanographic centre too. All on the Same site. Lots of places to eat, very easy to park, and relatively inexpensive. (€57 for both of us into the oceanographic and €16 for the sciences centre.

reviewnospace:
The buildings are looking rather sad and falling to pieces in places. We visited when they opened and were quite mind blowing.
The science museum has lost its way and really only of interest to school parties. Many exhibits are closed. It could be so much better !!! No direction. The staff are on sleep mode.
The new Tesla exhibit also fails to excite as it should.
One main building on the complex is closed and deserted. Lots of aimless walking and after all these years, a complete lack
of signs in the area to direct you to the complex and even the correct parking areas.
The oceanographic is excellent but very pricey at 28 euros each.

quote: Valencia's gift to us tourists ...and to the great people of Valencia :)
reviewnospace: The kids could not get enough of it. On a sunny day, it is so much fun. There is a train that would take you all around for 5 or 6 euro.

reviewnospace:
It is very nice to walk around these buildings. Going there is a must in Valencia. And you can take great pictures!
It is incredible to think about the way they did the columns and bridges. But I saw that at least one of them is empty now. I do not know its real use.
titleopinion:

reviewnospace: An amazing group of buildings. Although like many things in the City looking a little tired and in need of some TLC. Science museum great for kids loads of interactive exhibits.

reviewnospace: This is quite an interesting place, although personally I thought the architecture of the building more interesting than the contents! A lot of exhibits were out of action and whilst it is only 8 euros to get in, you have to pay extra for some of the exhibits/attractions.

reviewnospace:
This wonderful complex, situated at the end of the Turia, is one of the best examples of the work of Santiago Calatrava!
Outside the effect of light and water on the beautiful white buildings is everchanging with each step you take.
Inside (I visited the sciences building) the visit is so well organized and so enjoyable with all the information given and the possibility to experience first hand the fenomena explained, thanks to the interactive devices, makes it a destination where everyone can have fun learning!

Inside (I visited the sciences building) the visit is so well organized and so enjoyable with all the information given and the possibility to experience first hand the fenomena explained, thanks to the interactive devices, makes it a destination where everyone can have fun learning!

reviewnospace: I was amazed by the whole place, the architecture, the size. There is also a park that offers very welcomed shade when the weather is too hot. This is a spectacular place to see and admire with the option to have somethis to eat and drink at the end.

reviewnospace:
This is a remarkable example of lack of management and giving creative people their way. Lots of space, but not being used for a productive purpose. Looks great from the outside but is largely a Potemkin village. Nothing behind the facades. Trash in the flowerbeds. Empty liquor bottles on the steps. Pools are dirty.
Somebody thought this would be a saving grace for a city that needs industry and jobs. The place provided neither.
titleopinion:
Astonishing Architecture, But Wasted Space. This is a remarkable example of lack of management and giving creative people their way. Lots of space, but not being used for a productive purpose. Looks great from the outside but is largely a Potemkin village. Nothing behind the facades. Trash in the flowerbeds. Empty liquor bottles on the steps. Pools are dirty.
Somebody thought this would be a saving grace for a city that needs industry and jobs. The place provided neither.

reviewnospace:
I realized long time ago that I cared more about the nature and architecture of a place I visit than about the history of it. It might sound a bit superficial, but I guess it is just the way it is. The trip to Valencia was yet another confirmation of that.
As fascinating and beautiful the rest of Valencia was, every day I kept coming back to the City of Arts and Sciences as if drawn to it. It is a perfect way to start and end the day. Even if you have no time to visit the museum or the aquarium, just walking around and taking photos (even if you are not photography obsessed as I am), or sitting and observing, will suffice. The complex was just too beautiful to describe in words, and the experience was changing as every hour passed. The color of the sky reflected in the water, and the striking white and reflecting glass of the buildings seamed as if they were out of this world. It is was a photographers paradise.
But not just that. One needs time, days to visit everything. To visit el Museu de les Ciències Príncipe Felipe takes few hours at least, and it was interactive and involving, fun for both children and adults. L'Oceanogràfic is a whole day experience and definitely worth a visit. I did not enter the rest but even just sitting and drinking a surprisingly inexpensive glass of white wine in front of the El Palau de les Arts Reina Sofia with great music from a restaurant as a soundtrack, made me feel like I was in some sort of a futuristic movie.
It is a site not to be missed and as I look at the hundreds of photos I took i realized that I will definitely go back there, sooner or later!
titleopinion:

reviewnospace: Visiting the City of Arts and Sciences is probably the best thing to do here, in Valencia. It s a time consuming activity(and you definitely need this so you won t go mad with boredom) plus it s a beautiful architectural set to experience. I ve also seen Calatrava s work in Lisbon, but the fact that, here, all of the buildings are smaller and concentrated in a relatively small area, enhances that effect of being swept away by the magic of architecture.
titleopinion: Beaut!. Visiting the City of Arts and Sciences is probably the best thing to do here, in Valencia. It s a time consuming activity(and you definitely need this so you won t go mad with boredom) plus it s a beautiful architectural set to experience. I ve also seen Calatrava s work in Lisbon, but the fact that, here, all of the buildings are smaller and concentrated in a relatively small area, enhances that effect of being swept away by the magic of architecture.

quote: Like something out of a sci fi movie
reviewnospace: Wow! This Calatrava-designed complex will take your breath away. The IMAX 'eye' can open, and at times you can rent kayaks to paddle in the pools. A must experience for Valencia.

reviewnospace: The Arts and Sciences building is located in a less busy section of the city and offers a beautiful stroll that features a large water feature and fountains and, when we were there, one section had a chronological tour of the world's space exploration. This is one of those places where you can spend the day and not rush to get through the exhibits.

he Science Museum Príncipe Felipe is a lot of fun not only interesting - is interactive and we spent maybe 5 hours in there. Note* Second floor - all scientists stories are all in Spanish, here and there even in other section you might find only Spanish language, but is not a biggie.
You HAVE to go, with kids or not - is very enjoyable experience!!

reviewnospace: Beautiful architecture and lighting. Simply fantastic. I was with my sons in Feb and we all enjoyed it even a teen ager was impressed ;). Quite a few restaurants and aquarium there as well.

reviewnospace: We visited this in the heat of the summer and the welcome coolness of the buildings and water here is good to experience. It is as if you have entered a future time warp. We had lunch in a little restaurant underground within the complex. You can hire little boats and go on a miniature 'train' ride around the area. We took a regular bus journey to reach the City of the Arts and Sciences. Although away from the old city of Valencia, these futuristic buildings are worth giving a day up to see. Go and look. You will have not seen the like before.

reviewnospace: We visited the Oceanographic,( which is outstanding), as well as the Hemispheric and the science museum since we had prepaid through the Valencia card. These last 2 are rather disappointing once you get inside and pretty much a waste of time unless it's raining. Worth visiting to take photos of the actual buildings , which are quite impressive, but the science museum is getting rather dated in terms of exhibits and very child oriented. Best to hire a bike and explore them as part of the extended Turia gardens/ parkland , but allow at least an afternoon for the Oceanographic , which is really enjoyable and not to be missed !
titleopinion: Stay outside !. We visited the Oceanographic,( which is outstanding), as well as the Hemispheric and the science museum since we had prepaid through the Valencia card. These last 2 are rather disappointing once you get inside and pretty much a waste of time unless it's raining. Worth visiting to take photos of the actual buildings , which are quite impressive, but the science museum is getting rather dated in terms of exhibits and very child oriented. Best to hire a bike and explore them as part of the extended Turia gardens/ parkland , but allow at least an afternoon for the Oceanographic , which is really enjoyable and not to be missed !

quote: Admire the architecture but don't bother going in!
reviewnospace:
The complex is stunning and ran well over budget during construction but the museum itself is very odd. It's almost as if the function was an afterthought...
The internal flow is poor and the exhibits very basic. It is supposed to interactive so perhaps that accounts for the wear and tear and the child-like feel throughout.
Only some of the exhibits are multi lingual and I felt that this was an opportunity wasted on their part.
Very disappointing inside, fabulous outside!
titleopinion:

Only some of the exhibits are multi lingual and I felt that this was an opportunity wasted on their part.
Very disappointing inside, fabulous outside!

reviewnospace: The City of the Arts and Sciences is an cultural-educational complex displaying a futuristic architecture. It comprises The Palace of Arts Queen Sophia, the Umbracle, the Museum of Science Prince Felipe, the Hemispheric, the Agora, and the Oceanographic. All those buildings are located inside a wonderful park along with some artificial lakes. The most interesting is definitely the Oceanographic, a theme park centered around the oceans' wildlife.
titleopinion: An unforgettable place!. The City of the Arts and Sciences is an cultural-educational complex displaying a futuristic architecture. It comprises The Palace of Arts Queen Sophia, the Umbracle, the Museum of Science Prince Felipe, the Hemispheric, the Agora, and the Oceanographic. All those buildings are located inside a wonderful park along with some artificial lakes. The most interesting is definitely the Oceanographic, a theme park centered around the oceans' wildlife.

quote: Pretty place but not good value for money
reviewnospace: Oceanographic was good, the cinema was also good but needs a technology update because of new virtual reality, also some of the language headsets were faulty. Compared to everything else cheap in the city- for 130+ euros, it wasn't worth it. The science museum was poor with few interesting exhibits although it was very interactive. I heard it used to be better because they changed around. Definitely worth walking or cycling around the buildings.

You had headphones which translated to your language.

quote: A must see for the sheer architecture but buildings seem empty
reviewnospace: This was a strange experience. I would say the area of the Arts and Sciences are a must see in Valencia purely for the quite jaw-dropping architecture on show in this area. The Arts museum, Science museum, Hemisphere and few other buildings and bridge are all designed by the same architect and the style is very striking and eye catching. Would recommend coming around for a walk and taking some snaps. On closer inspection of the buildings there was vast empty spaces with some having nothing inside, so I'm not sure what they are used for. The area was also a little eerily quiet. Maybe it used for exhibitions at certain times of the year. But in any case would thoroughly recommend setting aside 2 hours or so to explore the area as it is worth seeing with your eyes!

reviewnospace:
What a stunning architectural display from the renowned Santiago Calatrava! If you have the time, approach it through the dried Rio Turia riverbed that has been converted into an excellent urban park, so that you can enjoy approaching the City from a distance.

The structures – framed by ample use of water – have to be a photographer’s delight; but even walking around these buildings without entering them (or photographing them!) has to be the main tourist attraction of Valencia outside its old city.
titleopinion:
Do not miss this!. What a stunning architectural display from the renowned Santiago Calatrava! If you have the time, approach it through the dried Rio Turia riverbed that has been converted into an excellent urban park, so that you can enjoy approaching the City from a distance.

The structures – framed by ample use of water – have to be a photographer’s delight; but even walking around these buildings without entering them (or photographing them!) has to be the main tourist attraction of Valencia outside its old city.

reviewnospace: Visiting this famous architectural extravaganza of Colatrava was one of our main reasons for a visit to Valencia and it did not disappoint. Stunning buildings. My only disappointment was that there were no performances at the opera and we did not arrive in time for tours of the building at 11:30 and 1:30 in April.
titleopinion: Worth the trip. Visiting this famous architectural extravaganza of Colatrava was one of our main reasons for a visit to Valencia and it did not disappoint. Stunning buildings. My only disappointment was that there were no performances at the opera and we did not arrive in time for tours of the building at 11:30 and 1:30 in April.

quote: Brilliant works of art and architecture
reviewnospace: We rented bikes and rode through the Turia gardens to the city of arts and sciences. These buildings have been designed by world famous architect Santiago Calatrava and are one of the main reasons we visited Valencia. It is amazing to see how such complex forms have been designed and constructed. Such a contrast to the nearby old city area of Valencia. We watched a show at the hemisferic imax dome theatre which was nothing spectacular.
titleopinion: Brilliant works of art and architecture. We rented bikes and rode through the Turia gardens to the city of arts and sciences. These buildings have been designed by world famous architect Santiago Calatrava and are one of the main reasons we visited Valencia. It is amazing to see how such complex forms have been designed and constructed. Such a contrast to the nearby old city area of Valencia. We watched a show at the hemisferic imax dome theatre which was nothing spectacular.

reviewnospace:
It's slightly out of town and not on the metro, so we grabbed a cab (v cheap in Valencia). Tickets are required to go into everything, and the queues were horrendous, so we didn't bother, and peeping inside some of the buildings were empty (a white elephant?). That said, it really is worth the effort to walk the whole of the CAS, the structures, designs and outside exhibits are fantastic .We spent the morning strolling along the riverbed and around, and headed back to town for lunch.
- Did I miss going inside the Oceanography? Not sure! But I'd love to go to a production at the opera house/ theatre one day.. when it's open!
What's really daft is that even the museum (tourist) shop is inside the pay-to-enter complex.
