quote: Almost too much to take in
reviewnospace: The best audience for the current exhibitions at least would be teenagers. Great info on science and interesting hands on displays. For me there was just too much info to take it all in and I skipped about half the exhibits. Many exhibits were also not working properly but I guess this will be likely to happen with the huge amount of visitors. I also went to the Pixar exhibition. I think this is for real pixar geeks, I enjoyed the figurines and understanding the process, but the rest was just filler up. Fab figures from Monsters inc iuside the exhibit though. You will need a few hours here to take it in properly. Parking is available right next door at 2.40 Euro per hour. I ate at the cafe and the sandwich was quite nice, a three course meal was available at the restaurant for 15.50 Euro.
titleopinion: Almost too much to take in. The best audience for the current exhibitions at least would be teenagers. Great info on science and interesting hands on displays. For me there was just too much info to take it all in and I skipped about half the exhibits. Many exhibits were also not working properly but I guess this will be likely to happen with the huge amount of visitors. I also went to the Pixar exhibition. I think this is for real pixar geeks, I enjoyed the figurines and understanding the process, but the rest was just filler up. Fab figures from Monsters inc iuside the exhibit though. You will need a few hours here to take it in properly. Parking is available right next door at 2.40 Euro per hour. I ate at the cafe and the sandwich was quite nice, a three course meal was available at the restaurant for 15.50 Euro.

quote: A sci-fi touch to the city
reviewnospace:
Valencia is a city with tiny streets and these massive futuristic buildings which can be found in the City of Arts and Sciences add a different touch to Valencia's image.

Amazing architecture which is really astonishing to watch and a long road stretching alongside the sci-fi buildings which makes a great way to take some photos!
titleopinion:
A sci-fi touch to the city. Valencia is a city with tiny streets and these massive futuristic buildings which can be found in the City of Arts and Sciences add a different touch to Valencia's image.

Amazing architecture which is really astonishing to watch and a long road stretching alongside the sci-fi buildings which makes a great way to take some photos!

reviewnospace: Words can hardly do justice to this stunning place. An absolute MUST place to visit when in Valencia. Although the quite pricey entrance fee to the Science Museum may put some people off, it's still an excellent attraction. Some of the 'hands-on' exhibits were a bit of a let down, but they are catering for young and old alike, so, with that in mind, I would still recommend going inside. If, however, you only choose to wander around the exterior, then you will still leave feeling rather humbled by the amazing architecture and settings.
titleopinion: Out of this world!. Words can hardly do justice to this stunning place. An absolute MUST place to visit when in Valencia. Although the quite pricey entrance fee to the Science Museum may put some people off, it's still an excellent attraction. Some of the 'hands-on' exhibits were a bit of a let down, but they are catering for young and old alike, so, with that in mind, I would still recommend going inside. If, however, you only choose to wander around the exterior, then you will still leave feeling rather humbled by the amazing architecture and settings.

reviewnospace: It is a very interesting place for the little ones learn in a very dynamic way. In summer they have many activities.
titleopinion: AMAZING!. It is a very interesting place for the little ones learn in a very dynamic way. In summer they have many activities.

reviewnospace:
In general VLC is a typical spanish city with all the tiny streets and the old city center and so on - but than in the middle of the city la ciudad de las artes y sciences appears - an incredible modern area of amazing buldings, pools, nature and entertainment possibilities.

It includes the opera, the science museum, a 4D cinema, l'umbracle/mya (night club) and the oceanografico.
every single part of it is worth a visit!
titleopinion:
Modern part of the city. In general VLC is a typical spanish city with all the tiny streets and the old city center and so on - but than in the middle of the city la ciudad de las artes y sciences appears - an incredible modern area of amazing buldings, pools, nature and entertainment possibilities.

It includes the opera, the science museum, a 4D cinema, l'umbracle/mya (night club) and the oceanografico.
every single part of it is worth a visit!

reviewnospace:
On the photo it looks a set of a Science Fiction movie. In reality it looks a bit less like it. Still it was nice to be there. There are a couple of buildings next o each other, a lot of people walking around. We went in one of these and watched two educational movies about space and about water world. We enjoyed it very much.
When we finished our visit, we wanted to go to the other side, towards the beach, but we couldn't pass to the other side. Then we had to go back to the "City" and then catch a cab. For a tourist who walks a lot, this was an unnecessary waste of energy.
titleopinion:
Looks better on a photo. On the photo it looks a set of a Science Fiction movie. In reality it looks a bit less like it. Still it was nice to be there. reviewnospace: The architecture of all these amazing buildings are truly out of this galaxy!! It is as though you are encountered with a futuristic blend of old and new mixed into a world of the present. The light of the overpowering sun glazed the surfaces of the buildings which brought them more life! The Palau de les Arts Reina Sofia was being renovated and oh what a joy to the eyes. A truly artistic creation of heart and wonder. At a glance you think " outer space, creative, futuristic" almost as though roman- like-galactic fusion. Just wonderful. What a creation! The other buildings, of the cinematic and scientific world, are also gems of creative wonder.The whole site is just amazing. I am in awe of these buildings. To see them are a great honour to the architect and creators and builders!!

reviewnospace: When we visited this area we only took in the external locations including all of the buildings on the site.I would recommend this to anyone,an architectural marvel with the added benefit of being accessible from the Turia,go see it!!
titleopinion: WOW quite incredibe!. When we visited this area we only took in the external locations including all of the buildings on the site.I would recommend this to anyone,an architectural marvel with the added benefit of being accessible from the Turia,go see it!!

quote: Must see and not to be missed
reviewnospace: Although some of the buildings were closed to us during the day. We spent well over 2 hours inside the science centre and more time walking around taking photos of this first part of the complex. A coffee and pastry was enjoyed. Then we crossed over to the biographic park with the sealife centre etc and this was extraodinary in it's design to say the least! Save lunch or early dinner for this part of the visit as there are plenty of places to eat and cater for every taste. We didn't stay for the dolphin show as you had to take your seat an hour before the start which did not suit. Take as much time as you can for this full complex as it is a hot area to visit during the day in summer and enjoy the full experience with plenty of relaxing pit stops!
titleopinion: Must see and not to be missed. Although some of the buildings were closed to us during the day. Save lunch or early dinner for this part of the visit as there are plenty of places to eat and cater for every taste. Take as much time as you can for this full complex as it is a hot area to visit during the day in summer and enjoy the full experience with plenty of relaxing pit stops!

reviewnospace:
We started our day in Valencia with the City of Arts and Science and it was a real surprise for us to see such a development. We all thought that we would see only an old city.
Walk around, enjoy the buildings, take the small train to the gardens. Just a great architectural delight
titleopinion:
Interesting place. We started our day in Valencia with the City of Arts and Science and it was a real surprise for us to see such a development. We all thought that we would see only an old city.
Walk around, enjoy the buildings, take the small train to the gardens. Just a great architectural delight

quote: Go visit your local middle school science fair INSTEAD!!
reviewnospace:
It's a very beautiful area to walk around and admire the outside architecture. The inside, however, does not provide a satisfactory experience and is not worth the entrance fee.

The information, even before you have entered the exhibition is poorly displayed and without any knowledge of how we perceive information. The exhibition itself was terrible, so confusing with no coherence at all and no information to tell you how to go about it.

Most of the inside space was left empty, it kinda of felt like there was no interest in creating meaningful exhibitions. You can just aswell visit your local middle school science fair and you will have a better time.
titleopinion:
Go visit your local middle school science fair INSTEAD!!. It's a very beautiful area to walk around and admire the outside architecture. The inside, however, does not provide a satisfactory experience and is not worth the entrance fee.

The information, even before you have entered the exhibition is poorly displayed and without any knowledge of how we perceive information. The exhibition itself was terrible, so confusing with no coherence at all and no information to tell you how to go about it.

Most of the inside space was left empty, it kinda of felt like there was no interest in creating meaningful exhibitions. You can just aswell visit your local middle school science fair and you will have a better time.

reviewnospace: If there was only one venue I could recommend to a friend visiting Valencia, it would be this! This place is stunning at all times of the day (do not miss it by night). This huge futuristic educational complex designed for Valencia by Calatrava will transport you into the 22nd century. Pictures do not do it justice. It is well worth it to visit all 5 structures and take a walk around the luxurious landscape of clear water spaces and greenery. And - of course - go inside and explore what each structure has to offer. There is no equal in Europe.
titleopinion: Breathtaking and one-of-a-kind. If there was only one venue I could recommend to a friend visiting Valencia, it would be this! This place is stunning at all times of the day (do not miss it by night). This huge futuristic educational complex designed for Valencia by Calatrava will transport you into the 22nd century. Pictures do not do it justice. It is well worth it to visit all 5 structures and take a walk around the luxurious landscape of clear water spaces and greenery. And - of course - go inside and explore what each structure has to offer. There is no equal in Europe.

reviewnospace:
Was not so able to go inside and visit but it was a great sight to look at in the bright sunny day.
It would be more interesting if I get a chance to see from Inside.

reviewnospace: impressive set of buildings, must see in all weather conditions (sunny is nicer of course). Currently the Opera is partially in restoration but still worth visiting. Impressive to see the moving parts of the buildings. There are free toilets in the "science museum" building

Modern architecture is fantastic.
Easy to get around the city.
Will return.

quote: Not quite up to par with earlier visits
reviewnospace: Yesterday we took one of our sons and his family - wife, one teenager and two young adults - for a day here. It was a bit disappointing due to the number of hands-on exhibits that were out of order. Maybe too everyone was tired because of the heat and the long and very satisfactory visit beforehand to the Oceanographic. The architecture is stunning although in need of some maintenance and it certainly would be nice to have many, many more benches sprinkled around the landscape for those weary of walking to have a brief rest.

The architecture is stunning although in need of some maintenance and it certainly would be nice to have many, many more benches sprinkled around the landscape for those weary of walking to have a brief rest.

quote: A Nice place to walk through... And visit the zoo/aquarium
reviewnospace: I am not this architect biggest fan but it is a nice place to walk and the zoo is very nice to visit. Eventually, it is worth it!!
titleopinion: A Nice place to walk through... And visit the zoo/aquarium . I am not this architect biggest fan but it is a nice place to walk and the zoo is very nice to visit. Eventually, it is worth it!!

reviewnospace:
The spherical structure of this part of the city makes you think that Aliens have landed in here and these are their ships ...
It is indeed a breath taking moments when you first see such huge buildings lies on pure slate of water ,, as you get inside the first building underground there are many cafes and restaurants and sure not forgetting the huge theater dome if you'd like to watch a 3D family movie.
And as you find behind the second spaceship like building there you'll see a big museum takes the name of the city itself, parts to many sections and exhibits like science, aviation and space history, Arts and finally the Marvel section of characters ;)
It is a majestic part of valencia where you need days to figure out all of it's mysteries.

It was a bit disappointing - we expected it to be more modern and with more exhibit items. The above floor was too hot!
The architecture was amasing.

reviewnospace: beautiful place. Feels like city of the future. Lots of air, space and amazing architecture. When in Valencia one should see it, even if just briefly

reviewnospace: This modern "city" is so so beautiful! I could stay there all day and just watch. Although the Opera was under maintenance, it such an impressive building! My favorite part is the Hemisferic and the Science Museum building, with the clear blue water in front and the bridge. Fantastic :)

quote: A very fun and educational museum
reviewnospace:
The city of the Arts and Science isn't like any other boring museum.Here you can learn about science by playing interactive games or watching videos.You can understand complicated phisics and chemistry in few minutes.
It's a place to must visit while in Valencia.
titleopinion:
A very fun and educational museum. The city of the Arts and Science isn't like any other boring museum.Here you can learn about science by playing interactive games or watching videos.You can understand complicated phisics and chemistry in few minutes.
It's a place to must visit while in Valencia.

quote: Looking a little sad but work underway!
reviewnospace: On a brief trip to Valencia the group of unique buildings were second on our list to visit. We were disappointed, primarily due to the fact that this area needs a jolly good spruce up! However it seems that work is underway! Diggers, scaffolding, materials and the lack of water in the pools were testament to this. On reflection, had we known, we would have remained in the historic area of the city instead.

reviewnospace: This is a must see in Valencia. The building are so unique and cool. There is something here for everyone. You could spend a whole day here easily. Look in to combination tickets before you go to try and save some money.
titleopinion: A unique and memorable experience. This is a must see in Valencia. The building are so unique and cool. There is something here for everyone. You could spend a whole day here easily. Look in to combination tickets before you go to try and save some money.

quote: Needs some money spent on it
reviewnospace: I visited here with friends, before we headed to the aquarium. It was nice to wander about the buildings, although some of them did look like they needed repairs!
titleopinion: Needs some money spent on it. I visited here with friends, before we headed to the aquarium. It was nice to wander about the buildings, although some of them did look like they needed repairs!

reviewnospace: We've been to the science museum (we haven't seen the arts museum so I cannot comment on that). On the ground floor first there is a cafeteria and only after you'll see the restaurant (we had a snack at the cafeteria but if we had known the restaurant where seating is nicer was right after we'd have rather eaten there) and the museum shop. The first floor of the science museum holds most for children. We had fun with an experiment where you taste candy and try to guess to flavour (it's harder than we thought but we had a laugh) but the best thing about the first floor (if you are traveling with children) is the playroom. The playroom opens only several times throughout the day (I think 5-6 times) and you must briefly register to get in but it is great. There is a big house that children can construct (there are bricks, a crane, wheelbarrow, helmets, etc); a big water game, animals etc. our kids wouldn't leave the playroom.
titleopinion: Children loved it. We've been to the science museum (we haven't seen the arts museum so I cannot comment on that). On the ground floor first there is a cafeteria and only after you'll see the restaurant (we had a snack at the cafeteria but if we had known the restaurant where seating is nicer was right after we'd have rather eaten there) and the museum shop. The first floor of the science museum holds most for children. reviewnospace: This is truly a group of wonderful, original, thought provoking structures. Individual meaning for each of us perhaps. They shimmer....they shine....they invoke wonder. The heights of each, the colouring, the quietness of the pool, yet allowing the children to play and enjoy. The surrounding gardens, flower, the original elevator structure. There are flowered former river beds, beautiful parks, One should spend at least a day to really appreciate the principle sites of this beautiful city.

They shimmer....they shine....they invoke wonder. The heights of each, the colouring, the quietness of the pool, yet allowing the children to play and enjoy. The surrounding gardens, flower, the original elevator structure. There are flowered former river beds, beautiful parks, One should spend at least a day to really appreciate the principle sites of this beautiful city.

quote: Almost felt we were in Tomorrow land!
reviewnospace: A spectacular complex. Visual treat. Modern almost sci fi like. This was the building in the movie Tomorrow land starring George Clooney. It has a very stylistic twist to it.
titleopinion: Almost felt we were in Tomorrow land!. A spectacular complex. Visual treat. Modern almost sci fi like. This was the building in the movie Tomorrow land starring George Clooney. It has a very stylistic twist to it.

reviewnospace: Well worth visiting lots to see , pity it was not open late at night because when it is lit up at night you can see its splendor in full ..... very futuristic ...with a nice terrace bar and night club underneath....Top totty included
titleopinion: architecture. Well worth visiting lots to see , pity it was not open late at night because when it is lit up at night you can see its splendor in full ..... very futuristic ...with a nice terrace bar and night club underneath....Top totty included

reviewnospace: Nothing ever disappoints when you see the majestic modern arcs and vibrant purples of this modern Valencian landmark. This must be a stop on your visit, if only to walk the beautiful promenades. Personal favorites include Oceanographic and Science buildings.

reviewnospace: This is the most amazing outdoor space - truly beautiful and great attractions/ museums. The Aquarium was truly fantastic one of the best places we've ever visited. Again the whole design of the place is something special. Loved the different zones. Despite being busy it was surprisingly peaceful and cool.

Again the whole design of the place is something special. Loved the different zones. Despite being busy it was surprisingly peaceful and cool.

reviewnospace:
It was a really nice place to have seen, and when walking around not only outside this but all the other buildings close by you are amazed at what people can accomplish.
Inside there were some blueprints of the buildings and before and after pictured that were really nice.
There were many things of education and I think it would be an awesome place for a schooltrip, well if it is line it was on July 7th of 2015. Information about perception and hearing, and information about the Earth and wood and materials. Things that every one should know a little bit about.

reviewnospace: This area is well and truly worth visiting. You can walk around the area and the old river bed. Best to hire a bike if you like that form of travel.

reviewnospace:
This is a modern architectural inspiration - it is just fabulous to walk around and be in this fabulous space.
If you are a fan of urban planning and modern architectural design, don't miss the opportunity to be here.
titleopinion:
Wow!. This is a modern architectural inspiration - it is just fabulous to walk around and be in this fabulous space.
If you are a fan of urban planning and modern architectural design, don't miss the opportunity to be here.

reviewnospace: For me the City of Arts and Sciences was a mixed bag. I really enjoyed the Museum of Science, which I felt well worth the entrance fee (8 euros before any discounts). Don't miss the top floor, where I found the best exhibits (currently about genetics and electronic communications). The Oceanografic I found a bit disappointing, after having visited Barcelona's aquarium a few days before; if you plan to be in Barcelona, go to its aquarium and skip Valencia's. The whole park of the City of Arts and Sciences contains lovely modern architecture and is great for photography. However, while there are signposts about, sometimes they aren't clear, with the result you can circle around a building before finding the entrance. This is a bit frustrating on a hot day.
titleopinion: A mixed bag.... For me the City of Arts and Sciences was a mixed bag. I really enjoyed the Museum of Science, which I felt well worth the entrance fee (8 euros before any discounts). Don't miss the top floor, where I found the best exhibits (currently about genetics and electronic communications). The Oceanografic I found a bit disappointing, after having visited Barcelona's aquarium a few days before; if you plan to be in Barcelona, go to its aquarium and skip Valencia's. The whole park of the City of Arts and Sciences contains lovely modern architecture and is great for photography. However, while there are signposts about, sometimes they aren't clear, with the result you can circle around a building before finding the entrance. This is a bit frustrating on a hot day.

reviewnospace: Visit the chromosome forrest, then the space expo, then onto the largest aquarium in Europe. This needs a whole day. Walk at night under the Umbarcle and smell the scented trees. Or try to walk in the air bubbles like ASA astronauts. Make sure you catch a few sessions in the Hemispheric, then stroll in the parc up to the Palau de la Musica, and get lucky catching a jazz show at night. Offers a complete two day adventure packed with learning, excitement and awe.
titleopinion: Tomorrowland!. Visit the chromosome forrest, then the space expo, then onto the largest aquarium in Europe. This needs a whole day. Walk at night under the Umbarcle and smell the scented trees. Or try to walk in the air bubbles like ASA astronauts. Make sure you catch a few sessions in the Hemispheric, then stroll in the parc up to the Palau de la Musica, and get lucky catching a jazz show at night. Offers a complete two day adventure packed with learning, excitement and awe.

reviewnospace: The Palau de les Arts offers guided tours: take one! Walk the grounds during the day and come back at night to see them lit. The whole complex is a beautiful example of great engineering and sensuous architecture that is strongly rooted in the Spanish tradition, and with clear connection to nature.
titleopinion: Beautiful, uplifting, feast for senses.... The Palau de les Arts offers guided tours: take one! Walk the grounds during the day and come back at night to see them lit. The whole complex is a beautiful example of great engineering and sensuous architecture that is strongly rooted in the Spanish tradition, and with clear connection to nature.

reviewnospace: The architecture is breathtaking and magnificent. I recommend people who love architecture to visit it at sunset and take great pictures of the building group. The Aquarium by Felix Candela nearby is also worth visiting.
titleopinion: Masterpiece by Santiago Calatrava. The architecture is breathtaking and magnificent. I recommend people who love architecture to visit it at sunset and take great pictures of the building group. The Aquarium by Felix Candela nearby is also worth visiting.

reviewnospace: One of the most beautiful places I've ever visited! The tranquility and utterly beautiful architecture of this place was just breath taking.
titleopinion: julztravels Valencia, Spain 2014. One of the most beautiful places I've ever visited! The tranquility and utterly beautiful architecture of this place was just breath taking.

quote: Worth a trip to Valencia although under repair
reviewnospace: Our entire side trip to Valencia (from Barcelona) was planned to see these buildings designed by Santiago Calatrava. Our biggest disappointment upon approaching was to see about half of the Opera House covered by cloth as they were working on it. Upon investigation, we learned that tiles on the building had been falling off and they have been repairing it for some time. Actually learning about these issues was intriguing and a source of interest to me. Some of the fountains and pools around the building were not working either, and they had one section of the greenhouse closed for a private party. But overall the trip was still worth it to see the beauty of these buildings and I would highly recommend a visit.
titleopinion: Worth a trip to Valencia although under repair. Our entire side trip to Valencia (from Barcelona) was planned to see these buildings designed by Santiago Calatrava. Our biggest disappointment upon approaching was to see about half of the Opera House covered by cloth as they were working on it. Upon investigation, we learned that tiles on the building had been falling off and they have been repairing it for some time. Actually learning about these issues was intriguing and a source of interest to me. Some of the fountains and pools around the building were not working either, and they had one section of the greenhouse closed for a private party. But overall the trip was still worth it to see the beauty of these buildings and I would highly recommend a visit.

reviewnospace: This is a great place with wonderful architecture as if aliens have landed! It is well worth a visit when you are in Valencia. We loved it.
titleopinion: Fabulous place . This is a great place with wonderful architecture as if aliens have landed! It is well worth a visit when you are in Valencia. We loved it.

reviewnospace:
Corny but really like being on another planet. We didn't enter any of the exhibits but did enjoy walking around and enjoying the architecture and ambience. It is really a must see if you are in Valencia. Search out Valencia Segway as they run tours down the the park from the city centre, Segway is so easy to master and such great fun tearing through the park.
At night time the science part is all lit up and one part turns into a night club, the Umbricale, trouble is it doesn't open until midnight!
titleopinion:
Life on Mars. Corny but really like being on another planet. We didn't enter any of the exhibits but did enjoy walking around and enjoying the architecture and ambience. It is really a must see if you are in Valencia. Search out Valencia Segway as they run tours down the the park from the city centre, Segway is so easy to master and such great fun tearing through the park.
At night time the science part is all lit up and one part turns into a night club, the Umbricale, trouble is it doesn't open until midnight!

quote: A day at the City of the Arts and Sciences
reviewnospace: The Aquarium is fantastic. As for the Science Museum, unless you have children or are simply a science geek that likes to push buttons at exhibits, there are other places in Valencia to better spend your time. Nothing is presented in English.
titleopinion: A day at the City of the Arts and Sciences. The Aquarium is fantastic. As for the Science Museum, unless you have children or are simply a science geek that likes to push buttons at exhibits, there are other places in Valencia to better spend your time. Nothing is presented in English.

reviewnospace: Take a walk and immerse yourself in some very innovative and beautiful buildings. Located out of the downtown core, it's easy to reach by bus and can be part of a trip to other attractions in the area.
titleopinion: Fabulous architecture. Take a walk and immerse yourself in some very innovative and beautiful buildings. Located out of the downtown core, it's easy to reach by bus and can be part of a trip to other attractions in the area.

reviewnospace: this is a great architectural wonder although some local people will not agree as it has been involved in some financial scandals. it is under repair at the moment since the tiles known as "trencats" tiles broken up into small pieces and then put together like a jigsaw puzzle. The activities inside need to be improved and really for what it's worth it is a little dear. but just walking around the grounds is fantastic in itself. great fotos can be taken here as well if you like archtecture!
titleopinion: great architecture. this is a great architectural wonder although some local people will not agree as it has been involved in some financial scandals. it is under repair at the moment since the tiles known as "trencats" tiles broken up into small pieces and then put together like a jigsaw puzzle. The activities inside need to be improved and really for what it's worth it is a little dear. but just walking around the grounds is fantastic in itself. great fotos can be taken here as well if you like archtecture!

reviewnospace: Popping out of crystal blue water lined w cracked tiles and only 1 meter deep, these structure seem to be of another world. We took a bike ride around Valencia and stopped here for a photo session. WOW, you must go and take a look. One structure you'll see is an eye ball w eye lids, very modern!
titleopinion: Space age architecture. Popping out of crystal blue water lined w cracked tiles and only 1 meter deep, these structure seem to be of another world. We took a bike ride around Valencia and stopped here for a photo session. WOW, you must go and take a look. One structure you'll see is an eye ball w eye lids, very modern!

quote: Visit the AQUARIUM, well worth the entry fee
reviewnospace: By far the best aquarium I have visited in the world! Its huge and is kept so clean! a vast array of animals, good dolphin show, lots of varied fish and other wildlife, definitely worth the visit!and the entry fee

reviewnospace: We visited the City of the Arts and Sciences but we were very disapointed because lot of experiments didn't work and nobody was there for avoiding bad behavoirs.
titleopinion: Disapointment. We visited the City of the Arts and Sciences but we were very disapointed because lot of experiments didn't work and nobody was there for avoiding bad behavoirs.

reviewnospace: We loved the area - all the buildings are spectacular and well maintained. We thought the science museum was ok - there was some good hands-on things but whole chunks were Spanish only so we had to walk past when we would've liked to have read them. It was very quiet on a Friday afternoon. We thought it would take about four hours but you could easily do it in two.

We thought the science museum was ok - there was some good hands-on things but whole chunks were Spanish only so we had to walk past when we would've liked to have read them. It was very quiet on a Friday afternoon. We thought it would take about four hours but you could easily do it in two.

reviewnospace: Splendid modern architecture, that got the city of Valencia close to the financial collaps. Still worth a day or at least half to wonder around all these fantastic buildings.

The architecture of the city of arts and science is a must see.
We spend some time waking around this wonderful architecture.

We weren't that interested in visiting all the exhibitions within the builds and just visited the aquarium.

I was there on a day trip with my kids 14 and 16.
Amazed by the architecture of the buildings.
Great exhibitions and very recommendable.
titleopinion:
Amazing architecture coupled with museaum. I was there on a day trip with my kids 14 and 16.
Amazed by the architecture of the buildings.

reviewnospace: Designed by famous Spanish architects, Santiago Calatrava and Felix Candela, this amazing complex is alone worth the visit to Valencia. It contains an IMAX Cinema (L’Hemisferic), interactive science museum, the largest oceanographic aquarium in Europe and Opera house with performing arts center. You can spend the whole day here, visiting its treasures not to mention the fantastic views and camera objectives.
titleopinion: Hard to describe!. Designed by famous Spanish architects, Santiago Calatrava and Felix Candela, this amazing complex is alone worth the visit to Valencia. It contains an IMAX Cinema (L’Hemisferic), interactive science museum, the largest oceanographic aquarium in Europe and Opera house with performing arts center. You can spend the whole day here, visiting its treasures not to mention the fantastic views and camera objectives.

reviewnospace: We visited the Science museum and it was brilliant and absolutely huge! The children loved all the experiments that you can do & seeing all the old fashioned TV's, radios and telephones. It really has something for everyone and was very interesting!
titleopinion: Great place to visit. We visited the Science museum and it was brilliant and absolutely huge! The children loved all the experiments that you can do & seeing all the old fashioned TV's, radios and telephones. It really has something for everyone and was very interesting!

reviewnospace: Amazing place, beautiful animals! I have never seen anything like it before. I recommend visiting the official website also, to schedule your visit. It will take a whole day to go through it all, it is quite large (incl. Oceanograph and the Hemisferic). Worth every penny
titleopinion: Fantastic. Amazing place, beautiful animals! I have never seen anything like it before. I recommend visiting the official website also, to schedule your visit. It will take a whole day to go through it all, it is quite large (incl. Oceanograph and the Hemisferic). Worth every penny

reviewnospace: Oceanografic - a terrific experience! Exotic and Tropical fish and creatures. Loved the Sharks and Sea Lions best! Science centre with interesting interactive displays. The whole complex is beautiful to look at and well designed.
titleopinion: Day out in Valencia. Oceanografic - a terrific experience! Exotic and Tropical fish and creatures. Loved the Sharks and Sea Lions best! Science centre with interesting interactive displays. The whole complex is beautiful to look at and well designed.

quote: Amazing place for photos - very futuristic
reviewnospace: I actually just stopped by because I was planning to visit Valencia (day trip from Madrid) and when I arrive i was mesmerized at this place. I am surprised they don't shoot a lot more movies here. The place was almost completely empty which was even more surprising since it was so cool. Its actually very close to the beach and I guess most people find that more interesting. The beach in Valencia is NOT worth the trip. I have seen a small pond in my local park with bigger waves than this place. Lots of nude sunbathers as well so beware!
titleopinion: Amazing place for photos - very futuristic. I actually just stopped by because I was planning to visit Valencia (day trip from Madrid) and when I arrive i was mesmerized at this place. quote: Excellent place to visit and take photographs

titleopinion: Excellent place to visit and take photographs. This place will wow you and you can not stop taking photographs! Love area to visit and relax. There is lot more to in this park and you can easily spend some hours here. (if it is not to hot!)

reviewnospace: When we visited, the "flagship" building (the opera) was being repaired so it was almost enveloped with scaffolding. However, the other buildings were lovely. We did not go into any buildings. A good place to visit if you're a modern architecture or Calatrava fan.
titleopinion: Modern architecture. When we visited, the "flagship" building (the opera) was being repaired so it was almost enveloped with scaffolding. However, the other buildings were lovely. We did not go into any buildings. A good place to visit if you're a modern architecture or Calatrava fan.

reviewnospace: If you are interested in current architecture this is a must see. Unfortunately the construction details were lacking and some of the buildings are already failing. I got into an interesting discussion with local architecture students about if these buildings are sculpture or architecture. They said sculpture because as buildings they failed to meet the needs of the services housed in them and were poorly detailed and failing from weather exposure in less than 10 years. Fun debate with them.
titleopinion: Sculpture or Architecture. If you are interested in current architecture this is a must see. Unfortunately the construction details were lacking and some of the buildings are already failing. I got into an interesting discussion with local architecture students about if these buildings are sculpture or architecture. They said sculpture because as buildings they failed to meet the needs of the services housed in them and were poorly detailed and failing from weather exposure in less than 10 years. reviewnospace: A stunning ensemble of contemporary buildings. The extensive site includes a science museum, concert hall and oceanarium, but you really don't need to go into the buildings to appreciate them. At the moment the concert hall is undergoin extensive restoration, but the rest of the site is up and running.
titleopinion: Futuristic Architecture. A stunning ensemble of contemporary buildings. The extensive site includes a science museum, concert hall and oceanarium, but you really don't need to go into the buildings to appreciate them. At the moment the concert hall is undergoin extensive restoration, but the rest of the site is up and running.

quote: Good looking, but inside is lacking
reviewnospace: Don't go if you are a science nerd, you will be dissapointed, it's very child friendly though and is aimed squarely at kids. They have really poor models, nothing is real.
titleopinion: Good looking, but inside is lacking. Don't go if you are a science nerd, you will be dissapointed, it's very child friendly though and is aimed squarely at kids. They have really poor models, nothing is real.

reviewnospace: Interesting displays of all parts of human existence and evolution of technology over time. Only negative would be the museum was really hot - its design clearly has some limitations as well with so much glass.
titleopinion: Interesting look at human existence. Interesting displays of all parts of human existence and evolution of technology over time. Only negative would be the museum was really hot - its design clearly has some limitations as well with so much glass.

reviewnospace:
I loved it. One of the most impressive places I have ever seen in my life. There's nothing quite like it and I love how it contrasts with the more classic look of Valencia.

Make sure you book the whole day for it. We didn't and had to skip some of it due to time.

Also, don't miss it at night.

Well worth the visit!

reviewnospace: Must visit, to walk around, make various pictures from different angles. Go inside to see exhibitions. Very interesting.

reviewnospace: Well, being in Valencia is always best time for me and everytime Im there I need to go to the city of Arts and Sciences:) just for a walk, to sit on the bunch, to feel the atmosphere in a place that is never crowded. A real pearl of architecture full of water, mixed with blue and white colors that are taking your breath away. for sure it wasn't my last visit.

quote: Impressive buildings, pity about the content
reviewnospace: The buildings are wonderful and very impressive, but unfortunately they seem in want of suitable content. We did not go to the aquarium, so I cannot comment on that, but the Science centre was more like a publicity centre for companies that had decided to sponsor the buildings. It felt like a PR exercise going through the exhibits, not an educational and uplifting experience. If you go merely to admire the architecture under brilliant blue skies, you will not be disappointed.

reviewnospace: Its an architectural masterpiece of the modern era..... Never never never ever.... Never ever miss it!
titleopinion: An architectural masterpiece....... Ultimate . Its an architectural masterpiece of the modern era..... Never never never ever.... Never ever miss it!

reviewnospace: I really didn't expect to get much from the area except a quick glance at some architecture that wouldn't seem any different from what I saw in pictures. What I found instead was the heart of a city teaming with all kinds of people socializing over jogging, walking, or just sitting and dangling their feet into the pool surrounding the buildings. It was the richest park scene I've ever encountered. I'd compare it to the life around Lake Pontchartrain in New Orleans or Central Park in New York, but honestly, much more social in that you could hear so much more laughing among young and old. Loved it much more than I expected to.
titleopinion: Surprisingly wonderful. I really didn't expect to get much from the area except a quick glance at some architecture that wouldn't seem any different from what I saw in pictures. What I found instead was the heart of a city teaming with all kinds of people socializing over jogging, walking, or just sitting and dangling their feet into the pool surrounding the buildings. It was the richest park scene I've ever encountered. I'd compare it to the life around Lake Pontchartrain in New Orleans or Central Park in New York, but honestly, much more social in that you could hear so much more laughing among young and old. Loved it much more than I expected to.

quote: Science fare were lots of exhibition pieces didn't work
reviewnospace:
Part of the Ocean park package, and so boring and "broken" (=things were out of order all over the place) that we left after 15 minutes.

Would not recommend it to anyone.

reviewnospace: Brilliant experience! The best part is the entire outer structure is completely free to visit! Highly recommend visiting the Oceanographic! A great day out1
titleopinion: Awesome!. Brilliant experience! The best part is the entire outer structure is completely free to visit! Highly recommend visiting the Oceanographic! A great day out1

reviewnospace: We visited this venue on a beautiful sunny day and I think every school in Valencia decided to visit it on the same day. However this didn't detract from our visit because the excitement of the children helped us as we couldn't understand the Spanish commentary at the dolphin pool. Not that you need to understand what is being said because the Dolphins are so good to watch you don't need translation. The remainder of the Oceanographic complex was also very interesting and informative. We also went to the Science Museum where there were lots of interactive experiments to try. The Pixar exhibition inside the Science Museum was fascinating. There were wax or plaster models of the characters from Toy Story, Ratatouille, Finding Nemo, The Incredibles and other animated films with descriptions of how the films were made. There was also a short film and a carousel which when spun at high speed gave the impression the characters were moving. Incredibly clever.
titleopinion: Futuristic design. We visited this venue on a beautiful sunny day and I think every school in Valencia decided to visit it on the same day. However this didn't detract from our visit because the excitement of the children helped us as we couldn't understand the Spanish commentary at the dolphin pool. Not that you need to understand what is being said because the Dolphins are so good to watch you don't need translation. The remainder of the Oceanographic complex was also very interesting and informative. We also went to the Science Museum where there were lots of interactive experiments to try. The Pixar exhibition inside the Science Museum was fascinating. There was also a short film and a carousel which when spun at high speed gave the impression the characters were moving. Incredibly clever.

reviewnospace: What we enjoyed visiting the City of Art and Science was its architecture. It made us feel like we had walked into a science fiction city with futuristic exterior design. We marveled at the lines and curves of the buildings that make the structures very graceful. You might see a building or two in lots of cities that are avant-garde, but here you get a whole complex.
titleopinion: Beautiful Architecture. What we enjoyed visiting the City of Art and Science was its architecture. It made us feel like we had walked into a science fiction city with futuristic exterior design. We marveled at the lines and curves of the buildings that make the structures very graceful. You might see a building or two in lots of cities that are avant-garde, but here you get a whole complex.

What is inside, is completely another story

You had to buy expensive tickets to get into the different buildings, which we didn´t really want to do; so instead we decided to just walk around in the área, hoping for amazing scenery. but what we found where weathered buildings, empty pool áreas, a lot of closed of áreas, and construction work. waste of time!

reviewnospace: Taking visitors to the City of Arts and Sciences was absolutely brilliant. The whole area is a pleasure to walk round and there is something for every age group to enjoy. Our visitors were so enthusiastic that we had to go back the following day to take in more of the areas. Would definately return although would advise taking a picnic as the food, although good, is not cheap.

quote: Go for the stunning Architecture, if nothing else
reviewnospace: We are fans of the architect Santiago Calatrava, so of course this whole city that he designed was high on our list. We were not disappointed. The scale of the "city" - all of the various buildings and spaces is huge and fascinating. We took way too many photos and spent several hours just wandering around the complex. We never went into any of the buildings, but we enjoyed all of the excitement of the exteriors. Pretty amazing place!
titleopinion: Go for the stunning Architecture, if nothing else. We are fans of the architect Santiago Calatrava, so of course this whole city that he designed was high on our list. We were not disappointed. The scale of the "city" - all of the various buildings and spaces is huge and fascinating. We took way too many photos and spent several hours just wandering around the complex. We never went into any of the buildings, but we enjoyed all of the excitement of the exteriors. Pretty amazing place!

reviewnospace: Beautiful architecture and nice open spaces. Very interesting overall but unfortunately a lot of the exhibits in the science museum were out of order
titleopinion: Very interesting. Beautiful architecture and nice open spaces. Very interesting overall but unfortunately a lot of the exhibits in the science museum were out of order

reviewnospace:
This complex comprises the Oceanografic (aquarium), Science museum, Hemisferic (IMAX theatre) , Umbracle - car park (and sometimes exhibition area) , Palau de les Arts Reina Sofía (Opera house) as well as the Agora (which holds tennis tournaments and other exhibitions too).
We have bought the yearly ticket which allows us visit as often as we want. I would actually recommend this if you can, even to visit more than twice. Great to keep kids occupied - Aquarium is good for 4 to 6 hours entertainment easily. There is a play area for young children in the Science Museum as well as many exhibits to keep their interest. IMAX theatre has several shows per day: check their timetables as these change according to time of year. I have not yet visited the Agora or opera house. We hope to in the future whenever they hold events that would be suitable for our children's age group and we are actually in the city.
titleopinion:
6 in one complex. This complex comprises the Oceanografic (aquarium), Science museum, Hemisferic (IMAX theatre) , Umbracle - car park (and sometimes exhibition area) , Palau de les Arts Reina Sofía (Opera house) as well as the Agora (which holds tennis tournaments and other exhibitions too).
We have bought the yearly ticket which allows us visit as often as we want. I would actually recommend this if you can, even to visit more than twice. Great to keep kids occupied - Aquarium is good for 4 to 6 hours entertainment easily. There is a play area for young children in the Science Museum as well as many exhibits to keep their interest. IMAX theatre has several shows per day: check their timetables as these change according to time of year. I have not yet visited the Agora or opera house. We hope to in the future whenever they hold events that would be suitable for our children's age group and we are actually in the city.

quote: Very nice architecture you should see
reviewnospace: This is the place to go to see futuristic architecture! Great buildings in a nice setting with lots of water and space, located next to a park. Impressive by its looks, all 24 hours of the day. Too bad that there is no subway station, only buses and taxis can bring you here. The Oceanografic is very good for a nice day of pleasure; the science museum was disappointing.
titleopinion: Very nice architecture you should see. This is the place to go to see futuristic architecture! Great buildings in a nice setting with lots of water and space, located next to a park. Impressive by its looks, all 24 hours of the day. Too bad that there is no subway station, only buses and taxis can bring you here. The Oceanografic is very good for a nice day of pleasure; the science museum was disappointing.

reviewnospace: I never went inside the buildings but they are stunning. The architecture was amazing and the way in which the rest of the area is designed in compliments it perfectly!
titleopinion: Beautiful. I never went inside the buildings but they are stunning. The architecture was amazing and the way in which the rest of the area is designed in compliments it perfectly!

reviewnospace:
We visited this complex fairly late in the day, knowing we were too late to go inside to the museum but in the hope we would enjoy just walking around and enjoying looking at the buildings. We were not disappointed!

The place is like something out of a film, perhaps some sort of luxurious space station - definitely out of this world. Everything is huge and glistening and spectacular. I would recommend going on a sunny day, which let's be honest isn't difficult in Valencia.

We explored round the buildings snapping photos of everything before taking a little rowing boat out on the perfect green man-made lake in the centre of the complex. We then enjoyed a lovely cold beer at the cafe and watched others having fun on the lake with those inflatable ball things that float on the water.

We would probably come back another time and actually go inside the museum, but I'd recommend taking time to visit even if the indoor attractions are closed. It's so unusual and a wonderful escape from the narrow side streets of the old town, as much as I love them!
titleopinion:
Unmissable architecture. We visited this complex fairly late in the day, knowing we were too late to go inside to the museum but in the hope we would enjoy just walking around and enjoying looking at the buildings. We were not disappointed!

The place is like something out of a film, perhaps some sort of luxurious space station - definitely out of this world. Everything is huge and glistening and spectacular. I would recommend going on a sunny day, which let's be honest isn't difficult in Valencia.

We explored round the buildings snapping photos of everything before taking a little rowing boat out on the perfect green man-made lake in the centre of the complex. We then enjoyed a lovely cold beer at the cafe and watched others having fun on the lake with those inflatable ball things that float on the water.

We would probably come back another time and actually go inside the museum, but I'd recommend taking time to visit even if the indoor attractions are closed. It's so unusual and a wonderful escape from the narrow side streets of the old town, as much as I love them!

quote: Loved it!!! Need to visit if in Valencia!
reviewnospace: The architecture of this complex is incredible. There were many activities including a train to take you around the multiple buildings, and a water ball to balance and test your strength around the entry pool areas. Everything was clean, organized and staff was friendly. Need to visit and admire the different buildings dedicated to science and arts!
titleopinion: Loved it!!! Need to visit if in Valencia!. The architecture of this complex is incredible. There were many activities including a train to take you around the multiple buildings, and a water ball to balance and test your strength around the entry pool areas. Everything was clean, organized and staff was friendly. Need to visit and admire the different buildings dedicated to science and arts!

reviewnospace: As we approached this site it reminded us of the film Jurassic Park - the remains of a gigantic monument to hubris, almost deserted, in unlikely surroundings. The buildings are large and ambitious but either unfinished or already in decline. Several of them were already under repair, with bits of mosaic being chipped off and falling into the water features. We could see that the buildings were mostly empty. Even the ticket offices were shut. A few bewildered tourists stood around. I really wouldn't spend a lot of time going out here, although the surrounding gardens and this part of the Turia gardens are lovely.
titleopinion: Weird, like a scifi film. As we approached this site it reminded us of the film Jurassic Park - the remains of a gigantic monument to hubris, almost deserted, in unlikely surroundings. The buildings are large and ambitious but either unfinished or already in decline. Several of them were already under repair, with bits of mosaic being chipped off and falling into the water features. We could see that the buildings were mostly empty. Even the ticket offices were shut. A few bewildered tourists stood around. I really wouldn't spend a lot of time going out here, although the surrounding gardens and this part of the Turia gardens are lovely.

quote: Underrated especially if you like science

I can't now obtain a refund either as they haven't replied to my emails and their customer line is only in Spanish!

quote: The place is amazing but the museum is dissapointing
reviewnospace:
The area and the park leading to it is beautiful!
we walked to the museum from the city center through the park on a sunny day at the end of summer- its reaaly peacfull, clean and pretty.
We arrived to the "city" which was even more beatiful and entered the science museum- very dissapointing. alot of exhibits were closed and the open ones are 80's oldy science....
so just hanging around is what i reccomend.

reviewnospace: What a mess! For starters, Valencia had a perfectly beautiful and fertile piece of land and they filled it with concrete. Second, the concrete is poor and the opera house is falling apart. Third, the complex is not accessible by metro which makes it less attractive for tourists. Finally, it's isolated and without life. The cluster of futuristic concrete buildings is isolated from organic barrios by 4 lanes of traffic. Nobody lives within the complex which makes it arri idol and isolated. One building might have been breathtaking (hello Bilbao) but a series of non-integrated concrete buildings makes the corruption and poor planning of the whole project painfully obvious. Glad my tax € were not wasted on this falling down mess
titleopinion: Wasteful, senseless city planning. What a mess! For starters, Valencia had a perfectly beautiful and fertile piece of land and they filled it with concrete. Second, the concrete is poor and the opera house is falling apart. Third, the complex is not accessible by metro which makes it less attractive for tourists. Finally, it's isolated and without life. The cluster of futuristic concrete buildings is isolated from organic barrios by 4 lanes of traffic. Nobody lives within the complex which makes it arri idol and isolated. One building might have been breathtaking (hello Bilbao) but a series of non-integrated concrete buildings makes the corruption and poor planning of the whole project painfully obvious. Glad my tax € were not wasted on this falling down mess

quote: We could not get enough pictures.
reviewnospace: It seemed as if the place was unreal. I touched the water the huge metal poles and walked around for at least an hour in awe at what we were seeing. We came in the winter and decided that a return trip in the early summer or spring would be a must in our future. Valencia was amazing and since we came here and could only view the exterior areas, we are looking forward to a return trip to see inside too and take much more time to walk the entire exterior and beautiful park that connects to the area. Our pictures are attached and I know there are far from as amazing as it is to stand there. You stand looking at this amazing modern art and can see the area behind it is both modern and traditional residential areas. From the same place you can look the other way across the river at the old town, business district and multiple cathedrals and churches.

quote: Cool Design and Architecture, Very little Science
reviewnospace:
The City of Arts and Sciences was the thing I most looked forward to seeing in Valencia and it was a bit disappointing. Maybe my expectations were too high, but it was a bit dull and there wasn't much too see inside.

The architecture is very cool and modern. I still thought it looked a bit run down at some places and in need of maintenance. But the view and concept are amazing.

I almost got depressed once I went inside. There's very little science and not a lot to see. It was a huge letdown. It's not worth the entrance fee. It was also a bit boring, very quiet and not enough ambiance.

Bottom line:
Save your money and just enjoy and admire the architecture from the outside and take a few more hours strolling around the center of Valencia. There are some beautiful plazas worth visiting and in much better condition than the newer City of Arts and Sciences.

Cool Design and Architecture, Very little Science. The City of Arts and Sciences was the thing I most looked forward to seeing in Valencia and it was a bit disappointing. Maybe my expectations were too high, but it was a bit dull and there wasn't much too see inside.

The use of the riverbed all around the city is impressive following the river's relocation after the floods of 1957. Well worth visiting

reviewnospace:
This is the perfect example of a Potemkin Village. Yes, all looks very impressive but the content of the museum is dismal. There is a huge amount of empty space where exhibits once were and what is left is either well past it's sell by date or just plain broken. The chicks hatching under heat lamps was the highlight of the visit. The music hall next door is also not up to scratch as all of the exterior decoration has been falling off. Not a lot of content for a very large entrance fee.
Go to the aquarium next door - much better value

reviewnospace: After visiting London Science Museum, Copernicus Science Centre in Warsaw and Experyment in Gdynia i was very disappointed visiting the one in Valencia. So much unused space! So little to see. So many broken installations. It must have been great when it was opened but not anymore. Its seems forgotten or unfinished and let do die. What a shame.

reviewnospace: I was only in Valencia for a few hours so I had to fit this in with wanting to see the Holy Grail. This is a stark contrast to all of the older architecture I've seen in Spain but it is gorgeous and breathtaking nonetheless. Walking down into the park area to see it is pretty cool and when you realize there are clear blue pools there too, it is even better. The day I went there was a wedding party there so it was nice to see the romantic side of the area. I didn't get to go inside the buildings but the outside was enough to hold me over until next time.

quote: Oceanografic is Good but Science Museum is a Snooze
reviewnospace:
Was so excited to go the City of Arts and Sciences. We went to the science museum first, with great anticipation. Based on the modern architecture and the write ups I had read, I was really looking forward to seeing and learning about what Spain is doing in terms of sustainable technologies, alternative energies, advanced homes, experimentation, etc. Ho hum, boring, not so much. Old hat exhibits and old information. This part of the City of Arts and Sciences I would give it a rating of 1.5 (i,e, skip it) unless you have children between the ages of 6 and 10.

Oceanografic, on the other hand, is definitely worth a visit. It is nicely done, offering a variety of sea environment experiences. The dolphin show is typical - something to excite the young, but I prefer to see them in their natural environments. The above ground exhibits are nice, but the real shows are the below ground exhibits that take you eye level with different oceanic life around the world. The Beluga whales were lovely, so elegant, and the walruses were fun. There are a large variety of fish, sharks, sea stars, anemone, etc. species. The tunnels going from exhibit to exhibit where you are surrounded by the aquarium sea life are great. More emphasis on what is necessary to save our oceans would have made it better, but overall it was a pleasant experience that I would recommend for all ages.

We did not make it to the Arts portion.

quote: Why did they build this so far from the metro station??!!
reviewnospace:
Yes, it's a very nice building. But by the time I got there I was too cranky to enjoy it because I was exhausted from the 45min walk from the metro station!
It's free to walk around the outdoor areas (as well it should be given that you really do need to get taxis there and back). It's a pretty place to walk around in the evening, it's probably even prettier at sunset but I missed sunset because of the long walk! At around 8pm there aren't many people there, so it may not be safe to be there too much later than that.

quote: One of the most impressive 23rd century-style buildings
reviewnospace: Have a look yourself to believe. It's more Star Trek than recession-hit Spain. Yes, money on public financing it was huge if not mad. It's a crazy folly to build in a small city, but definitely ambitious. Despite my conservative tastes hating most modern box glass and concrete buildings - this is one of the best. A very impressive Calatrava architectural design is one of the better style, form and grace modern buildings. See the sun shining off it, or the reflection in the water. It's a wonderful sight and you don't have to pay admission into the science museum. So it's beautiful and FREE !
titleopinion: One of the most impressive 23rd century-style buildings. Have a look yourself to believe. It's more Star Trek than recession-hit Spain. Yes, money on public financing it was huge if not mad. It's a crazy folly to build in a small city, but definitely ambitious. Despite my conservative tastes hating most modern box glass and concrete buildings - this is one of the best. A very impressive Calatrava architectural design is one of the better style, form and grace modern buildings. See the sun shining off it, or the reflection in the water. It's a wonderful sight and you don't have to pay admission into the science museum. So it's beautiful and FREE !

quote: One of the modern wonders of Europe
reviewnospace: Truly stunning modern architectural ensemble by Spanish architect Calatrava. A worthy successor to Gaudi. Saw his new subway entrance for the 9/11 site in New York being built last year. The harp-shaped bridge, the helmet- shaped blue arena, the eye-shaped hall and the opera building that is a match for the Sydney opera - altogether it is unique for Valencia, Spain and Europe (and no wonder Spain has a budget crisis...). We made the mistake of going into the aquarium, which is big and expensive but not that special. The walrus and beluga enclosures are small and sad. Did not bother with the rest, after reading the tripadvisor reviews. Not sure Spain has someone of the caliber of Calatrava to bring the content on the inside on par with the architecture. Anyway, the outside is a must-see.
titleopinion: One of the modern wonders of Europe. Truly stunning modern architectural ensemble by Spanish architect Calatrava. A worthy successor to Gaudi. Saw his new subway entrance for the 9/11 site in New York being built last year. The harp-shaped bridge, the helmet- shaped blue arena, the eye-shaped hall and the opera building that is a match for the Sydney opera - altogether it is unique for Valencia, Spain and Europe (and no wonder Spain has a budget crisis...). We made the mistake of going into the aquarium, which is big and expensive but not that special. The walrus and beluga enclosures are small and sad. Did not bother with the rest, after reading the tripadvisor reviews. Not sure Spain has someone of the caliber of Calatrava to bring the content on the inside on par with the architecture. Anyway, the outside is a must-see.

quote: Disappointing, however the exterior makes up for what the interior lacks
reviewnospace:
The pools surrounding the outside of this building are swoon worthy on a hot day. We took plenty of pictures and sat and enjoyed the outside 'park' with many others for an hour or so. Lots of visitors had their feet dipping into the pools so we did too (to cool down).. Don't do this unless you want a scalding by the miserable security team!

The inside of the arts and science museum felt run down and a little dated. Quite a handful of the exhibitions/attractions were not actually working. Most definitely geared towards children's education. Nevertheless, for €8 per person it was a reasonable price and there were some interesting exhibitions on show. Spent around 2 hours here before heading to the beach for gins and paella in the sun!

reviewnospace:
The entire complex is very beautiful: the architecture is modern, with very high quality design, very well laid-out. The mixture of entertainment is very well thought through.

It was not very busy when we went there, and I hope local people enjoy the visits;

The content of the exhibitions is very interesting.

The only draw back is the difficulty to find a taxi when you leave the space.

quote: Nice but not as spectacular as Oceanografic
reviewnospace: We went there as a Family after Oceanografic and after the outstanding experience at the one before this one was a bit disappointing as we have some great Museums of this kind in Switzerland.

quote: A bit tired inside, but enough to entertain young children
reviewnospace: Given that the building is relatively new, I was quite surprised that the interior looks so tired. It also seemed quite empty of exhibits! Our children were strangely entertained by the kids area on the first floor, especially the brick building bit, for a good hour. But the other displays weren't that engaging. There were a couple of extra activities you could do, some paid, some free, including a show on electricity for over 7s and a space show for children over 1m 10cm. We asked for info but weren't told about the Space Robot show that was in English, so we saw it in Spanish (which only I speak). It was quite good, free and only 10 minutes long (although pointless for my children!). The restaurant was very good value (and you get 10% off with at VLC card, which I didn't notice til afterwards!). Not sure it's worth a detour unless you've got discounted tickets.

Do keep in mind the Opera house was in scaffolding, since it needs the tiles to be replaced (April 2015)

reviewnospace: Seeing this area was so bizarre for me. Since I've been in Italy, I have become used to its architecture. After visiting Spain and seeing Valencia, my mind was blown. The amazing modern architecture of this area in Valencia was such a breath of sweet air. I would highly recommend taking a stroll through here to admire the buildings and arts&sciences within.

quote: Makes you appreciate people you have such vision
reviewnospace: We were planning on going to the Arts and Sciences complex after having done a morning walking tour of Valencia, but very glad we returned a second day as this place deserves adequate time for exploring. We walked from the Valencia Nord train station as it was a nice day; took about 25 minutes. The complex was nearly deserted; which was great for taking photos. We spent over three hours and the only building we entered was the Hemisferic to see the IMAX movie. The movie was OK; wouldn’t highly recommend it as the best IMAX we’ve ever seen. But the Arts and Sciences complex was outstanding. We are familiar with Calatrava’s work in the United States and therefore were very interested in seeing his structures in his hometown of Valencia. Work was being done on the Opera Building and it was almost completely covered in scaffolding so we couldn’t enjoy that…and the large reflecting pool on the back side of the Hemisferic was empty as it was being cleaned. But neither impacted our overall experience. The complex is such an interesting contrast to the old, historic city center; we enjoyed both. After walking from the train station to the complex and walking around the complex for 3 hours, we walked back into the historic city center which was a bit ambitious. Wish we had opted to take a bus. Would love to return sometime in the future to see the complex in the evening!
titleopinion: Makes you appreciate people you have such vision. quote: Dolphins, Science, Everything you could need!
reviewnospace: There is so much variety in the City of Arts and Sciences! There is definitely tons to do. I visited the part that is most like a "science museum" as well as the oceanografic, including the dolphin show. I even got to pet a dolphin while I was there! The oceanografic had some incredible sea life, and it is definitely a crucial part of any visit to Valencia!

titleopinion: Disappointing. Although the pictures are fantastic, not all of the buildings are open. There is much construction going on and we did not feel the cost was worth the trip.

quote: Great architecture - but not much else.
reviewnospace: We loved the architecture - stunning. We wanted to take lots of photos, but the water has not been filled so the reflections did not work properly. Lots of it was fenced off - we could not climb the stairs of the Science Museum to take pics of the Hemispheric. As we didn't have kids, we thought the content of the science museum was not for us. The film showings at the Hemispheric also appeared to be aimed at children. The cafes were very average and the waiters disinterested. We went back at night, but it was like a ghost town and much of the lighting was not working. There seemed to be no restaurants. We wanted to see the architecture of the aquarium, but you coudn't go in unless you paid. Since we are firmly against keeping dolphins and belugas in captivity and making them do tricks, we felt unable on principle to pay to go into the Oceanographic. All in all, this area felt underused and neglected. What a waste, what a missed opportunity. And shame on you Valencia for keeping dolphins and belugas in captivity.

reviewnospace: The architecture is stunning, but it is a strangely neglected area in general. Pleasant to stroll around and take photos, but off season it's a bit like a ghost town with nothing much to do. A couple of rather poor cafes,with disinterested waiters, a rather confusing array of options at the Hemisferic Imax cinema (seemed to be aimed at kids) and the science museum would also be great for kids but not adults. Lots of bits were fenced off, so you couldn't walk around the Hemisferic and you couldn't climb the steps of the Science Museum to take photos of the other buildings. The concert hall was covered in scaffolding. Worst of all, the water surrounding the buidings had not been filled up, so we couldn't get the photos with reflections which we wanted. It seems that the city has these amazing buildings but doesn't really know what to do with them. Easy buses to the centre or a pleasant walk through the old river bed. I am sure the Aquarium is great, but we can't bear to go anywhere which has captive dolphins and belugas doing tricks. Shame on them.
titleopinion: Fabulous buildings but..... The architecture is stunning, but it is a strangely neglected area in general. Pleasant to stroll around and take photos, but off season it's a bit like a ghost town with nothing much to do. A couple of rather poor cafes,with disinterested waiters, a rather confusing array of options at the Hemisferic Imax cinema (seemed to be aimed at kids) and the science museum would also be great for kids but not adults. Lots of bits were fenced off, so you couldn't walk around the Hemisferic and you couldn't climb the steps of the Science Museum to take photos of the other buildings. The concert hall was covered in scaffolding. Worst of all, the water surrounding the buidings had not been filled up, so we couldn't get the photos with reflections which we wanted. It seems that the city has these amazing buildings but doesn't really know what to do with them. Easy buses to the centre or a pleasant walk through the old river bed. I am sure the Aquarium is great, but we can't bear to go anywhere which has captive dolphins and belugas doing tricks. Shame on them.

quote: Great museum - plenty to see and some excellent temporary exhibits
reviewnospace: REally nice location. Also can be bought with tickets to the Oceanografic - it saves money whcih is a good thing also the left luggage area is cheaper and a lot more convenient that the oceanografic - especially if you have suitcases.

reviewnospace:
Among all the building of the City of Science the less interesting was for me the Hemispheric.
Not because of the informations shared but because the quality of the images was very poor. You are seating in a huge dome with a IMAX system and the images were not as good as you can expect
And it was something very disapointing because it dealt with space and the birth of stars and how the universe was created

The museum of Science was interesting in the upper level (the ground and 1st level were really child oriented and not every experiences worked)
The history of communication from the previous centuries to nowadays was well furnished with old pieces of equipement - they have an enigma machine !!! and the journey through time was interesting

The oceanografico is NOT the largest aquarium in Europe because the one is Lisboa is way bigger
The difference between the 2 lays on the fact that you can walk underneath large brigde of water and it allows you to see all kind of fishes/sharks..

If you want to visit the 3 building count a whole afternoon to do so...

Though some interactive systems don't work as they should, it is worth half a days visit to explore all scientific issues on the planet, the body and the mind.

Very beautiful facility with lots to look at. This is really a work of art! Would like to have had more time to spend than just a morning, but with so much to see in Valencia it's hard to spend a whole day in one spot.

The river parks/ grounds were a delightful walk, very relaxing with many people around walking, biking, running. Very family friendly.

reviewnospace: All over Europe, things are closed on Sunday and we are always looking for things to do. Plan ahead, get picnic provisions on Saturday, and spend Sunday like the Spaniards -- strolling the parks around the City of Arts and Sciences and nibbling on your culinary finds! Oh, and don't miss the children's play area!
titleopinion: Sunday solution!. All over Europe, things are closed on Sunday and we are always looking for things to do. Plan ahead, get picnic provisions on Saturday, and spend Sunday like the Spaniards -- strolling the parks around the City of Arts and Sciences and nibbling on your culinary finds! Oh, and don't miss the children's play area!

reviewnospace: Being lovers of modern architecture, this place blew us away (so much so we visited twice during our time in Valencia). Beautiful, interesting, uber-stylish. We visited on very hot sunny days, and as the buildings are white and covered with shiny mosaic tiles the centre is kept cool while you explore the site. The buildings are surrounded by large expanses of crystal clear water. We hired a Kayak with hilarious results! Well worth getting soaked for. Kids will love this place loads of space to run around and lots to see. There's a museum, cinema famous concert hall and bars and restaurants, also within walking distance of the huge Oceanografic All in all a must do!
