reviewnospace: Cannot praise this location enough. Not only is the architecture amazing but the oceanografic and the urmbracle and the science museum HAVE to be enjoyed. Worth every penny.
titleopinion: Incredible. Cannot praise this location enough. Not only is the architecture amazing but the oceanografic and the urmbracle and the science museum HAVE to be enjoyed. Worth every penny.

reviewnospace: This complex holds the tallest opera house in the world and the largest oceanographic aquarium in Europe. The architecture of the buildings and suspension bridge seems to strive to be different, so we can't guess the functions of the main buildings just by looking at them, which can be a bit off-putting. The main buildings are all elliptical and symmetrical. The flying-buttressed Science Center is said to resemble the bones of a whale carcass, and the L'Hemisferic, the planetarium, resembles the human eye. The Queen Sophia Palace of the Arts looks like a giant hemispherical fish to me, and it holds the opera house. L'Agora is an enormous covered plaza. We spent most of our time in the Science Center, and we found that the inside has few, if any, innovations; all of the innovations appear to be concentrated in the architecture seen from the outside. The science center has free bathrooms and a very nice book/souvenir shop. The complex is worth a visit because it is the most easily recognizable icon of Valencia, and it is truly unique. You might want to visit only one building in less than an hour or all of them over 2 or 3 hours.
titleopinion: Must-see icon of Valencia. This complex holds the tallest opera house in the world and the largest oceanographic aquarium in Europe. The architecture of the buildings and suspension bridge seems to strive to be different, so we can't guess the functions of the main buildings just by looking at them, which can be a bit off-putting. You might want to visit only one building in less than an hour or all of them over 2 or 3 hours.

reviewnospace: the whole stretch contains several (around 5, i think) futuristic (i can only call it that) architecture which are in contrast to the architecture in the rest of the city (old city or even the alameda). They are rather stunning and impressive.

reviewnospace: We spent a great day visiting the area. We wandered around enjoying the architecture and visited the science centre. I have to say it is my favourite science centre of those I have visited so far. It is definitely worth taking time to enjoy the area. The park is also a pleasure to walk in and goes all the way up to the city centre.

quote: Fantastic, brilliant architecture and wonderful oceanografic
reviewnospace:
This really is a brilliant way to spend a day in Valencia, in fact probably the best way to spend a day in Valencia!

The park itself is very futuristic, with incredible architecture. We bought tickets for the oceanografic and science museum, but only had time to visit the oceanografic (our total visit inside there was 4.5 hours). The oceanografic is a great complex - a park/lake setting with intertwining walkways and bridges leading you to the various buildings/sights including areas of aquarium underground. You really see everything here - fish, sharks, dolphins, sea lions, seals, beluga whales, penguins, tropical birds, turtles - the list goes on.

I highly recommend, the best aquarium park I have been to by far and in a great setting!
titleopinion:
Fantastic, brilliant architecture and wonderful oceanografic. This really is a brilliant way to spend a day in Valencia, in fact probably the best way to spend a day in Valencia!

The park itself is very futuristic, with incredible architecture. We bought tickets for the oceanografic and science museum, but only had time to visit the oceanografic (our total visit inside there was 4.5 hours). The oceanografic is a great complex - a park/lake setting with intertwining walkways and bridges leading you to the various buildings/sights including areas of aquarium underground. You really see everything here - fish, sharks, dolphins, sea lions, seals, beluga whales, penguins, tropical birds, turtles - the list goes on.

I highly recommend, the best aquarium park I have been to by far and in a great setting!

reviewnospace: Great place for a walk in the evening. Nice coffee shop for Horchata, Boccadillo, beer and ice creams. Cool see through kayaks and giant balloons to walk on water. Above the car park is a nice park walkway. Across the road is a shopping centre El Salader. Well worth a look.
titleopinion: Futuristic Park.. Great place for a walk in the evening. Nice coffee shop for Horchata, Boccadillo, beer and ice creams. Cool see through kayaks and giant balloons to walk on water. Above the car park is a nice park walkway. Across the road is a shopping centre El Salader. Well worth a look.

reviewnospace: Modern architecture that will astound you. I recommend that you walk via the long park (used to be the Turia River) that connects the old city to the City of Arts and Sciences. Makes for a beautiful day!
titleopinion: Ultra modern architectural experience. Modern architecture that will astound you. I recommend that you walk via the long park (used to be the Turia River) that connects the old city to the City of Arts and Sciences. Makes for a beautiful day!

quote: Never miss this if you visit Valencia!
reviewnospace:
What the Eiffel tower is to Paris, is this magnificent futuristic city for Valencia. Don't miss this!

I come here at least every week with my different clients to show them the contrast of all these modern shapes in comparison to the authentic old town in the center of Valencia.

As a private guide I love to tell about the concept of Calatrava, his ideas and views but I have to explain about the many things that went wrong as well.

If you visit the City of Arts and Sciences this year, one of the most beautiful buildings is far from amazing like it used to be. You will not notice what's different if you can't compare it to how it used to be. I'm talking in riddles but I won't tell more.

Discover this part of Valencia at least for one day and feel yourself surrounded by something you'll never see somewhere else. It's totally worth it and very inexpensive!
titleopinion:

I come here at least every week with my different clients to show them the contrast of all these modern shapes in comparison to the authentic old town in the center of Valencia.

As a private guide I love to tell about the concept of Calatrava, his ideas and views but I have to explain about the many things that went wrong as well.

If you visit the City of Arts and Sciences this year, one of the most beautiful buildings is far from amazing like it used to be. You will not notice what's different if you can't compare it to how it used to be. I'm talking in riddles but I won't tell more.

Discover this part of Valencia at least for one day and feel yourself surrounded by something you'll never see somewhere else. It's totally worth it and very inexpensive!

reviewnospace: The building and layout designs made the area a real people city. Such a contrast from the sterile blank decadent cities at home in the US
titleopinion: Fantastic people city. The building and layout designs made the area a real people city. Such a contrast from the sterile blank decadent cities at home in the US

quote: Take your time, it's worth it
reviewnospace: Visit early morning, later on too many tourists rushing without really appreciating the view. Sit down and take it all in, enjoy the breeze. Such impressive architecture. Doesn't actually look like the postcard during the day but it works for the better and the concrete, rust and metal give it Its unique character.

Such impressive architecture. Doesn't actually look like the postcard during the day but it works for the better and the concrete, rust and metal give it Its unique character.

reviewnospace: I went to Valencia as a tourist to experience the flavours of this amazing city. It certainly greeted me with awe inspiring architecture and the City of the Arts and Sciences is no different. Buildings nearby in the complex have the most sophisticated architecture in the world. I went to the Princes Felipe Science Museum and the quality of it is brilliant. It is THE best attraction in Valencia and I would visit it time and time again!

It certainly greeted me with awe inspiring architecture and the City of the Arts and Sciences is no different. Buildings nearby in the complex have the most sophisticated architecture in the world. I went to the Princes Felipe Science Museum and the quality of it is brilliant. It is THE best attraction in Valencia and I would visit it time and time again!

reviewnospace: Impressive architecture in this park. The buildings is lined up nicely and they all interact with each other in a nice way. The only negative we found was that there are no metro stop near by, or that the buildings are not lit up after dark. We went to use the buildings after dark and was disappointed that the park area was I. Total dark several evenings during the week we spent in Valencia.

reviewnospace: Buildings are fantastic. A great work of Architecture in a country famous for it's Architects . A must visit for any one visiting this third largest city of Spain . We very much enjoyed visiting the site.
titleopinion: Landmark of the City. Buildings are fantastic. A great work of Architecture in a country famous for it's Architects . A must visit for any one visiting this third largest city of Spain . We very much enjoyed visiting the site.

quote: one of the best science museum
reviewnospace: this is one thing thta you must do in Valencia, to visit the city and go at least to the science museum. one of the best that i have ever seen.

quote: A beautiful location for sight seeing and much more
reviewnospace:
The City of Arts and Sciences is a beautiful area of Valencia that displays the city's love for architecture and design with its Palau de les Arts Reina Sofía (opera house), Oceanografic, El Museu de les Ciencies Príncipe Felipe (science museum), and L'Hemisferic (planetarium).

I suggest walking or biking along L'Umbracle (walking/biking paths) and enjoy the views of the architecture and nature. There are also tours that are offered, this is a good way to get an insider's look at these amazing venues.

Contrapunto Restaurante is a very nice restaurant on the ground floor of Palau de les Arts Reina Sofía. I recommend sitting in their outdoor area and enjoying the weather, architecture, and cuisine.
titleopinion:
A beautiful location for sight seeing and much more. The City of Arts and Sciences is a beautiful area of Valencia that displays the city's love for architecture and design with its Palau de les Arts Reina Sofía (opera house), Oceanografic, El Museu de les Ciencies Príncipe Felipe (science museum), and L'Hemisferic (planetarium).

I suggest walking or biking along L'Umbracle (walking/biking paths) and enjoy the views of the architecture and nature. There are also tours that are offered, this is a good way to get an insider's look at these amazing venues.

Contrapunto Restaurante is a very nice restaurant on the ground floor of Palau de les Arts Reina Sofía. I recommend sitting in their outdoor area and enjoying the weather, architecture, and cuisine.

reviewnospace:
I have never seen such feats of bending steel and concrete into complete art. I constantly wondered how such things could be built and my husband and spent hours walking around and speculating. Every new part was nicer than the old part.

This is a site that it truly benefits one to have read a little about it before going to see it. You can not imagine until you see it

reviewnospace: just take a walk and look at the buildings it is absolutely beautiful could not imagine how they built this

reviewnospace: The building design is fantastic. Outside is a must visit monument, however, the Museum of Science is too poor science museum. It looks like a children's museum. Nevertheless, I really enjoyed the visit.
titleopinion: Spectacular. The building design is fantastic. Outside is a must visit monument, however, the Museum of Science is too poor science museum. It looks like a children's museum. Nevertheless, I really enjoyed the visit.

reviewnospace: so you visited the old centre of Valencia, and you want to see something completely different? Go for a 40 minutes walk along the old Turia riverbed, and you'll arrive at the ciudad de las artes y las ciencias. Though it could do with a little maintenance, this place is a symphony of structures, angles, curves and intersecting beams, reflected in the water and leading you gently to the oceanografic (the aquarium). It is a must if you want to feel both the historic and the futuristic side of Valencia, and believe me, we made around 100 pictures (I guess) of this place (don't forget the bridge that looks like a harp)
titleopinion: futuristic paradise for photographers. so you visited the old centre of Valencia, and you want to see something completely different? Though it could do with a little maintenance, this place is a symphony of structures, angles, curves and intersecting beams, reflected in the water and leading you gently to the oceanografic (the aquarium). It is a must if you want to feel both the historic and the futuristic side of Valencia, and believe me, we made around 100 pictures (I guess) of this place (don't forget the bridge that looks like a harp)

reviewnospace: The architecture is truly awesome. I think it may be best to walk around just before the sun sets as the views are spectacular. Some of the buildings are rather empty (some of the space is wasted due to the design. I had dinner at the Science building and the atmosphere was splendid. What a great city....do not attempt to walk around the whole complex as the service roads on the back to not connect with the other side!

reviewnospace:
For me this is one of the most interesting parts area of Valencia. With the very modern and photographic architecture. Our friends took us there on a flying visit. Very spectacular the most amazing buildings, making you wonder how they were designed and built. Our friends suggested the service bus, the bus is much cheaper than the circular tour bus, get your tickets before you board the bus at a fraction of the price. The other cheap way is to visit the city is by bike.

There is an entrance fee you pay will only get you some of the exhibitions. We spent our time outside so I cannot comment on the contents.

The only downside to the visit was the poor choice & expensive food on offer.

Too bad that the financial crisis hurt Valencia, because you can see the some of the buildings need a new paint job..

reviewnospace:
A must see place in Valencia. We walked here from the old town.

Not much to do there but look and be amazed. The surrounding park is also picturesque.

reviewnospace: I've stayed in Valencia for 5 months during my studies and I really enjoyed this place. Go for a walk at sunset, you will love its colors and lights. If you're a photographer, well, that's a really good place to practice!
titleopinion: A lovely place. I've stayed in Valencia for 5 months during my studies and I really enjoyed this place. Go for a walk at sunset, you will love its colors and lights. If you're a photographer, well, that's a really good place to practice!

reviewnospace: We only walked around the City of the Arts and Sciences and were amazed at the architecture. If we'd had more time we would have loved to have gone inside some of the buildings and viewed the exhibits.
titleopinion: amazing. We only walked around the City of the Arts and Sciences and were amazed at the architecture. If we'd had more time we would have loved to have gone inside some of the buildings and viewed the exhibits.

quote: Hands on for all the family.
reviewnospace: Only in the area for a few hours but thoroughly enjoyed the IMAX show and a quick walk by tour of the complex. So much hands on stuff for kids. The architecture of the complex is amazing. Lots of parking on street and in centro commercial across the street- free on weekends. Plenty of eateries.

quote: Great architecure in a well designed and maintained environment
reviewnospace:
“Spectacular and surrealistic” are the first words that pop up when you see these buildings. Amazing what architects can design and contractors can build.
Also the surrounding infrastructure, park and art are amazing. A huge contrast with the nearby medieval city gates. The best way to visit the city is by bike.
titleopinion:
Great architecure in a well designed and maintained environment. “Spectacular and surrealistic” are the first words that pop up when you see these buildings. Amazing what architects can design and contractors can build.
Also the surrounding infrastructure, park and art are amazing. A huge contrast with the nearby medieval city gates. The best way to visit the city is by bike.

reviewnospace:
The "City" was created in the dry river bed of now diverted river Turia. It is made up of the following: Opera House, Imax Cinema & Planetarium, Science Museum, Oceanographic Park and Agora, the versatile space for holding outdoor concerts etc. The City was designed by a Valencian architect. The construction started in July 1996 and was completed in April 1998. The City of Arts & Sciences has become a symbol of financial
mismanagement and waste, due to large cost overruns and a large debt burden left for Valencia.
titleopinion:
Example of financial waste !. The "City" was created in the dry river bed of now diverted river Turia. It is made up of the following: Opera House, Imax Cinema & Planetarium, Science Museum, Oceanographic Park and Agora, the versatile space for holding outdoor concerts etc. The City was designed by a Valencian architect. The construction started in July 1996 and was completed in April 1998. The City of Arts & Sciences has become a symbol of financial
mismanagement and waste, due to large cost overruns and a large debt burden left for Valencia.

reviewnospace: This is a must see for everyone visting valencia. We spent one day in iceanografic and one day in the museum. The oceanografic is simply amazing and the museum is great too, but since we had a baby and a 3-year old with us, we couldn' t see it as good as we would want to. But they have an amazing childrens place in the museum and our girl looooveeeed it. For the end of the day, we saw two movies at the hemisferic, which was also nice.

reviewnospace: The City of Arts and Sciences is so spectacular that we visited it on 2 separate occasions. Each time there was a different sculptural art exhibit along the garden walkway on the south side. The architecture, flowers and reflecting pools are magnificent during the day, but at night the lighting changes and gives a different perspective- don't miss the building that turns into a giant eye. Plan to spent a full day here.
titleopinion: A must see in Valencia!. The City of Arts and Sciences is so spectacular that we visited it on 2 separate occasions. Plan to spent a full day here.

reviewnospace: The City of Arts and Sciences is a must see if in Valencia. The buildings are absolutely amazing, makes you feel like you are starring in a SF show. Must visit L'Oceanografic, you won't regret it. The Museum of Arts and Sciences, San Felipe, can be entered for free and you can buy something nice from the souvenir shop near the entrance. Didn't pay to see the exhibitions though, didn't seem it had anything more interesting to offer than what was already exhibited at the museum's ground floor.
titleopinion: Must visit!. The City of Arts and Sciences is a must see if in Valencia. The buildings are absolutely amazing, makes you feel like you are starring in a SF show. Didn't pay to see the exhibitions though, didn't seem it had anything more interesting to offer than what was already exhibited at the museum's ground floor.

quote: The Aquarium is a must, not the science museum
reviewnospace: The building in this area is amazing:) take some time to have a look at them. I think the Aquarium is the most popular place, and I understand that very well. It is a much better place than the Science museum, which has some parts that are interesting and a lot of things that do not work and are not so much fun. They should do something about that. Since the Aquarium is the most popular place, there is quite a long line to get tickets, so I would recommend getting them online before you go, or go to one of the other buildings and get your tickets there. The Aquarium is a lot of fun, and they have many different tanks with fish and other animals. They also have a dolphin show, which is good, but I always find it hard to watch as I do not agree with the captivity of dolphins for entertainment (The Cove). You could also say that for other animals in the Aquarium. The ethics aside, it is a great place for a family to spend a day.

I think the Aquarium is the most popular place, and I understand that very well. It is a much better place than the Science museum, which has some parts that are interesting and a lot of things that do not work and are not so much fun. They should do something about that. Since the Aquarium is the most popular place, there is quite a long line to get tickets, so I would recommend getting them online before you go, or go to one of the other buildings and get your tickets there. The Aquarium is a lot of fun, and they have many different tanks with fish and other animals. They also have a dolphin show, which is good, but I always find it hard to watch as I do not agree with the captivity of dolphins for entertainment (The Cove). You could also say that for other animals in the Aquarium. The ethics aside, it is a great place for a family to spend a day.

reviewnospace: A beautiful place to wonder around, with small alleys covering in bright flowers. Graffiti and artistic drawings are everywhere. If you love art then this is the place for you!
titleopinion: A Beautiful City of Art!. A beautiful place to wonder around, with small alleys covering in bright flowers. Graffiti and artistic drawings are everywhere. If you love art then this is the place for you!

quote: Great architecture, but do not waste too much time here
reviewnospace: The architecture which combines cold futuristic shapes with big flickering water surfaces is extraordinary. The Aquarium is a must, but do not expect as much in the Sciences part as in the City of Science in Paris. A lot of scientific experiments do not work and there is a whole floor with genetics taking a lot of time to read the explanations. This makes kids tired, while there are many more attractions in Valencia they will enjoy.
titleopinion: Great architecture, but do not waste too much time here. The architecture which combines cold futuristic shapes with big flickering water surfaces is extraordinary. A lot of scientific experiments do not work and there is a whole floor with genetics taking a lot of time to read the explanations. This makes kids tired, while there are many more attractions in Valencia they will enjoy.

quote: A must see with even more untapped potential
reviewnospace:
Great collection of buildings, bridges and reflecting pools beautifully blended into a wonderful park that is laid out in an old riverbed. Great for a family outing, biking, jogging or walking - or just hanging out in the park or wander from one unique architectural treat to another.
The content of the buildings is less impressive - you will not miss much if you enjoy it all from the outside, but you should not leave Valencia without giving yourself this little treat.
PS it is right next to the "Oceanographic" which is a very well conceived aquarium park.
titleopinion:
A must see with even more untapped potential. Great collection of buildings, bridges and reflecting pools beautifully blended into a wonderful park that is laid out in an old riverbed. The content of the buildings is less impressive - you will not miss much if you enjoy it all from the outside, but you should not leave Valencia without giving yourself this little treat.
PS it is right next to the "Oceanographic" which is a very well conceived aquarium park.

reviewnospace: My daughter and I went to Valencia and were going to only go to the science part as she was on a budget. I then thought twice and thought, I didn't spend $1200 to get to Spain only to question the admission price of the aquarium. So I bought both of our admissions and I am SO GLAD I did! The aquarium was one of the best I have ever been to and it was the best day during our entire trip! This is not only visually amazing but a must see if you go!

The aquarium was one of the best I have ever been to and it was the best day during our entire trip! This is not only visually amazing but a must see if you go!

reviewnospace: Amazing collection of buildings that we walked around - didn't go in any of the museums but just walked around the area and took tons of photos. Good area for kids just out front of the science museum with some kayaks and those inflatable waterfalls that you can climb in available to rent. Well worth seeing!

Good area for kids just out front of the science museum with some kayaks and those inflatable waterfalls that you can climb in available to rent. Well worth seeing!

reviewnospace: This is spectacular! Numerous buildings constructed in the 2000's are unique and beautiful, as is their setting in the former riverbed of the Turia, now a beautiful park. Most of the buildings are by Calatrava, noted Spanish architect. You will enjoy it whether you visit the museums and aquarium or not.

reviewnospace: Such beautiful constructions in such relaxing environment. An extremely appealing area to visit, one building after another.

reviewnospace: Definitely a must when in Valencia. Amazing buildings that look like shellfish. Make sure you also go for a stroll in the park when the river Turia use to be.

reviewnospace: You must take a walk down the river bed to this area of Valencia if you visit, even if you don't actually want to pay to enter the Science Museum and Cinema. However, we did both and enjoyed our day out. The Science Museum is very educational for children and has many experiments for them to carry out. Not so good for just Adults we feel. There are several daily films and we watched the film about modern space and our universe. Just walking around this very peaceful area in enjoyable.

reviewnospace: Great place to visit, absolutely stunning architecture. A must do for all science lovers. The price is a little too high for Oceanographic, but Museum of Science is quite affordable with ticket-price of 8 euro
titleopinion: Really nice . Great place to visit, absolutely stunning architecture. A must do for all science lovers. The price is a little too high for Oceanographic, but Museum of Science is quite affordable with ticket-price of 8 euro

reviewnospace: As a resident if Valencia, I visit thus place around 2 times a month. Perfect for walks anytime of the day.
titleopinion: Wonderful place for regular visits. As a resident if Valencia, I visit thus place around 2 times a month. Perfect for walks anytime of the day.

quote: A brilliant way to spend the day
reviewnospace: A fantastic set of buildings in amazing surroundings. We visited the aquarium, the science museum and the IMAX theatre. All were really excellent although we had to come back another day to fit it all in. There's also the lovely inside garden section near the science museum. Great architecture, really well thought out attractions (the aquarium is a must see) and well worth the money. Just make sure you leave enough time to see everything.
titleopinion: A brilliant way to spend the day. A fantastic set of buildings in amazing surroundings. We visited the aquarium, the science museum and the IMAX theatre. All were really excellent although we had to come back another day to fit it all in. There's also the lovely inside garden section near the science museum. Great architecture, really well thought out attractions (the aquarium is a must see) and well worth the money. Just make sure you leave enough time to see everything.

quote: Incredible buildings - just don't bother going inside
reviewnospace: I would definitly recommend walking around the buildings, they are awe-inspiring and make you feel as if you've stepped into the future. We decided to visit the Science museum and unfortunately it was a waste of time and money. The 8 euro entrance fee you pay will only get you into about half of the exhibitions, and of the exhibitions you do get to see, half will be out of order. One entire floor is just a museum of famous Spanish scientists with barely any English translation of the texts. Most exhibits seem to be aimed at children or are just poorly thought out. Extremely disappointing day out, would not recommend. Better to admire the building from the outside!
titleopinion: Incredible buildings - just don't bother going inside. I would definitly recommend walking around the buildings, they are awe-inspiring and make you feel as if you've stepped into the future. We decided to visit the Science museum and unfortunately it was a waste of time and money. The 8 euro entrance fee you pay will only get you into about half of the exhibitions, and of the exhibitions you do get to see, half will be out of order. One entire floor is just a museum of famous Spanish scientists with barely any English translation of the texts. Most exhibits seem to be aimed at children or are just poorly thought out. Extremely disappointing day out, would not recommend. Better to admire the building from the outside!

reviewnospace: This place makes you feel like all the futuristic sic-fi movies you watched as a kid just came alive before your eyes! Architecture is unbelievable and that alone is worth the trip!
titleopinion: WOW- so futuristic!. This place makes you feel like all the futuristic sic-fi movies you watched as a kid just came alive before your eyes! Architecture is unbelievable and that alone is worth the trip!

reviewnospace: Designed by Calatrava, this series of buildings, bridges, and theaters is not to be missed. The IMAX theater has great programs that vary throughout the day, the Museum is a great place for hands on activities for all ages, and the opera house is a must see.
titleopinion: Futuristic architecture. Designed by Calatrava, this series of buildings, bridges, and theaters is not to be missed. The IMAX theater has great programs that vary throughout the day, the Museum is a great place for hands on activities for all ages, and the opera house is a must see.

reviewnospace: We stopped here briefly during our tour. It was a great place to stop and take pictures. The architecture is amazing. Definately a beautiful backdrop for a photo op. We did not enter any of the complex so can not review the inside. But definately worth a stop.
titleopinion: Great for pictures. We stopped here briefly during our tour. It was a great place to stop and take pictures. The architecture is amazing. Definately a beautiful backdrop for a photo op. We did not enter any of the complex so can not review the inside. But definately worth a stop.

reviewnospace: We only visited the oceanarium (average, unless you have children - they like it a lot) and the complex is quite amazing at first glance. But once inside, it's all a little sterile - masses of concrete, bizarre sculpture, pools of water. We were also surprised to see how badly some of the buildings were deteriorating. Compared to Valencia's old architecture, this is a graceless addition to the city.
titleopinion: Epcot on steroids. We only visited the oceanarium (average, unless you have children - they like it a lot) and the complex is quite amazing at first glance. But once inside, it's all a little sterile - masses of concrete, bizarre sculpture, pools of water. We were also surprised to see how badly some of the buildings were deteriorating. Compared to Valencia's old architecture, this is a graceless addition to the city.

reviewnospace: The building is amazing. A must see in Valencia The surrounding area is really nice. We took the hop on hop off bus and this is on the route
titleopinion: Amazing architecture . The building is amazing. A must see in Valencia The surrounding area is really nice. We took the hop on hop off bus and this is on the route

quote: City of Arts and Science, Valencia
reviewnospace: Absolutely amazing! A whole complex of several very interesting must-see buildings. Includes Oceanarium, Hemispheric, Museum of arts, House of Science, Agora etc.. Each builiding is a real chef d'oeuvre! I was only inside of Oceanarium and spent there about 6 hours! A great place to see a variety of all possible fishes and other see inhabitants. I have never seen smth similar before. There are around 10 different places within it - faune from different parts of the world like Arctica, Antarctica, Medditeranium etc..It is absolutely worth visiting, also with children. There is a separate "house" with very interesting birds which are not at all afraid of people:) Just impressive!
titleopinion: City of Arts and Science, Valencia. Absolutely amazing! A whole complex of several very interesting must-see buildings. Includes Oceanarium, Hemispheric, Museum of arts, House of Science, Agora etc.. Each builiding is a real chef d'oeuvre! I was only inside of Oceanarium and spent there about 6 hours! A great place to see a variety of all possible fishes and other see inhabitants. I have never seen smth similar before. There are around 10 different places within it - faune from different parts of the world like Arctica, Antarctica, Medditeranium etc..It is absolutely worth visiting, also with children. There is a separate "house" with very interesting birds which are not at all afraid of people:) Just impressive!

reviewnospace: The architecture of the place is fantastic and it is worth to spend a few hours wondering around and taking photos of the huge amount of spectacular details.
titleopinion: Futuristic architecture. The architecture of the place is fantastic and it is worth to spend a few hours wondering around and taking photos of the huge amount of spectacular details.

reviewnospace: Even though some of the buildings need some maintenance, the views are spectacular and offer some great picture opportunities. This was the highlight for me in Valencia

nice for a walk or a bicycle ride from the historical center.

reviewnospace: I don't like arts or musea in generaal but the building itself and its surroundings are absolutely amazing. Like you are visiting a different planet.
titleopinion: City of its own. I don't like arts or musea in generaal but the building itself and its surroundings are absolutely amazing. Like you are visiting a different planet.

reviewnospace: Built by Calatrava,the museum has a lightness unexpected for a building made of concrete and other heavy materials. It has very sharp and geometric angles and yet it makes one think of decorations made in lace patterns. Inside, there are attractive cafes and restaurants, with outside terraces overlooking the rest of the park. Unfortunately,time did not allow for a proper internal visit. Allow at least half a day to see the exhibits and building.

reviewnospace: The buildings were futuristic and fabulous especially with the sunlight refected in the water. Didn't go to oceanographic as was very expensive when compared with most attractions in Valencia. Shop was also expensive, same souvenirs cheaper in other places.

reviewnospace: no trip to Valencia would be complete without a visit here, great place it has also a good shopping center around and great bars and resturants
titleopinion: must visit. no trip to Valencia would be complete without a visit here, great place it has also a good shopping center around and great bars and resturants

reviewnospace: We went on a Sunday because the entry to the Aquarium was at a reduced price (@ 10 euros) but it was a bit of a disaster because the whole of the city appeared to have descended to take advantage of the half-price offer and the queuing for 3 hours, yes 3, in the sunshine to get in was almost too much. Spectacular once inside but it seems that the management should sort out their pricing to encourage more visitors during the week when prices are too high. Valencia is broke as a consequence of overspending on spectacular projects such as this one. It is already showing signs of wear which will require yet further expenditure on maintenance so it seems obvious that the public must not be priced out of visiting and more should be done through competitive and fair money generation both to improve revenue streams whilst incentivising visitor numbers in a fair and consistent way throughout the City of Arts and Sciences.

Spectacular once inside but it seems that the management should sort out their pricing to encourage more visitors during the week when prices are too high. Valencia is broke as a consequence of overspending on spectacular projects such as this one. quote: Nice place to walk and about
reviewnospace: One thing I like is the massive avant-garde architecture. Amazing and beautiful. It will take whole day to walk around here.
titleopinion: Nice place to walk and about. One thing I like is the massive avant-garde architecture. Amazing and beautiful. It will take whole day to walk around here.

reviewnospace:
This amazing complex is the reason I visited Valencia (but I stayed for much more). This extra-ordinary place looks like it was developed for a science fiction set.
The principle building is the science museum and was quite amazing. Filled with exceptional exhibits, many of them hands-on, the museum is breathtaking in size and scope. You are left alone by attendants and are free to enjoy the many different exhibitions. The entry fee is affordable and good value.
The remainder of the complex includes theatres, gardens, ponds and walkways - each exceptional in its own way.
I was disappointed that it was not illuminated at night - as is seen on the postcards.
titleopinion:
Beamed straight from Star Trek. This amazing complex is the reason I visited Valencia (but I stayed for much more). This extra-ordinary place looks like it was developed for a science fiction set.
The principle building is the science museum and was quite amazing. Filled with exceptional exhibits, many of them hands-on, the museum is breathtaking in size and scope. You are left alone by attendants and are free to enjoy the many different exhibitions. The entry fee is affordable and good value.
The remainder of the complex includes theatres, gardens, ponds and walkways - each exceptional in its own way.
I was disappointed that it was not illuminated at night - as is seen on the postcards.

reviewnospace:
These buildings are very nice to look at, but the enormous debts that have been taken to build them will costs the taxpayers lots of money for the next 100 years (perhaps longer). Do these buildings even generate enough money to pay the interest on those loans? What happens when interest rates eventually rise?

Meanwhile, we tourists can admire the buildings.

quote: Science museum would put you off science for life
reviewnospace: Very interesting looking building. The science museum shows no imagination at all. Boring exhibits. Science is about sparking imagination. Everything is so static. There's even a module on Valencia winning the European cup throughout the decades (shows how few ideas they have). I'm a scientist (doctor) and I was saddened to think that kids who visited would be put off for life.

I'm a scientist (doctor) and I was saddened to think that kids who visited would be put off for life.

reviewnospace: Unique geometric forms, futuristic ...City of the Arts and Sciences is a wonderful place where you can enjoy a variety of activities, ranging from Oceanográfic with wonderful water world, the beautiful Principe Felipe Science Museum and the Palau de les Arts Reina Sofia.For all tickets should be around 40 euros. If you go to Valencia at the end of October, you can watch great tennis matches in the Agora. Amazing place.

reviewnospace: I thoroughly enjoyed this entire area! We took a tour of the opera house and then went to the oceanographic right afterwards, and it was all close by. The architecture is really great and all of the blue leads to some great photographs. If its warm enough, they have those bubbles that people can get it and crawl around on top of the water, so that's great for children. They have these neat little Horchata booths and the science museum is wonderful.

quote: Takes you back and forth in time
reviewnospace:
Immediately you enter the area of the science museum, you are transported to a sci-fi world of architectural wonder. The buildings have many hidden gems including the pearly white mosaic tiles covering much of the surface, reflecting the sun in all angles and at the same time capturing Valencia’s traditional tiles and ist past. This is like past meeting present and future. The turquoise water is another effect that is well thought out. There are many other visual effects built into this huge work of art. Just walking around these buildings can make it feel you are in a spaceship. It reminded me of the resurrection ship in Battlestar Galactica. This bit is for free and you could easily just walk around there and not pay a penny.

The staff there are extremely friendly. They are always looking to help. We pushed our bikes through and they pointed us in the right direction for parking them. Many friendly remarks from the staff throughout. Seems they were very happy working there.

From the attractions you pay for, I only visited the Science Museum. There were so many interactive things there to make you see things from a science perspective. Other things are highlighted which make you see things in a new light. I would have liked to have had more time to visit the other attractions there.
titleopinion:

reviewnospace: Amazing architecture for an amusing museum, aquarium and Imax movie theater. I had a great time, i loved the aquarium even i think that it could be better both for the tourists and animals. The dolphins show was lovely anyways. One must visit the City of the Arts and Sciences if in Valencia. It doesn't cost too much either. Spent a lovely day.

reviewnospace: Most doors closed, areas taped off and took 30 minutes to find a toilet. Public toilets when found were locked.Lots of dust and dirt in the water filled areas. The area needs attention and information guides to help orientate tourists.

reviewnospace: Worth a visit, particularly if combined with a stroll through the wonderful Turia park. Striking architecture. Opera and Science Museum are overpriced. Aquarium (Oceanografic), although expensive, better justifies the cost and is by far the best attraction.

reviewnospace: Overwhelming in architectural design, too much of the same in a relatively small area. A pity as each building on its own would have raised a far greater impact. Apparently the bureaucrats were of the idea that bigger and many is more beautiful, but that isn’t the way it worked out to my opinion. Seriously worth the effort and trip to view and walk around, but most likely not a place to return, when to travel a large distance.

reviewnospace: This is a great site and it will stay in my memory for ever. Negative thing is that it is one of many the Spanish cities trying to copy the Bilbao effect. They try to attract tourists with great and extremely expensive designs but do not realy know what to do with it. Imax, oceanographics, science museums are things you can visit in other cities also at cheaper prices. I fact you walk around without a purpose in the complex. But I wish it a great future.

We had tickets to the Oceanographic which had many great features. It was a Sunday and midday when we got it with MANY other Valencian families. We drew pleasure from the community atmosphere. The similarity between schools of fish in tanks and the multitudes moving through was vivid. I suspect that high summer in those open spaces between the buildings would be fiercely bright and hot.

titleopinion: Stunning architecture.... I went to visit the museum, the building is amazing- clean and not too crowded. However,the down side was the green area around it, the park for running, many dogs' poops, really annoying to run fearing you might step into one of the smelly piles. There are nice bicycle tracks- brightly lit at night :)

reviewnospace: An interesting area full of extraordinary buildings with modern design. We never entered any of the buildings, but were content to just stroll around the whole area. We found it very relaxing and a very pretty place worth a few photos.
titleopinion: A nice stroll. An interesting area full of extraordinary buildings with modern design. We never entered any of the buildings, but were content to just stroll around the whole area. We found it very relaxing and a very pretty place worth a few photos.

reviewnospace:
As many other reviewers say, the buildings are stunning, bringing to mind the Guggenheim in Bilbao. However, for me, whereas the magic continues on entering the Guggenheim, the science museum disappoints. Quite a few of the exhibits were closed. Of those that were open, the maintenance was poor and things failed to work the way they should. Probably the biggest let down was an exhibit designed to interest kids in space. Instead of capitalising on natural curiosity and using clear presentation, it used an R2D2 kind of robot with flashing lights and a series of irrelevant cartoons, which totally detracted from the learning experience.
Generally, it was difficult to follow clear themes in this place. I cannot really recommend it.
titleopinion:

Generally, it was difficult to follow clear themes in this place. I cannot really recommend it.

reviewnospace: The City of Arts and Science is one of the top attractions. The modern architecture is stunning and the setting fantastic. Excellent family attraction but even if you do not go inside the buildings it is worth a visit. Good cafe in the Science museum open to all even if you do not visit the museum.

reviewnospace:
There really is nowhere quite like the Ciudad de las Artes y las Ciencias! For an enjoyable and scenic walk to the centre, I would thoroughly recommend taking a walk from the glittery Alameda metro stop and meandering along the former river bed which now forms the Jardin del Turia.

As you approach, you will glimpse the futuristic buildings and with every step taking you closer, you will be able to appreciate the intricate three-dimensional structures providing different and ever-changing vistas.

As for City of the Arts and Sciences itself, you will need at least a full day to fully appreciate and explore everything on offer. Be sure to allow at least a good half a day for the aquarium, for which I have written a separate review.

The science museum is very informative and truly interactive which really does help to bring the science behind virtually everything you can contemplate to life! My biggest regret was that I missed the Electric Theatre show which a friend had thoroughly recommended. Whilst I was there, the last show of the day was in full flow and judging from what I could hear standing outside the theatre, it sounded fascinating (and just a tad frightening!), so will definitely feature on my list of things to do next time I'm here.

I also know that there is an IMAX theatre here (Hemisfèric) as well as a beautiful-looking walkway known as the Umbracle.

If you are in Valencia then you definitely should visit as I doubt you'd have ever seen buildings quite like this and the exhibitions themselves are great. Furthermore, don't try and rush it like we did as you will regret not taking the time to see everything (and may have to go back a second time round like me!)

reviewnospace:
If you can, then approach this complex along the paths of Turia Gardens. Make sure you have plenty of shots left in your camera because the buildings are stunning. If you are a tourist then the appropriate time Valencia Tourist Card reduces the admission fees and if you are a Senior you pay even less.

The star of the show is probably Oceanography with the inhabitants of many different seas of the world able to be viewed from under water. We spent 5 hours here. The restaurants are expensive!

The arts and science building is very interesting with many experiments for you to try.

All explanations are also in English.

It will make your visit more rewarding if you read up on the exhibits beforehand.

quote: Impressive buildings and great place to walk around
reviewnospace: The modern buildings in the middle of the old riverbed are impressive in their own right and contrast with the old city center. It's a great place to take a walk through even if you don't get a chance to go into any of the buildings.
titleopinion: Impressive buildings and great place to walk around. The modern buildings in the middle of the old riverbed are impressive in their own right and contrast with the old city center. reviewnospace:
I’ve visited the City of Arts and Sciences on each of three separate visits to Valencia and still don’t know quite what to make of it.

I think the best way to get to the City is to approach it along the cool green spaces of the Jardin del Turia. As you walk through the trees, under the crypt like bridges, past the elegant Palau de la Musica with its tinkling fountains and round the surreal Parque Infantil Gulliver, the great architectural forms of the City, so unlike historic Valencia, entice you mirage-like onwards.

When you get there the architecture is truly extraordinary, bold shapes that recall animals and ships, contrasts of light and shade, cool rippling water and brittle glazed surfaces. It’s walkways and terraces are a pedestrian friendly continuation of the Jardin. The car parking is cleverly hidden under the open conservatory called L’Umbracle. It’s a magnet for architects and urban designers, who cluster in groups discussing its finer points.

In the other hand this is grand trophy architecture, a monument to political pride and architectural ambition. The individual can feel overwhelmed; and toilets and places to eat seem few and far between (contrast this with the services in the Parque Oceanographico). And I’ve still yet to get into the Palau de las Artes simply to have look at what lies under the extraordinary exterior – tapes and chains and men in uniform give a very clear massage (contrast this with the openness of the Palau de le Musica).

So,it engenders mixed emotions in me. Does the mirage prove to be just that? Maybe. But you have to make up your own mind – as something you should definitely see during a visit to Valencia the City of Arts and Sciences merits an ‘excellent’.

reviewnospace: The architectures of the Imax, Science museum and Sea Aquarium are amazing with surrounding water and landscape - it feels like being transported to another city! The science museum fee is €8 and extra €2.05 for Nasa flight stimulation session. It took us 3hrs to look at the museum with some interesting activities you can do. The second level was not that interesting to us. Not all information is available in English for the climate change. Strangely, there is a big section on football. Just wondering what it has to do with science. The flight stimulation session was ok for the price you pay. It feels like you have taken off the ground indeed.

reviewnospace: The city of Arts and Sciences is built to marvellously that you tend to forget which century you are in - I felt it was the 23rd! The architectural creativity and the subsequent maintenance is second to none even in the modern times. Not only did I spend atleast an hour just clicking photographs from outside the building, I was also quite impressed by what was in store inside. Barring a couple of sections, most of the items/concepts/simulators, etc. are definitely worth a visit. There could be more to it no doubt but I am writing this review 5 months after my visit and I can still remember enough of it to praise it. This place really captures your imagination.

quote: Worth a visit but could be more to it
reviewnospace: Another place I'd like to give a 3.5 = Good rating, but no option for that so I'll be kind and say 4. Lots of interesting displays and interactive activities, including a mind-wrestling machine and tests of strength. Explanations given in English are quite detailed. I liked the health checks disguised as activities - we tested our blood pressure, pulse rate, body fat index, & balance among other things and it was fun. The dissatisfaction was partly that there seemed quite a lot of empty space where there could have been more exhibits - maybe that is to come? And that there didn't seem to be a clear plan to enable you to go round all the things which were there - all seemed a bit randomly placed. All the same, a good couple of hours for all ages. And I'm glad my blood pressure's normal!

Definitely worth a visit even if you don't go into the buildings. The whole area is beautifully landscaped and the architecture is innovative and simply stunning in scale and ambition. As awe inspiring as any building can be. An art exhibition is outside and is worth a look (free). An expensive white elephant perhaps but a must-see if you're visiting Valencia.
Why no cafes or facilities for visitors to the area?
Expensive entry tickets and really the architecture is the attraction here.

quote: Spectacular,its free!! Wish I had time to go back at night!!
reviewnospace: Having sern the architecture on a tv advert we just had to visit the City of Arts and Sciences. We walked from the city centre along the riverbed park, its worth the walk. Its like something out of a Science Fiction comic when I was a kid. Exactly how I imagined the future 40 or more years ago. Striking,spectacular and very very clever architecture. There is loads to do there but we just walked round for 3 hours,open mouthed, taking pictures. Didn't spend a single euro and still enjoyed every second there. My only regret was not having time to go back at night to see it all lit up, at one point the buildings reflected in the water make a giant fish..... you have to be there... really please go !!!! Fantastic and free if you want it to be .

quote: A bold investment in the future...
reviewnospace: The stunningly modernist architecture--such a contrast with the nearby old city--is just the beginning: each of the Ciudad's installations has fascinating stuff on the inside. With its explanations in both Spanish and English,the Science museum's interactive section is a delight for children and adults alike. The Oceanográfic has a great underground restaurant surrounded by an aquarium, in a addition to its many beautifully presented displays. And I loved "Mystery of the Nile" at the Hemisfèric. A whole day for everything was not enough--we came back for a second visit.

reviewnospace:
Just as we sighted our hotel we also sighted the city of Valencia's gift to the modern architectural world - Santiago Calatrava. In the last few decades his work has become one of the world's most recognized and here it was right across the road from where we were staying. He designed the World Trade Center's subway station in NY and we've been in love with him since.

We had no plans to sightsee in Valencia, just stop, sleep and get a fresh start for Barcelona. When we saw the structures across the road we just had to go and look at everything up close. Each structure is more amazing than the previous one. Pure constructive art.
titleopinion:
Calatrava's Gift to the World. Just as we sighted our hotel we also sighted the city of Valencia's gift to the modern architectural world - Santiago Calatrava. In the last few decades his work has become one of the world's most recognized and here it was right across the road from where we were staying. He designed the World Trade Center's subway station in NY and we've been in love with him since.

We had no plans to sightsee in Valencia, just stop, sleep and get a fresh start for Barcelona. When we saw the structures across the road we just had to go and look at everything up close. Each structure is more amazing than the previous one. Pure constructive art.

quote: Very enjoyable, even for grown ups!
reviewnospace: We had a great time - the science museum is very interactive so be prepared to spend a lot of time there - we spent 2 hours measuring our water content, how much electricity we generate and the like. Also, there is parking outside the complex, for free. We bought a combined ticket for the Science Museum and Oceanographic, it was about 30 euros each, but was well worth it, we did not spend any time in queues!

We bought a combined ticket for the Science Museum and Oceanographic, it was about 30 euros each, but was well worth it, we did not spend any time in queues!

reviewnospace: The buildings themselves are works of art. We visited after seeing the aquarium. There's a packaged deal you can get where you buy tickets for both and save some money. The exhibits are science based, but tend to be much more artistic and creative than typical "science museums". Most of the exhibits are highly interactive. This place is good for all ages; it isn't just the type of place you take your kids. Only downside from the perspective of a tourist is that not all exhibits have English translations, although most did. Make sure to walk to/from here through the riverbed park (Antiguo Cauce del Rio Turia).
titleopinion: Really a cool facility. The buildings themselves are works of art. We visited after seeing the aquarium. Most of the exhibits are highly interactive. This place is good for all ages; it isn't just the type of place you take your kids. Only downside from the perspective of a tourist is that not all exhibits have English translations, although most did. Make sure to walk to/from here through the riverbed park (Antiguo Cauce del Rio Turia).

quote: Best Science Museum I have ever been to
reviewnospace:
Although I wasn't a fan of the city of Valencia...I LOVED the science museum.
The City of Arts and Sciences is the area you have probably seen pictured to represent Valencia (very architectural and cool). We went to the Science museum, which on top of being so cheap (around 6 euros for students with ID) was SO fun. I couldn't count the amount of 20 something year olds like us running around this museum doing the experiments. Could've happily spent the whole day here...

quote: Simply outstanding design and a beautiful and tranquil part of the city
reviewnospace: So cool and peaceful here, the design makes you feel you are in a completely different place, rather than in the heart of a bustling old city. Beautiful.
titleopinion: Simply outstanding design and a beautiful and tranquil part of the city. So cool and peaceful here, the design makes you feel you are in a completely different place, rather than in the heart of a bustling old city. Beautiful.

reviewnospace:
After reading most people's reviews of the science museum my partner and I nearly didn't bother going but I'm SO pleased we did. We spent four hours going through all four floors of the museum but the time flew by!

If you want to find out about the history of science, this isn't the place for you. If you want to do hands-on, fun experiments with short and sweet explanations about the science it relates to, then this place is great.
We loved it and found that all the adults around us were having just as much fun as we were. Really good value too considering how long we spent there.

reviewnospace: I was looking forward to visiting the city of arts and sciences but it looks far more impressive from the outside than on the inside. The science museum is disappointing - half the exhibits didn't work which rather defeated the object of an interactive museum. The Hemisferic film show was excellent though - we saw the Mystery of the Nile and it was very interesting and the film experience was good too. We did both get headphones that didn't work to start with but girls came round to check and changed them - they do seem to have problems with them as they were changing a lot of them. This, and wandering around the outside of the buildings was the best bit of the day. We did also enjoy the aquarium - nothing really new compared to similar ones in other cities but still a good day out looking at the various exhibits.

quote: incredible ensemble from the air, iconic and humane from up close
reviewnospace:
We had our first glimpse of the incredible ensemble of architecture from the air upon our approach to Valencia’s modern airport – and although we’d read about the Ciudad de las Artes y las Ciencias, we weren’t prepared for its vastness neither above nor when we arrived and had the chance to approach the complex by bus and by foot.

Each building taken alone would be an eye-catcher, taken together the effect is almost surreal but never inhumane perhaps due to the green spaces, the fountains and pools, and the somehow playful sense of the architecture, which no matter how huge is never overpowering. Maybe the effect is also due to its location in the dried river bed of the Turia – the magical sunken garden of Valencia that makes the city one of the most beautiful we’ve traveled to.

We were perhaps a bit disappointed to discover that the beautiful blue shell-shaped building between the Science Museum and the Aquarium complex was conceived as a public gathering place but not as a permanently open building as its name Ágora indicates. Upon a return trip to Valencia, we’ll definitely check the calendar for the next concert or sporting event at the Ágora if only to be able to go inside.

Even the garage isn’t simply a place to park your car inside but has a tree-lined avenue for pedestrians on top with open air art gallery, the necessary air shafts disguised as plump friendly alien figures in blue-tiled mosaic outfits.

We spent a wonderful day at the Oceanogràfic, saw a movie at the Hemisfèric, and marveled at the exhibits at the Science Musuem, and upon a return trip we’ll be revisiting all these attractions as well as getting tickets for a concert or opera at the Palau des les Arts.

After our return home we began to read up about the controversies surrounding the immense costs of the complex and about the rampant corruption within the Valencian provincial government. We can understand the rage some feel at the huge expenditures in light of cutbacks in all areas now but hope that in the long run this unique ensemble will prove to have been a wise investment in making Valencia very special indeed.

reviewnospace:
We visited Valencia for one week in august 2013. One of the main attractions in this city was, of course, City of Arts and Sciences. The complex itself is amazing. White "cosmic" buildings and blue water are making you feel like on the other planet. We bought ticket for all attractions. First, we visited the Science Museum. We, two adults, did not find it very interesting, cause we have the almost the same museum at our town. But for children, it might be interesting. The only problem is, that all the shows there are in Spanish, so we were a bit upset.
After we went to Oceanographic. I did not see dolphin show before, so I was pretty satisfied with it and oceanarium as well, until we got to the room, where were two white whales. I could not stop crying. They look at you as they are human. It was so painful to watch them through that glass and think, that they have to live all their long life in this aquarium, which I think is still too small for these big beautiful creatures. I think that orginisers made this room for relaxation, with music playing and benches, but for me it was not the best place to visit.
The last place we visited was Hemisferic. We bought tickets for planetarium show. That was disappointing. It was in Spanish and nothing interesting. Just pics of the sky and stars. Maybe the lecture was interesting, but it was not translatied.
We took some great pic at night, when there are lights everywhere.
My conclusion is, that the architecture is great and you can view it for free. It might be interesting for children to visit Science Museum and it is great for all to see the Oceanographic, but do not go to the room with white wales, if you are found of nature and love wild animals.
After all, we were satisfied.

reviewnospace: I bought a ticket that allowed me entrance into the Science Museum and the Oceanographic. The Science Museum is great if you're travelling with children but don't waste your time or money if you're visiting with adults. The best thing about the Museum is the photo you get from outside.

The Science Museum is great if you're travelling with children but don't waste your time or money if you're visiting with adults. The best thing about the Museum is the photo you get from outside.

reviewnospace: This is must do on your trip to Valencia - I have no idea how on earth they came up with these structures but they are fantastic. Well worth a walk around, and while you are there, visit the Oceanografic!
titleopinion: Awesome architecture. This is must do on your trip to Valencia - I have no idea how on earth they came up with these structures but they are fantastic. Well worth a walk around, and while you are there, visit the Oceanografic!

reviewnospace: Stay outside and marvel at the architecture, but don't waste your money to go inside. I really hope someone in Valencia wakes up and starts 'exploiting' this whole area properly - there's fabulous potential, but it's already looking more like a white elephant(s).

quote: lovely place for families travelling with children
reviewnospace: We spent two entire days visiting this place. We spent one day at the Science Museum and the second one at the Oceanographic. Our children aged 4, 6 and 8 loved them both. We couldn't drag them away. Both attractions are spread over larger areas. There is room to run around and exprience them well. The bars/restaurants are rather on the expensive side so we recommend you take a packed lunch as well as lots to drink.

reviewnospace: Its a great place to visit - definitely my number one spot! The buildings themselves and architecture is impressive. We got a ticket to see the planetarium, the aquarium and science museum - although expensive at 32 euros each it was certainly worth it and you get a full days worth of entertainment from it
titleopinion: MUST SEE!. Its a great place to visit - definitely my number one spot! The buildings themselves and architecture is impressive. We got a ticket to see the planetarium, the aquarium and science museum - although expensive at 32 euros each it was certainly worth it and you get a full days worth of entertainment from it

quote: Terrific architecture but let down by the exhibits
reviewnospace: The whole of this area is quite something, with great architectural views that are worth looking at from all sides, so do walk around the whole place. The science area itself on 3 floors is very large. Although there were some hands on exhibits, in general the features were fairly dry with large and overdone wordy sections. Some areas were closed e.g. a gravity area sounded exciting, but not a chance to see it. They could have enhanced the whole placed with a few mathematical ideas as you get in the UK, but maybe that wasn't the intention. There were hardly any actual pieces of equipment that I could see- one aeroplane ! The top floor hasd a small exhibition of bikes - penny farthings etc but it looked a sorry sight as the rest of that vast area was full of nothing at all. There is a shop but actually nothing educational for sale, except a few books. Pretty pencils etc. are OK, but nothing more exciting. A real wasted opportunity throughout this uninspiring place. A terrible shame as it must have cost a fortune to build.

We also had a pitcher of sangria in the bar of the Opera building. Very nice...We didn't go in for any of the attractions, but if you are interested in a science centre, or in watching IMAX movies, this is the place for you.

quote: interesting and suitable for families and children

reviewnospace:
I really loved Valencia and found it a great city but i really would not recommend going to visit the Science museum, there are plenty of more simulating and more enjoyable things to do around the city.
The architecture is great but when you get inside, the content of the museum does not do it justice. It is really just empty, there are about 4 exhibits that have little to no scientific content and with no flow of information, the other patrons run around touching everything with no regard to the idea behind it, interactive equipment is broken. Its great for children but if your actually interested in science or museums definitely give it a miss.

reviewnospace: An architecture is marvellous, I've seen nothing of the kind. Gardens on the terraces create a powerful sensation of scale. In the Science Museums you can have a great fun with exhibits equipped as if for practical science lessons in school.

reviewnospace: We did the Valencia City Tour, and fell in love with Valencia. The park that was once the Turia River is spectacular. The "new" Valencia in the City of Arts/Sciences feature architecture the mind can't even imagine. We were too early to go inside the buildings but just being on the grounds and knowing that such wonders exist are memories that will last a lifetime.

reviewnospace: We spent two days visiting this magnificent place and this is something our family will remember for the rest of our lives. It is beautiful, well-organized, educational, fun and awesome!

quote: Amazing Architecture and Great Science Museum
reviewnospace:
The architecture of the arts and science museum is amazing and worth a visit in itself!

This was my second visit (first was to the aquarium which I also highly recommend) and we decided to visit the science museum only. This cost about €8 for an adult which was very reasonable. They also offer a student discount about €6.

It has 3 levels full of all different science information including Memory, chromosomes, nature, energy and many more. What was great is that all stages were interactive so you didn't feel you were only reading information. It had a childrens play area in the design of a builders set.

Surprisingly on one of the levels they had a Marvel section with statues of all the marvel superheroes and kids could get a free face paint.

They also had a Valencia FCC museum with all memorabilia.

We spent about 3 hours in this place and had a great time.

We didn't eat here but the cafeteria on the ground floor looked reasonable.

Would highly recommend for both adults and children.

quote: You won't see this anywhere else in the world!!
reviewnospace: Valencia is such a beautiful city filled with such history. Among all that history is a modern area called the City of Arts and Sciences. You will see modern buildings that you will not see anywhere else in the world. Located in the old river bed, it is not hard to find. Inside these buildings (we did not have the time to go in but wish we did) were the Oceanografic (the aquarium), Hemisferic (the IMAX cinema) and the Science Museums. Do not go to Valencia and miss out on the City of Arts and Sciences.

quote: Exhausting but well worth a visit
reviewnospace:
We caught the number 19 bus from the cruise terminal and arrived at opening time (1000) buying tickets for the aquarium and science centre. Spent 3 hours inside the 10 different zones which had english as well as spanish information and got close to every type of marine life including sharks, Spent the afternoon in the science building which has three floors that really need a few days rather the the two hours we had before leaving to catch the cruise ship. All the exhibits were interactive and good fun as well as educational and our only disappointment was not seeing the "electric show" which needed timed tickets. We should have booked on arrival to the complex and could have watched the 2pm show.
The site is a huge architectural complex of about six massive buildings set in huge gardens and artificial lakes that took us 20 mins to walk from end to end and we both felt tired at the end of the visit trying to cram too much into six hours.

Definitely worth a walk around the area. We did not visit inside, so I would not be able to comment on this, although I have read several people were disappointed about the interiors.

I can only speak for the outside, which is fantastic and I certainly recommend a visit when it is sunny. I am so pleased the city of Valencia approved this futuristic construction. This is truly what I understand as being Spanish modern forward thinking architecture.

titleopinion: Modern Classics. Surreal modern architectures in a sea of blue tiles & white blocks. They even got polices on Segways patroling the area to stop people jumping into the pools. Watch out!

reviewnospace:
I give the Valencians 10 out of 10 for this incredible piece of architecture. It's as if a beautiful alien spaceship landed in the middle of the old river bed. The buildings really do take your breath away. If you're in Valencia you must must must go and see it, even if you don't go into any of the paid attractions.

We bought a ticket which gave us entry to Oceanografic (the aquarium), Hemisferic (the IMAX cinema) and the Science Museum.

The aquarium was brilliant, very well designed with lots of it being underground in (mainly) cool air conditioned areas. Our favourite bit was watching the walruses splash about in their tank. They have several places to eat, we had a nice and reasonably-priced snack/drink in one whose name I don't remember, except it was near the entrance to the sharks and had a wooden balcony all round!

The science museum was good but not amazing. The building it was in, on the other hand, was just breathtaking. I got the impression they were given this building and told to fill it with "science museum stuff" and in places it looks like they put something there just to fill the space - of which there is a LOT. Nonetheless, some very good exhibits in there too and lots of interactive things. Worth a visit, especially to gawp at the building from the inside.

The Hemisferic cinema was interesting, the movie was nothing to write home about but it was a different experience for us and only a tiny extra cost on the ticket.

One great aspect of this complex is that they have beautifully landscaped grounds all around - some gardens but mainly huge expanses of shallow water which somehow sit perfectly with the awesome architecture around you. So even if you haven't a euro to your name, you can go there and spend an hour or two walking around this stunning place and soaking up the wonderful sights. Valencians must be very proud of this place.

If I didn't already make it clear - YOU MUST VISIT HERE!!! Over & out :-)

reviewnospace:
We went to the Oceanografic / Hemispheric and the Science centre while in Valencia. The buildings alone are magnificent, they should be used in some science fiction film to promote the city. The Oceanografic is brilliant particularly for children. The Beluga Whales are beautiful and make an amazing noise. Dolpin show is great also and good atmosphere.

You need to do this in 2 days. The price I found was very expensive as it cost over 130 euros for a family of 5, however I can only imagine what it costs to run this operation. If you are in Valencia you have to see it though. (I would recommend anyone going to the Oceanografic to bring a packed lunch as buffet restaurant again is very expensive and the food isn't great. As it's so big you wont be popping out to get lunch and come back-bottle of coke in the vending machines €2.70)

If you are on a tight budget and can't afford it, I would still recommend you go and see the buildings. Nice walk to it if you go through the Turia Park.

quote: Beautiful place but expositions are not so impressive

We went first to the sciences museum and it was interesting but many activities aren't explained in english and some weren't working. We preferred the science museum in Barcelona. The real disappointment was the "3D" cinema. We went to see a movie called "3D Flames" so we were expecting something impressive but it turned out it was only a simple documentary about the pyro festival in valencia ... The spheric screen wasn't really used because the picture was a simple square. So compared to "La Géode" in the city of science of Paris, it was really disappointing but maybe we picked the wrong movie... We didn't go to the aquarium so i can't tell about this one.

reviewnospace:
It was spectacularly designed and is worth having the outside structure explained to you by a guide. It is basically shaped like a whale is very pretty. The IMAX is very special and at €8 affordable. The screen is in the whale's eye and it stretches up over your head, a great cinema-going experience.
The Sciences building €8 had a great flight stimulator €2 and science of superheroes exhibit worth seeing. Should be noted that one and a half floors are only in Spanish with no English translation. The workshops are only in Spanish too. I think the price here could be better spent at the IMAX, though this would provide entertainment for longer.
The aquarium €20 is special for the dolphin show and walking under the tunnel of sharks. It's the biggest in Europe, though as with most aquariums, it's been done before. Note that the most shows are in Spanish, an Translated audio guide might be worthwhile.
Get in early to see when English speaking shows are on because there isn't many.
You can buy combination tickets

reviewnospace: The City of Arts and Sciences is interesting, unique and worth a walk around. If you have children/young adults with you, the attractions are particularly worth the visit. The architecture is stunning and futuristic and your friends won’t believe your photos. There are 3 major attractions other than just the buildings themselves: the aquarium (Oceanografic, I lump this in with the City of Arts and Sciences although it is listed in TripAdvisor separately), science museum, and IMAX. If you are interested in them, there is combination ticket that will get you into all three. And if you are going to do the hop on-hop off bus as well, you can get an all-inclusive ticket that includes the bus and the 3 attractions. And there is a senior discount if you qualify.

quote: Sci Fi Fantasy architecture. Beam over!

quote: Enjoy the architecture rather than the exhibits
reviewnospace: I'm only referring to the science museum out of the whole complex; this was a return visit and I have to say Calatrava's architecture is still absolutely amazing and unique. What disappointed was the exhibition itself which is principally interactive. Whilst I loved it the first time, shortly after it had opened, I felt let down on this visit, it felt like the curators had lost their way. The sports science section which I remembered as being really exciting was now mostly dedicated to the history of Valencia FC, with an exhibition of their team strip, cups and footballs over the years; I fail to see a connection with science there. Around 50% of the exhibits I tried just didn't work or had a sign on saying out of action. I would not waste my money again on the exhibition but I would definitely recommend a visit to marvel at the architecture.
